loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For rabbit keeping.

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Mrs. SaroE. Eam and her husband, Mr. Chhum Uk, live in a small village along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have one son and one daughter. The son attends school and the daughter is a garment factory worker. 

SaroE. sells porridge in front of the garment factory. Her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. The couple asked for a Kiva loan once before. Now SaroE. is requesting another loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive work.

loans.name: Symon

texts.en:
Symon is the chairman of Kauma Self Help Group in Murang'a town, Central Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for over 30 years and has employed two farmhands. His mixed farm produces coffee, maize, and milk which he sells both to the local market and to Kenya Cooperative creameries respectively. He also depends on his pension pay to meet the needs of his family.

Symon has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 63,600 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will improve his income and enable him to pay school fees for his daughter in college and reduce his dependency on others. His primary challenges have been poor marketing and transportation problems due to seasonal roads. Despite the challenges, he hopes to acquire six more high yielding dairy cows in the future.

Symon is 57 years old. He is married with four children who are all adults. His youngest daughter is attending school. He says that the future is bright since farmers can access loan facilities with ease and thus are able to grow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mr. Son Khin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people living in Angk Krasang village in Takeo province have selected Mr. Son K. their village bank president.

Mr. Son K. and his wife, Mrs. Ry Soem, are farmers. They own one hectare of land where they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. But his field is infertile soil and he did not have enough money to fix it. To improve his production, Mr. Son K. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline.

Mr. Son K. was born in 1950 and is a vice village chief. He is a father of three children; one is a farmer and the others attend school and help their parents’ businesses.

The members of the village bank loan will each use their portion of the loan for varied ways.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Savun

texts.en: Mrs. Savun S. has three children: one son and two daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers and another one is still young. She also has an elderly mother living with her. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  Savun, who has been a lotus farmer for more than two years, is requesting a loan of $550 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to reduce her transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 43 years old and a married father of five children between the ages of 2½ and 14, four of whom are attending school. Elijah, who has a mixed farm in the town of Litein in Rift Valley Kenya, has been farming for the last nine years and employs two farmhands. His main products are milk, cabbage, beans and tea, all of which he sells to the local market. He depends on the income from his farming to provide for the basic needs of his family.

Elijah has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family, enable him to pay school fees for his children and provide for their basic needs. In five years' time, he hopes to expand his dairy farming by increasing his number of dairy cows, buying a piece of land upon which he will plant nappier grass, and purchasing other required farming machines.

His primary challenges are an inadequate market for milk, diseases, and insufficient dairy feeds.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en: Mr. Veasna Y. is single and lives with his mother and sisters and brothers on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  Veasna has been a wooden house builder for more than two years, working in his village and the nearby village. A recipient of a previous Kiva loan, he is now requesting another loan of $1,000 to organize his house by laying bricks and plastering the ceiling and the wall in order to visually enhance it.

loans.use: To lay brick and plaster the ceiling and the wall of his house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old, married, and has three children, ages 28, 19 and 15, one of whom attends school. Josephine has a mixed farm in Nkubu town, Eastern Kenya, where she has been in business for 20 years, employing one farmhand. Her main products are milk and broilers which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from her rental houses within her compound.

Josephine has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry project. She says that the additional income this loan will generate will enable her to expand even further and improve her family's living standards. Her biggest challenges are a lack of market for broilers, fluctuating and high feed prices, and shortages and delays of stock (chicks).

In the future, Josephine plans to start keeping layers to increase her income. She also plans to buy more dairy cows and even construct a greenhouse shed for planting tomatoes. She says that Juhudi should consider increasing the amount that a farmer can apply for with respect to their needs.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C. (pictured here with her loom) and her husband Mr. Sam-oeun Soy live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 2004 and have one young daughter.

Sopheap has been a silk weaver since she was 20 years old. Her husband works on a chicken farm. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Naftary

texts.en:
32 year old Naftary has been farming for the past six years in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya. He operates a mixed farm producing milk, maize and beans which he sells through Meru Central and at the local market. He is also employed at Mukune Cooperative Society. Naftary is married with two children, ages 5 and 18 months. His eldest child attends school.

Naftary has requested this loan of 67,600 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income generated from this loan will help in educating his children as well as improving their standard of living. The manure from the dairy cows will help improve soil fertility thus increasing his output.

His biggest challenges have been disease, price fluctuations, transportation problems and unfavourable weather conditions. He, however, hopes to expand his farming in the future by acquiring no less than six dairy cows. He comments that Juhudi loans have really helped him as a farmer because they have allowed him to expand and increase his production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia has been practising mixed farming for the past 13 years in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya. She has employed one farmhand. Her farm produces bananas and milk which she sells locally. She is also employed as a caretaker at a local school for the mentally handicapped.

She has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry project. She says that the income from this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her children and to build a decent house. She also plans to use the income to purchase a piece of land. She, however, faces the challenge of lack of a proper market for her products.

Anastasia is 36 years old. She is married with three children aged 5, 10 and 15. All the children attend school.

In the future, she intends to improve her farming by buying two dairy cows, upgrading her poultry farming and improving her banana farming. She is so happy because Juhudi has helped her to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Kimsreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsreng I. (who is in the photo with her loom), is 28 years old, has been married since 2009 and just had a young son. She lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Kimsreng has been a silk weaver for 13 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh City. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Rado

texts.en:
Mr. Rado L., is 35 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sreymom Sok, is 33 years old. They live in a small village along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1995 and five children: three sons and two daughters. Three of them are in school and the other two are still too young for school.  

Rado has been a mason since 2000, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He wants to buy construction materials to operate his business because he does not have enough materials.

Hence he is applying for a loan of $300 to make the purchases. 

Photo: Rado is not in the photo; instead his wife is in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has a mixed farm, which produces bananas, maize, beans, coffee and milk, which she sells through the coffee factory and at the local market. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 25 years in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya. She depends on the income from her farming to meet the basic needs of her family.

Rose recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings and has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase dairy goats. The extra income from this loan will go toward the education of her children and improve their living standards.

In the future, she hopes to acquire five more dairy cows and start a poultry project.

Rose is 53 years old. She is married with five children who are between the ages of 12 and 25. Two of the children attend school.

Rose is happy because Juhudi has helped her acquire assets unlike other institutions that don't care where their clients get money.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Mrs. Mach Les Village Bank Group

texts.en:
NineteE. people living in Kandal village in Takeo province have selected Mrs. Mach L. as village bank president.

Mrs. Mach L. owns a general store where she is able to earn a good profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Poeun Buch, is a construction worker and he is also a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to support his family.

Since her current business is going well, she wants to expand. To reach this goal, Mrs. Mach L. is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to sell and the rest of the loan she will use for her farming this year.

Mrs. Mach L. was born in 1979. She is a mother of three childrE.; two are in school and the youngest is four years old.

The members of the village bank loan will each use their portion of the loan for varied ways. All the members are shown in the picture but one member is blocked.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bunthea

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthea M. (in the photo), 27, is a driver. His wife, Mrs. Sokheng Phon, 27, is a garment-factory worker. They have been married since 2007 and just have a young son. Nowadays, the couple lives with their parents in a village along National Road Number Four about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

They want to live in a separate home, but they do not have money to build a house. Therefore, Bunthea is applying for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to make the buildings.

loans.use: To build a house to live in

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been operating his mixed farm in the town of Nkubu, eastern Kenya for the last two years. His main products are bananas and coffee, which he sells through the coffee factory and at the local market. He also earns income from his motorbike business and masonry business.

John has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to start a poultry project. He intends to purchase both layers and the local breed of poultry. He says that the extra income from this loan will enable him to take his children to better schools and to build a decent home. He faces the challenges of pests and diseases, poor prices for his products and insufficient water for farming.

John is 33 years old. He is a married father of two children, ages 3 and 5. One of the children attends school.

In the future, he hopes to start a hardware shop business and buy an extra motorbike. He is happy about Juhudi's fast processing of loans and training for clients.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 15 years and has employed one farmhand. He sells his eggs to a local shop. He also earns income from his pension and from the sale of bananas.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand his poultry farming. He says that this loan will help improve the family's lifestyle. His major challenges have been competition and a lack of sufficient capital to expand his business.

Peter is 60 years old. He is married and has been blessed with three children, who are all now adults. He is very optimistic that he will succeed in his poultry business.

He comments that Juhudi products have really improved unlike before.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farming

loans.name: Sroin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sroin K. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Nheb Eng, have been married since 1982 and have two children. They live in a small village across the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sroin and her husband are farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in the village. Besides farming, Mr. Nheb Eng is a fisherman as well. Sroin has had several Kiva loans; she is now asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a rice milling machine.

loans.use: To purchase a rice milling machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chan Sithy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan Sithy P., 23 years old, is married and has a child who is just two years old and not yet I. school. Her husband, Mr. Sopheak Sao, is a soldier while Chan Sithy sells groceries I. Sdau Kanlaeng village I. Kandal province. With both working, they are able to earn a small income to support the family.

Chan Sithy was selected to be the village bank president by its twenty-eight members. She will use her loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her grocery business and so increase the family’s income. The other members of this village bank will use their loans to support their different ventures.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to enlarge her grocery business

loans.name: Mrs. Savin Khit Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savin K. is the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Sok Phorn Kry, is a construction worker. She is a weaver at her home in Kandal village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Savin K. is the village’s bank president, selected by the other seventeen members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. Since Savin’s business is going well, she wants to expand, so she is applying for a loan to buy more silk. With the rest of the loan she will fix up her house.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old. He is married with 3 children aged 7 to 6 months. Two of the children attend school.

He has been farming for three years and has employed 2 casual labourers. His main products are eggs, which he sells to the local market. He also operates a motorbike and a kiosk which help supplement his income.

Joseph recently completed his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 51,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow and upgrade his poultry project. He says that this loan will assist him expand his farming, which will later improve his income and enable him pay school fees and provide food for his family.

In future, he would like to expand his farm to enable him do more dairy farming. He says diseases is a major problem that is costly to treat.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and upgrade his poultry farm.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya.  He has been farming for 2 years and has employed one farmhand.  His main products are eggs, which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from his business and from the sale of maize.

Peter has requested this loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry farming. He will use this loan to purchase more chickens to increase his stock. He will use the proceeds from this loan to send his child to a good school for a better foundation. His biggest challenge has been diseases and bad weather conditions.

Peter is 28 years old. He is married and has one child aged 4 who is attending school.

In the next five years, he wants to supply eggs to most learning institutions in the North-Rift region.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farming.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhorn Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhorn, 26, is the mother of a child who is four years old. She is a weaver while her husband, Mr. Kuntha Lang, is a construction worker. They both are farmers as well in Kandal village in Takeo province. They own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Sokhorn’s problem is that she does not have enough oxen to plow the land.

Sokhorn was selected as village bank president by the fourteen other members who will use their portions of the loan in various ways to support their families. To improve her production, Sokhorn is seeking a loan to buy an ox.

loans.use: To buy an ox for plowing

loans.name: Prutus

texts.en:
Prutus has been practicing mixed farming for twenty years in the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. His main products are maize, vegetables, tomatoes, beans and honey which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from his carpentry services and masonry services.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He is planning to buy an incalf cow since he will be able to earn income from the sale of milk and this will assist him in paying school fees for his children.

Protus is 45 years old. He is a married father of 8 children who are now between the ages of 4 and 22. Seven of the children are attending school.

His biggest challenge has been fluctuation in market prices and diseases that may cause losses. He, however, hopes to acquire at least 3 or 4 dairy cows that will enable him increase his productivity and income.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase firewood and baking tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: The

texts.en:
Mrs. The O. is a villager in Pnov village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chheng Duong, are farmers. They own two hectares of land where they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Mr Chheng Duong also owns a mill in the local village.

Her problem is that her rice field is far away from an irrigation system. To improve her production, Mrs. The O. is requesting a loan to buy a pump machine. With the rest of the loan she will buy fertilizer, pesticide, and hire a plow machine to plow her field.

Mrs. The O. was born in 1952. She is a mother of four children. Two attend school, one is a driver, and the other is a farmer. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To progress her husband's business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: expand his business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia S. is 57 years old. She is a busy entrepreneur and wishes to be able to help her children and provide a decent life. She makes and sells ice cream products and closely works with her husband as an ice cream vendor. She started the business 12 years ago to help her family meet basic needs as everything is very expensive. 

She will use the loan to buy more ingredients for her ice cream products, so she needs more capital to meet the demand in her customers in the local area where she sells her ice cream. She is pleased because, in the past, she has managed to utilize the loans to invest in her ventures.

With working capital Cecilia’s business will continue growing and she will be able to provide good service to her regular customer. Through the support of KIVA lenders, Cecilia hopes to see herself and her family, who currently live in poverty, soon change their quality of living, 

Cecilia’s long-term goal is to have an ice cream booth a few years from now so that she can give an opportunity of employment to others specially her extended relatives in their community. Cecilia hopes to maintain a long-term sustainable ice cream business. 

During her 12 years as a member of ASHI, Cecilia has shown very good performance with her group mates and center. Having this loan will enable her to finally achieve her dreams in life: to have a successful business, fund the educational needs of her children until they finish college, and have a better life and a happy family as well. Cecilia is very thankful to ASHI and KIVA for the continued support of her dreams.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her ice cream products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy materials for her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline L. is from the town of Banga. She is 50 years old. Evangeline is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 18 years.

Evangeline joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Evangeline from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy C. is from the town of Banga. She is 37 years old. Juvy is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Juvy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the second loan taken out by Juvy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Chrisantus

texts.en:
Chrisantus O. is a 50-year-old proprietor of a small restaurant and a fishmonger in Shanzu, Mombasa. He is married to Florence Akello and they are blessed with two children. 

This marks Chrisantus’ first time borrowing from KADET and he plans to increase his stock of fish and perform minor renovations in his restaurant.  He hopes to utilize the anticipated profits on restaurant expansion. 

O.’s dream is to own a large and spacious restaurant in future.

loans.use: to increase his stock of fish and perform minor renovations in his little  restaurant

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en:
Enelita S. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Enelita is married and has three children. To make a living, Enelita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Enelita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years. She says she wants to have a happy and harmonious family.

Enelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enelita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Enelita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Enelita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith R. is from the town of Banga. She is 53 years old. Judith is married. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Judith says she learned farming from her parents who were also both farmers. 

Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Judith is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This will be the second loan taken out by Judith from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, two boys and two girls, who all attend school. She is married to a businessman who supplies fruit to restaurant operators. She has been operating her business selling fresh water for five years, from home to her neighboring community. Previously she was selling soft drinks (juices). With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to open another stall and also renovate her existing stall and purchase a water pump.

 Fatuma hopes that in future she will be able to put up another tank to enable her to sell water in large quantity. She decided to work with Yehu so as to access loans and expand her business. She owns a home with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, open another stall, and renovate her old stall

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida R. is from the town of Banga. She is 62 years old. Zenaida is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Zenaida has been farming for more than 35 years now. 

Zenaida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Zenaida from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos S. is from the town of Banga. He is 47 years old. Carlos is single. To make a living, Carlos owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Carlos has been engaged in his business for over 15 years.

Carlos joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carlos has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Carlos is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase more cassettes for his shop

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani Y. is from the town of Banga. She is 34 years old. Lani is married and has 2 children, aged 10 and 5. To make a living, Lani owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lani has been engaged in her business for over 4 years.

Lani joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She says she also likes the Bible Reflection they have during meetings. Lani has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lani is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie Sta. R., 36 years of age is a resident of Cardona in the Province of Rizal, Philippines. Since she joined in 2007, Margie is one of the excellent and very active members of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI)-Rizal Central Branch, a Microfinance Institution (MFI) partner of KIVA in the Philippines. She is married to William Sta. R. Sr. and blessed with four children namely Ginalie 14 years old, Maristela 13, William Jr. 10, and Christian 6 years old.  All of them are studying. 

To meet the daily needs of the growing family, the couple work hand in hand through all means just to earn a living. Both are engaged in making & selling doormats and at the same time her husband maintains their small vegetable plantation. Margie wishes to increase their income so that she can start earning for her children’s future. She applies for a loan of Php 24,000 to fund their plan to expand their vegetable (Kangkong) plantation. It’s been three years since the couple got into this business and they have realized that profit is good because vegetables are in demand with Filipinos.  They want to purchase raw materials such as bamboo poles, straw and construct 5 rafts that they will use to gather said vegetable. They are expecting P 10,000 additional monthly profit from this business.  

The couple's dream is to be able to establish a good business and increase their profit so that they can renovate their house, provide for their daily needs and send their children to a nice school. Margie also wishes to help people in their community by hiring them during harvest time on their plantation and in production of doormats. 

She wishes that people from ASHI and KIVA partners will help them achieve this plan. The couple also wishes to convey their sincere gratitude to both institutions for providing capital to poor families without collateral and encouraging people like them to bring out their skills and potentials so as to be able to rise from poverty.

loans.use: raw materials for vegetable plantation and expenses for contruction of 5 rafts

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn C. is from the town of Banga. She is 53 years old. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in farming for over 20 years. She also grows piglets for fattening and sale. She hopes to acquire additional pigs to raise.

Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. She also plans to buy feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Victoria Womens Group C-Lugazi

texts.en:
T. Julius is a good natured, focused, God fearing and buoyant father of four school going children. He is also in his own right a go-getter and a suave businessman with a clear sense of business purpose. 

It is now four years since he has been at the helm of his retail shop business in Lugazi-Town. The past ten years, which have been chequered in terms of experiences, have made him understand the gruelling nature of doing business. The good side is that it has made him into the hard working man that he is.  Julius knows that without such a virtue, his chances of striking a workable medium in his business face long odds.  At present he makes 200,000 shillings monthly profit. With this loan he wants to buy more stock such as sugar, salt, beans, rice and plastics to resell. He reckons he will make more profits when he resells the aforementioned items.

loans.use: To purchase of  sugar, salt, beans, rice and plastics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita Y. is from the town of Banga. She is 44 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Clarita owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over four years. She recently started growing pigs for fattening. She says she wants to have another source of income.

Clarita joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the family income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda F. is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Amanda owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Amanda has been engaged in her business for over ten years. She wishes to be a good mother to her children and to have a healthy and happy family.

Amanda joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amanda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Amanda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm materials such as fertilizers. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Amanda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business and financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm materials such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase necessary things for his land.

loans.name: Victoria Womens Group A-Lugazi

texts.en: 30 year old K. Mary runs a general merchandise retail shop in Kiyindi-Lugazi. She took the reins 3 years ago after her husband asked her to start her own income generating project to help him provide for the family. She and her husband have 3 children. In a month, Mary who is a hard worker, as evidenced by all the effort she's put into her shop, makes 224,000 Ugandan shillings. With this loan she wants to buy more retail items for her shop. She wants to buy more bags of sugar, rice, salt, plastics, maize flour, beans and saucepans.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey Y. is a 40-year-old farmer from the town of Banga. He has been farming for over 15 years. He also grows chickens. Rey works hard to improve his business and make it grow. He is happy that he is able to help his family financially. He also dreams to have his own family someday and he is saving for it now.

Rey joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rey has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rey is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and feed for his chickens. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rey from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business and save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: purchasing fertilizer and chicken feed

loans.name: Chuluun-Erdene

texts.en:
Chuluun-Erdene J. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His 2 elder daughters attend a local kindergarten while the younger daughter stays at home. His wife B. Odonchimeg helps her husband's business.  

Chuluun-Erdene started a transportation business in 2006. At the beginning of his business, he used his brother's car to transport customers, after while he purchased own car. He also run an automobile repair center.  He is a modest and hard working person. Chuluun-Erdene is requesting a 600,000 Mongolian tugrug MNT loan to purchase an old car and sell it after it is repaired.

loans.use: purchasing, repairing, and reselling a used car

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita D. is from the town of Banga. She is 54 years old. Nonita is married and has 6 children. Most of her children are adults already but her younger ones still go to school. Nonita works her own rice farm. Nonita has been engaged in her business for over 26 years.

Nonita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Nonita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nonita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nonita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buying fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Marcely

texts.en:
Marcely D. is from the town of Banga. She is 30 years old. Marcely is married and has two children, aged seven and one. Marcely owns and operates a rice farm. Marcely has been engaged in her business for over nine years.

Marcely joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Marcely has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marcely is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marcely from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
One of the pioneer members of the Rizal Central Branch of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, is Amelita C.. She is 62 years of age and a resident of Cardona, in the province of Rizal, Philippines. She joined ASHI in 2003 and was recognized as one of the good model borrowers in the center. Her husband passed away a few years ago and left her with their two children: Melody, 36, and Mariyon, 34.

When Amelita joined ASHI seven years ago, cooking and selling native foods was her business. She is thankful that ASHI provided her with capital during those times. From her income she was able to send her children to school and have them finish their choice of degree.

Again, Amelita is applying for a loan of Php 25,000 to use as capital for her food-production business. She needs this amount to buy raw materials like rice, sugar, coconut, other ingredients, banana leaves, firewood and additional cooking tools. The demand for her delicious product has increased and that is why, even at her age, she keeps on cooking and producing native food products.

Amelita’s dream is for her business to prosper for her family and for her to enjoy life to the fullest. ASHI and Kiva are a great help in the realization of her dream and she conveys her thanks to both institutions.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, coconut, other ingredients, banana leaves, cooking utensils and firewood

loans.name: Victoria Women's Group B-1, Lugazi

texts.en:
42-year-old focused M. Joseph operates a seven-year-old shoe-sales enterprise in Lugazi Town. With profits from this business this happily-married man has managed to substantially provide for his family’s welfare and his seven children’s education.

Joseph started his business after a pep talk by his father. He was at first involved in a poultry business that he still operates, though it now plays second fiddle to his premier business. Since he began, this hard-toiling man has been making profits to the tune of 150,000 shillings weekly.

Joseph is planning to buy more new pairs of shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more new pairs of shoes to sell

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Mrs. Sean K., who was born in 1975, lives in Pnov village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nhornh Meas, are farmers who own four hectares of land where they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. He is also a palm juice collector.

Because her field is infertile soil Mrs. Sean K. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will hire a plow machine to plow her field and hire farming laborers to grow rice.

She is a mother of five children. Two are seamstresses in a garment factory, one is a policeman, and two are in school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou Y. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old and is married with three children.

Marilou owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Like other entrepreneurs, she wants her business to prosper.

Marilou joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Marilou is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha N. lives in Rung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bros Yi, are farmers who own three hectares of land where they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She is also a farming laborer and he is also a cow middleman.

Now it is time to grow rice but she did not have enough money to buy rice seed. So Mrs. Sokha N. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed.

Mrs. Sokha N. was born in 1966. She has three children. Two attend school and the youngest is seven years old. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin M. is from the town of Banga. He is 44 years old and is married with three children.

Edwin owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He also raises pigs for fattening that he sells to his community.

Edwin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Edwin is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and feeds for his pigs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business and financially support his family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and feeds for his pigs

loans.name: Khunthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Khunthy B. lives in Slaeng village in the Takeo province. She was born in 1986. She is a Khmer cake and dessert seller in the local village, where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sophen Orn, is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support the family. 

She has some problems because in her field, it is time to grow rice, but she does not have rice seeds to grow. So to improve production, Mrs. Khunthy B. is seeking a loan to buy rice seeds and, with the rest of the loan, she will purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline. 

She is the mother of a child who is four months old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe P. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has three school-aged children.

Ma. Fe owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale and has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years. She also raises pigs for fattening and sale.

Ma. Fe joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Ma. Fe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and feeds for her pigs. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun P. is a villager in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province and she is 50 years old. She is a farmer who owns a three-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family.

Her problem is that her field is infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Savun P. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and with the rest of the loan she will rent a plow machine to plow her field.

Her husband, Mr. Ham Chao, is a traditional medicine seller who is able to earn some money to support his family. They have a child who is studying in school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide.

loans.name: Oeth

texts.en: Mrs. Oeth C., who was born in 1976, lives in Poun village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a one point five-hectare plot of land. She cultivates rice that she sells in order to support her family. She is also a basket maker. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Oeth C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and with rest of the loan she wants to rent a plowing machine to plow her field. Her husband, Mr. Nat Ses, is a furniture maker. Through those activities, they support four children: two of whom are attending school, while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Mrs. Phin N. is a villager in Thommoda village, in Takeo province and she is 48 years old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land. She cultivates rice to sell in order to support her family's costs of living. Her husband, Mr. Khy Ben, is a chicken and duck seller, in the local market, where he is able to earn some income to support his family. Since her husband’s business is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Phin N. is requesting for a loan to buy more chickens and ducks to resell. She is a mother of six children, one is a teacher, while another one is a laborer, and the rest are studying in school and they are helping in their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and ducks to resell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn T. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old and is married with four school-aged children.

Jocelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seventeen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna G. is from the town of Banga. She is 25 years old and is married with a 7-year-old child.

Lorna owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years.

Lorna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Lorna is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Victoria Women's Group B-2, Lugazi

texts.en:
Ever since her friend made a believer out of her through persuasion, Ruth N. has set her shoulders to the wheel, working vigorously hard to establish a vantage point in the local market in Lugazi for her six-year-old boutique. This required that she take the reins early and boldly in making the right and impacting decisions. She made success doubly sure by these attributes.

36-year-old Ruth has an applied and experienced mind. Her business generates her 200,000 shillings on a monthly basis. Being the wise, hardworking and focused woman that she is, operating a pay-phone business has also been a wise decision.

With this loan, Ruth wants to restock her boutique with new clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her boutique

loans.name: Mr. Munyra Hun Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of eleven people who live in Bam village, in Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan for different goals in which to improve their living conditions. Mr. Munyra H., born in 1961, is a village bank president who was selected by the other members. He and his wife, Mrs. Saret Ven, are famers who own a four-hectare plot of land. They cultivate rice to sell in order to support their family. In addition, he is a village chief in this local village. His problem is that his field has infertile soil, but he does not have enough money to support improvements to the soil. So to improve production, Mr. Munyra H. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer. He is a father of six children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other three are studying in school. The youngest one is five months of age.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj T. is 59 years old and lives with his wife in Tuv province in central Mongolia. He and his wife have been living for the past twenty-five years in the home where they raised their children. Their children are now grown and live separately.

Davaadorj operates a taxi service in his local area, using his own car to transport people to and from points in his province. He started his transportation business in 2005 after working in the public transportation sector as a driver for thirty-seven years. He has steadily grown his private business over the last five years and has built a solid local customer base.

Davaadorj has used his business growth and success to renovate his home, making it more comfortable for his family. He is a modest and hardworking man and says, "I work hard to provide my children with a happy life.”

Today, as his car is beginning to age, Davaadorj hopes to soon make needed repairs. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase new tires and make repairs to his car.

loans.use: To purchase new tires and make repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Mrs. Tho Ma Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Bam village, in Takeo province, nine people have been selected Mrs. Tho M., who was born in 1987, as a village bank president. All members of the group will use their portion of the loan for different goals in which to improve their living conditions. Mrs. Tho M. and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Proum, are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land. They cultivate rice to sell in order to support their family. Mrs. Tho M. is also a pig breeder while her husband is a fisherman. She has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Tho M. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of a child who is four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie G. is from the town of Banga. She is 46 years old and is married with two children aged 27 and 25.

Rosemarie is a farmer and has been planting and harvesting rice for over seventeen years now. She also raises pigs for fattening and sale and was able to put up a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells a variety of different products. Rosemarie hopes to succeed in all her ventures.

Rosemarie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs, feed for her pigs and additional store inventory. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her businesses to improve her businesses and financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, feed for her pigs and additional store inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28 year old single woman living with her parents in Lebanon. She established a mini-market in her town in 2009, after having had previous experience in this occupation for 5 years. She helps her family through her business income, in collaboration with her brother. She offers food products, cereals, detergents, etc. Her mini-market is situated in a busy area, so there are a lot of customers who pass by her shop. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 to increase her shop's inventory. She is certain that with the help of the loan, her business productivity will be increased.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in her picture, not indicating her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support of Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

loans.use: To increase her shop's inventory.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old. Josephine is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 12 years.

Josephine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Gerel

texts.en:
Gerel V. is 56 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. He has three daughters and a son, two of whom are grown and on their own, and two of whom are students. 

Gerel operates an iron forging business in his town. He produces horseshoes, which he sells throughout his province. Gerel has been operating as an iron forger since 1980, after inheriting the business from his family. His business operations are very stable, with his peak season being the winter and around the Mongolian Naadam festival, which includes horse races.

Gerel is a very hardworking and optimistic person. He says, "I recently purchased construction materials in order to build a house, therefore my working capital available for my business is low. I hope to finish my house this year." Gerel is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials/iron to make horseshoes.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials/iron to make horseshoes.

loans.name: Tsogzolmaa

texts.en:
Tsogzolmaa N. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Tsogzolmaa and her family currently live with her parents in their home. Her husband works as a driver for a private company, and her 9 year old daughter attends secondary school.

Tsogzolmaa operates an appliance retail business at a rented pavilion, where she sells a variety of domestic home appliances to her many customers. Tsogzolmaa started her business in 2001 with capital of 1,000,000 MNT. She has become quite experienced in her trade over the years and has built a stable operation at her pavilion. Her business has become well-known among the locals and she earns an average daily income of 40,000-50,000 MNT.

In the future, Tsogzolmaa hopes to own her own workplace. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more products for increase her business' working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more products.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Our CCT* Community Partner, Linda N., 50, is married to Rolando N., and has four children who are still studying. They live in Silang, Cavite, north of Manila. Rolando works as a chef in a local restaurant in their community.

Linda owns and manages a coin bank manufacturing business for almost ten years now, which basically serves as her family's main source of income. They make these items in their own shop, which is adjacent to their house. After ten years in this business, she has established patrons of her products who buy them on a wholesale basis. Linda earns at least Php1,000 in sales every day. 

Linda is applying for a loan of Php50,000, which she plans to use to purchase raw materials needed to continue operation of her business. She believes that additional capital will increase production at her business, that would cater to the demands of her wholesalers.

At present, Linda finds the frequent rain greatly affects delivery of orders for her clients. However, Linda still hopes and believes that God has destined her for greater things. She dreams of owning a bigger business with more customers to cater to, even in Metro Manila and beyond. Further, it is her dream that her children will be able to finish their studies in college. Linda has been a member of Center for Community Transformation a for few years now and regularly attends fellowship meetings*.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to manufacture coin banks.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina C., 45 years old, married to Welfredo C., is a good member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.- Rizal Central Branch, a partner microfinance institution of Kiva in the Philippines. Mr. and Ms. C. were blessed with 1 child who is now 5 years old. Her husband works as carpenter, while she manages their variety store at home, while attending to the household chores and taking care of their daughter.

She started this business almost two years ago to support her husband in their financial needs. The business is running smoothly, and that is why she is applying for another loan to increase her capital. She wants to buy more grocery products to display in her store, in order to meet the demands of her customers and increase her monthly profits to an additional 2,000 pesos.

She wants to save and earn more for the future of their bright child, who is ranked number one in their school. She would also like to buy appliances for them to enjoy and provide for their daily basic needs. Her dream is to send her child to college and finish a degree. Also, she wants to increase her savings to avoid worrying during payments of monthly utility bills and for any unexpected expenses.

With this new loan opportunity, she is hopeful that some day she and her family will experience a better future. She is thankful that there are institutions like ASHI and KIVA who trust poor people like her. She said she and her husband will repay all the help by improving their lives and moving out of poverty.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en:
Novelita V. is from the town of Banga. She is 43 years old. Novelita is married and has a 14 year old child. To make a living, Novelita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Her husband is also a farmer and they work together to keep their farm productive.

Novelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Novelita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Novelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Novelita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie L. is from the town of Banga. She is 27 years old. Annie is married and has 2 young children aged 7 and 6 months. To make a living, Annie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Annie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years. She says she works hard to be able to save for her children's future.

Annie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Annie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Demna

texts.en:
Demna Y. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Demna is married and has a 13 year old child. To make a living, Demna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Demna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years. She works hard to improve her business and hopefully increase her harvest.

Demna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Demna is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Demna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and improve their house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn B. is from the town of Banga. She is 32 years old. Jenalyn is married and has a 4 year old child. To make a living, Jenalyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jenalyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years.

Jenalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenalyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jenalyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: C7906 Byukadufatanye Group

texts.en:
Jean is 28 years old and is married with four children.  Jean is the leader of a group called Byukadufatanye.  Jean and his team are well-known in the business of agriculture. They have been in this business for about ten years and the business hours are from 6 a.m. until late in the evening.

Jean and his team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, they will try to expand their business by purchasing a variety of agricultural products as well as items which can play a big role in increasing the crops. If successful, they hope that their profits will increase and these profits will be used for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of agricultural products as well as items to increase the crop

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa D. S., 37, who wants to achieve more in life not just for herself but for her family as well. Marissa lives in GMA, Cavite with her husband, Hermogenes, who is a jeepney driver. They have three children, one of whom is in elementary graD., and the other two are already married.

Marissa is in the business of direct selling brand apparel, cosmetics, footwear, and accessories, which cater mainly to people near their residence in GMA. Direct selling of beauty products and other items depends largely on Marissa'a perseverance and social connections. Marissa and Hermogenes gather a net income of Php10,000 monthly, which they use to meet the needs of the entire family.

Marissa admits that she needs a Php13,000 loan to enhance her business and increase her profits. She applied to CCT* for this loan, which she plans to use to further her direct selling business, which includes brands such as Avon, Natasha and MSE. Basically, the loan will serve as additional capital that will enable Marissa to make her business more profitable and lead to more savings.

At present, Marissa sees that her business is not that profitable. She also experiences problems in collection and dealing with customers, and even balancing the time for family and business. Still, Marissa is determined not to be swayed by these struggles and aims to make her business grow. She prays that she will find a commercial area where her business can thrive and flourish. More importantly, she dreams of seeing her children finish their studies and be used as one family for the glory of the Lord whom they serve.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase orders in advance for her customers.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora R. is from the town of Banga. She is 50 years old. Adora is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Adora owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Adora has been engaged in her business for over 20 years. Out of her income from the farm, she was able to put up a sari-sari store, where she sells various products. She hopes that her store will grow as well.

Adora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adora is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional store inventory. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Adora from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house and living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and additional store inventory.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher K. is sixty-two years old, married to a fish monger, and they have eight children aged between thirty-nine and twenty-one. His business is located at Kakamega.

He has been buying cattle and reselling them at a profit to butchers and other middlemen, who resell them for slaughter. He has been in this business for the last twenty-five years and he says his major challenge is financial capital and cattle dying while in transit from the place he buys them. He is using his loan of Kes 70,000 to buy a cow to resell and make a profit. He hopes to grow his business and buy a plot of land from the profits.

He describes himself as honest, hardworking and Christian.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn T. is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old. Annalyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Annalyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Annalyn has been engaged in her business for over 16 years. She dreams of having all her children finish college and have a bright future.

Annalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annalyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lailyn

texts.en:
Lailyn P. is from the town of Banga. She is 37 years old. Lailyn is married and has a 13 year old child. To make a living, Lailyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She also helps her husband maintain their farm. She helps in keeping it free of weeds and pests.

Lailyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lailyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She also plans to buy inputs for their farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies, and to buy inputs for their farm.

loans.name: Lenny

texts.en:
Lenny S. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Lenny is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lenny owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lenny has been engaged in her business for over 23 years. She hopes to improve her harvest the next time.

Lenny joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lenny is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lenny from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve their house.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Having attained a high school education, Yvonne E., 47, wants to achieve more in life not just for herself, but for her family as well. Yvonne lives in Carmona, Cavite with her husband, Eduardo, who is a machine operator. They have four children, one of whom is working, and the other three are still studying.

Yvonne has been in the business of direct selling, which caters mainly to people near their residence in Carmona. Direct selling of beauty products and other items depends largely on Yvonne's perseverance and social connections. Yvonne and Eduardo gather a net income of Php3,300 monthly, which they use to meet the needs of the entire family.

Yvonne admits that she needs a Php15,000 loan to enhance her business and increase her profits. She applied through CCT* for this loan, which she plans to use to purchase advance orders for her clients and additional stock for her variety store. Basically, the loan will serve as additional capital that will enable Yvonne to make her business more profitable and lead to more savings.

At present, Yvonne also experiences problems and challenges in her business, especially in collecting receivables. Still, Yvonne is determined not to be swayed by these struggles and aims to make her business grow. More importantly, she dreams of seeing her children finish their studies and be used as one family for the glory of the Lord whom they serve.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase advance orders for her customers, and grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Peter Jonathan

texts.en:
Peter Jonathan C. is from the town of Banga. He is married and has 2 children aged five and one. To make a living, Peter Jonathan owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Peter Jonathan has been engaged in his farming for over eight years. He also invested in raising fish. He now has a fish pond that he hopes to develop as well.

Peter Jonathan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
