loans.use: To buy more crates of beer.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne was born in 1964 and is married with three children: the first one is 13; the next is 15; and the last one is 19.

Anne is the businesswoman in the family and there is no one else in the family who makes money. For that reason, she has to work hard so that she provides all the basic needs of her family.

Anne owns a business selling small fish and she said that this business is profitable. She is seasoned in her business, obviously, because she has an experience of eight years. She employs two people from her community as helpers so that her business runs well.

Anne is now requesting Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more sacks of small fish. With the loan, Anne will be able to satisfy her customers, which is the best way of earning enough profits to use in her business and in her family as well.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: food staples and sale of kerosene

loans.name: Shahriboni's Group

texts.en:
Shahriboni M. is the leader of the group. She is 42 and married with a son and daughter. Her son is twenty and works in Russia, while the daughter is a seventeen-year-old handicapped person. When the collective farms broke up in 1995, Shahriboni got a piece of land upon which she started cultivating rice and cotton. Her husband works in construction, and when he is free, he helps his wife with her farming. Selling her harvest makes Shahriboni 4800 KGS per month. Shahriboni applied for a loan because she needs money to purchase mineral fertilizers. In the near future she plans to celebrate her son’s wedding.

Zhananhon S., 45, is married and has a daughter and two sons. One son works in construction with his dad, the other is engaged in farming, and her daughter studies at school. Zhananhon has been growing corn and sunflowers since 1995. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for her farm. In the future she plans to purchase a piece of land and start building a house for her son.

Ruslanbek A., 48, is married with a daughter and a son, both of whom are at school. Ruslandbek grows corn while his wife works as a cleaner at a school. Ruslanbek makes 3600 KGS per month through his corn. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase fertilizer and hire labor for sowing his field. In the future he wants to provide his children with a good education.

Turganbubu M. is the treasurer of the group. She is 44 and married with three daughters and a son. Her oldest daughter studies at university, her second daughter and her son are at school, and her youngest daughter, under seven years old, is preschool age. Turganbubu is a baker who earns 6000 KGS per month. Her husband works in construction, making 4000 KGS a month. With money received from the loan Turganbubu wants to purchase flour for baking bread. In the future she wants to build a house for her son.

About MBF:

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers and flour

loans.name: Champion Group

texts.en:
Watchie G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Champion. She is 41 years old, married and has five children who range from 15 to 25 years old. She was only able to attend school through ninth grade due to a lack of funds. For four years Watchie has been selling lappas (a traditional dress for women) in Redlight Market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

Watchie plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more lappas. Her goal is to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more lappas

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice was born in 1972 and is married with two children: the first one is 7 and the second is 5.

Alice has been a businesswoman for the two last years. She sells shoes in Kigali and this business is profitable in the city where her business is located.

Even though she is a young entrepreneur, Alice has belief that her business will expand very soon and she will need to employ more helpers. At present, she employs two people from her community as helpers so that her business runs well.

Alice is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business. With the loan, she will purchase more shoes which will be satisfying for her.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to expand her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. Janet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

Janet has sold charcoal for the past three years. She works seven days a week selling her charcoal at retail prices at the market. The main business challenges for Janet include transportation of her charcoal and thieves.

Janet has requested a loan of 500000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals are to buy a plot of land and to start selling her charcoal at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her arable land and buy fertilizers for her soil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags and lappas (a traditional dress for woman) to sell.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver J. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). Oliver lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent, and school fees.

Oliver has a business selling cooked food at the market. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 7 days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, Irish potatoes, cassava and maize flour for her restaurant. Oliver's main business challenge is transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land and to own a fully stocked restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as bananas, rice, Irish potatoes,cassava and maize flour

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine was born in 1975 and is married with seven children aged between 2 and 10. Her husband is a driver and both work hard for the purpose of providing all the basic needs of their children.

Claudine has owned a small business selling fruits for ten years. The hours of her business are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening, every day.

Claudine is now requesting a Kiva loan for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more sacks of fruit. This expansion will allow her to attract more customers which is the way to earn more profits. With the extra money expected, she will pay her children’s school fees and improve their living conditions as well.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of fruit to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan A. has been running a grocery shop since 2008. He supports his wife and two children. Vardan rents a shop in between several buildings serving the neighborhood. To meet his customers’ demands, Vardan wishes to introduce a fruit and vegetable corner in his shop.

loans.use: to introduce a fruit and vegetable corner

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza is a 30 year old married man and the father of one child. Hamza has worked in car services for 11 years, dealing with all electric car maintenance. He opened his own garage in 2002, and he is proud of what he has accomplished. Hamza is an expert in airconditioner maintenance, therefore many people visit him from far away places. Hamza is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a special KEYMAKE machine, which is used to program keys for new cars. Competition is a major problem for him. Hamza’s dream is to open a showroom for new cars.

loans.use: To buy a special KEYMAKE machine.

loans.name: Virtue Women Group

texts.en:
Magdalene M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Virtue Women. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three children who range from 5 to 13 years old. Magdalene was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty.

For three years, Magdalene has been selling charcoal and bread in Red Light Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 7,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 35,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal, flour and sugar. She describes herself as a caring woman.

Magdalene’s dream is to improve her business, educate her children, and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal, flour and sugar

loans.name: Feras

texts.en:
Feras is an 18-year-old single man from Lebanon who has worked as a hairdresser since 2009, with three years experience. His young age wasn’t an obstacle to proceed in his work, it’s just the competition he has to be ready to face at any time.

Feras is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary products for his work such as hair colors and haircutting tools and to renew his haircutting chairs.

Feras has certain talents in hairdressing, which everyone in his environment talks about. His dream is to expand his business to a bigger, famous salon.

loans.use: To buy necessary products for his business and to renew his chairs

loans.name: Frederic Francois

texts.en:
Francois was born in 1988 and is married with three children: the first one is 18, the next is 14, and the last is 12. There is no one else in his family who works and, for that reason, he has to work hard so that he can provide all the basic needs of his family.

Francois is seasoned enough in his business, obviously, because he has four years of experience. The hours of his business are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening, every day.

Francois is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more bales of clothes to sell. This expansion will allow him to satisfy his customers and attract new ones as well.

With the profits that Francois expects to earn, he will reinvest in his business and pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchasing more bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new clothing stock

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice N. lives in the neighborhood of Kalerwe in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her mother. She lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, food, rent and school fees.

Beatrice has been in the sugar cane business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her products at the market. Beatrice has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bundles of sugar cane.  Her main business challenges are defaulters and the transportation of bundles from the villages of Kyagwe to her stall in Kalerwe. Her goal for her business is to buy land and start growing sugar cane herself.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of sugar cane

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 34-year-old single man from Lebanon.  He has been working in the construction business, and dealing primarily with stone, for 15 years. He likes his work a lot and his clients like dealing with him a lot, too. 

Walid is requesting a Loan from Al Majmoua for two reasons: first, to buy products necessary for his water pump; and second, to open a small restaurant, which will be a new, extra business. He believes that his work in construction is seasonal and must be supported by another efficient means of income, and a restaurant is the perfect choice. Walid hopes to improve his business and to succeed in his new venture.

loans.use: to buy products necessary for his water pump, and to open a restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, beans, etc.

loans.name: Raydan

texts.en: Raydan is 40 years old, married, and a father of two children. He has been working as a mechanic since 2000, and he owns his own garage for repairing cars. His experience, commitment and honesty have led to widespread popularity amongst his neighbors and other villagers. Raydan has been with Al Majmoua for 6 years, and has a perfect record of loan repayment. Today, he is requesting a loan in order to buy new machines to improve his business. His hope is to expand and improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy new machines to improve his business

loans.name: God’S Favor Group

texts.en:
Mamie C. (holding the sign) is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “God’s Favor.” She is 30 years old, single, and has two children aged 11 and 14 years old. She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to poverty. She describes herself as a devoted woman.

For 10 years, Mamie has been selling plantains, pineapples, oranges, mangos, etc. in Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 28,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more plantains, pineapples, oranges, mangos, etc. Her goal is to expand her business and build a house. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Ezekieh is inset at lower right because he was absent during picture-taking.

loans.use: to buy more plantains, pineapples, oranges, mangos, etc

loans.name: Nema

texts.en: Nema U. is currently in the business of selling mixed goods such as biscuits, cartons of salt, cartons of powdered milk etc in a retail shop and is requesting a loan to stock bags of sugar, coffee, tea leaves and more cartons of salt to sell.  Nema is 28 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: To stock sugar, coffee, tea leaves and salt to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 27-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has traded cars since 2006, with five years of experience. This is the second time Ali has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his capital through buying a new car. This will increase and improve his income and business at the same time. Ali is very committed to his business and clients. He hopes to open a big showroom for new and used cars.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie J. sells provisions at O.I.C road in Makeni. She is hard working and committed to her business. She is married and got her start up capital from her husband, a high school graduate. She has 42 years of business experience. She needs a loan of SLL 4,000,000 to buy additional provisions and groceries. She hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to send her five dependants to the university level and help her husband complete their house. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy provisions and grocery products

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben N. lives in Tsamakasar village near Talin city, Armenia. After serving in the Army, he found himself involved in growing cattle food, which he sells to the neighbors. The income supports him and his parents. The land that he is currently cultivating is being rented. With the help of this loan, Ruben is planning to purchase his own piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase his own piece of land

loans.name: Moonlight Group

texts.en:
Mamie Kolleh, who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called MoonLight. Mamie is 37 years old, married, and has four children who range from 1 to 19 years. She was only able to attend school through third grade due to poverty. Besides her chiildren she also cares for two siblings.

For four years, she has been selling pepper, soap, milk, and tomatoes in Redlight Market, Paynesville (outside of Monrovia, Liberia).

She plans to use her 5,000 LRD portion of this 25,000 LRD group loan to buy more pepper, soap, milk, and tomatoes. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman.

Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy pepper, soap, milk, and tomatoes

loans.name: Kejiyo

texts.en: Kejiyo A. sells cooking oil, beans, simsim, and rice at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and beans to sell.  Kejiyo is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has four children, and her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Noorah

texts.en:
Noorah N. lives in Kyebando in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced and has four children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of two additional family members (a sister and a brother). 

Noorah sells second-hand clothing. She has been in this business for four years. She works seven days a week. Noorah sells her products in a retail shop. Noorah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bales of second-hand clothing. 

The main business challenge for Noorah is the transportation of bales of clothing from Owino market to her shop in Kyebando. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy land and build rooms to rent. She decided to join MCDT because of good customer care. Noorah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but she doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane T. sells bags of simsim and groundnut at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell. Jane is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a service staff. She has four children, all of whom go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Our God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Elvator B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Our God Is Able. Elvator is 34 years old, single, and has three children who range from 11 to 17 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty. 

For four years, she has been selling drugs (medications) in Redlight Market, Paynesville (outside of Monrovia, Liberia).

She plans to use her 5,000 LRD portion of this 25,000 LRD group loan to buy more drugs (medications). She describes herself as a patient woman.

Her dream is to improve her business and build a clinic.

loans.use: To buy drugs (medications)

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty T. is currently in the business of selling simsim, beans and groundnuts at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of charcoal to sell.  Betty is 24 years old and is married to a ZAO staff member. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up her charcoal store.

loans.use: To stock bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy carving materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is currently in the business of selling rice, tomatoes, onions and simsim at the market and is requesting a loan to stock jerrycans of cooking oil and Irish potatoes to sell.  Mary is 35 years old and is married to a builder. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy jerrycans of cooking oil and Irish potatoes

loans.name: C2587 Twihaze Group

texts.en:
Donathe was born in 1970. She is married with three children. Her first child is 19 years old. The next is 16 and the last is 10 years old. In the family of Donathe everybody is jobless. Donathe works hard in order to provide all that is needed for her children. Donathe has been a businesswoman since 2006. In fact, Donathe sells various foodstuffs and she said these products are profitable, which is the reason why she chose this kind of business. Donathe is serious in her daily activities. That is the reason she is the group representative of the five members. Each of the members has a different business. All the businesses are organized, obviously, because they have a start and end time. In particular, Donathe starts her business at 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day except on Sunday.

Donathe and her group are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their businesses. This group is focusing on satisfying their customers, which is the main reason for requesting this loan. With the extra money, Donathe and group will be able to save money for the future.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. lives in Kawala, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has eight children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (orphans).  

Jane has a business of selling second-hand shoes. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works six days out of every week. Jane sells her products at the market on a retail basis.   

Jane has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bales of second-hand shoes. She also generates additional income. The main business challenge for Jane is the transportation of bales of shoes from Owino market to her stall in Kawala.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to boost her business and to start importing shoes herself.   

Jane lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad H. lives in Sisian city, Armenia. He works as a driver. To support the family, he and his family members are growing vegetables. The windows of the family’s greenhouse have broken over the years and require repair. This loan will go to repair the greenhouse and improve the household’s economy.

loans.use: Repairing the greenhouse

loans.name: C9454 Dufatanye 1 Group

texts.en:
Gratien is 37 years old and is married with two children, 8 and 12 years old. He is the leader of this group called Dufatanye which operates a business selling a variety of goods including the sale of foodstuffs. The business hours are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

As the number of their customers has increased to the extent that Gratien and his team are not able to satisfy the demand, they need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, they will be able to satisfy the demand and, in addition to that, they will be able to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs, to sell

loans.name: Help Yourself Group

texts.en:
Mary N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Help Yourself. Mary is 46 years old, married and has five children who range from 12 to 23 years old. 

She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For 10 years, she has been manufacturing and selling “iron soap,” a locally manufactured soap, in Rehabilitation Community, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more gallons of the red oil and caustic materials used in the production process. 

She describes herself as humble and easy-going.

Her goals are to improve her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha's picture is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil and caustic materials used in the production process of soap

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia K. is currently in the business of selling beans, rice, tomatoes and cabbages at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish, more tomatoes and bags of maize flour to sell.  Cicilia is 40 years old and is widowed.   She has 7 children, three of whom attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock dried fish,  tomatoes and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 32-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and only child. Ibrahim has worked as a car repairer and painter since 2004, now having 15 years of experience. Ibrahim is requesting his third loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary raw materials which are essential to his business and will increase his profit. His clients are people from his village and those they lead to him. His hardworking attitude is the secret of his success.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials

loans.name: C4355 Abatoni Group

texts.en:
Delphine is 29 years old and is married with two children. She is the leader of this group called Abatoni which is well-known in the business of selling a variety of goods. This is their third successful year in this business and the hours of their business are from early morning until late in the evening.

Delphine and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company which they will invest in the purchase of foodstuffs. This, hopefully, will increase their sales as well as their profits. With these profits, each member of this group will improve the living standard of his or her family and, in addition to that, they will keep expanding their business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of goods for their store

loans.name: Eva United Group

texts.en:
Eva K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Eva United. She is 46 years old, married and has five children who range from 12 to 30 years old. Eva was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

Eva has been selling red oil and rice in Barnard Farm Community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia for 7 years. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of rice and gallons of oil. She describes herself as easygoing. Her dream is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy rice and oil

loans.name: C4509 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Josiane is 29 years old and is married with four children. She is the leader of this group called Abizeranye which is well-known in the business of sewing different styles of clothes. Their business hours are from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.

Josiane and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company and they really hope that, once this loan is disbursed to them, they will be able to purchase more clothing items and sewing machines. If successful, they will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow them to keep expanding their business till they become financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing items and additional sewing machines

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice K. is currently in the business of selling bags of beans, simsim (sesame), and rice at the market, and she is requesting a loan to stock bags of peeled, dried cassava tubers, maize, and sorghum to sell. Alice is 50 years old and is married with a husband that is a pastor. She has 4 children, and they go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more goats and sheep to improve the number of existing ones at home.

loans.use: Stock bags of peeled, dried cassava tubers, maize and sorghum to sell

loans.name: By God’S Grace Group

texts.en:
Sando M., who is holding the sign in the photo, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called By God’s Grace. Sando is 48 years old, married and has six children who range from 6 to 24 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. For 2 years, she has been operating a mini restaurant in Barnard Farm Community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, peppers, meat, fish, onions, etc. She describes herself a determined woman.

Her dream is to grow her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, peppers, meat, fish, onions etc

loans.name: Abass

texts.en: Abass is a 27-year-old engaged man from Bint Jbeil. He has been working as an electrician since 2002 and is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to buy a motor engine and an SDS (a machine that’s used to open holes in the wall) necessary for his business. Abass has worked as an electrician since 2002, and he’s an expert in his field. He hopes to expand his work in the future through big construction projects.

loans.use: To buy a motor engine and an SDS (wall-cutting machine)

loans.name: Theodosie

texts.en:
Theodosie is 51 years old and is married with five children. She also takes care one dependent who is 20 years old.

Theodosie is well-known in the business of selling a variety of drinks and this is her sixteenth successful year in this business. Her business operates mostly in the afternoon hours until late in the evening.

Theodosie, after realizing that her capital is too low to expand meaningfully, would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. Once given this loan, she hopes that her sales and her profits will increase.

If successful, Theodosie will keep expanding her business till she becomes financially stable and, in addition to that, she will be able to keep satisfying all the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of drinks for sale

loans.name: Be Careful Group

texts.en:
Gbolu F., who is holding the sign in the photo, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Be Careful. Gbolu is 53 years old, single, and has five children who range from 16 to 33 years old. She also cares for two siblings. She was not able to attend school at all due to lack of financial support. 

For 9 years, she has been selling red oil in Barnard Farm Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more gallons of red oil. She describes herself as humble. Her goal is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil to resell

loans.name: C 4367 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Donatien is 31 years old and is still single. He is the leader of this group called Tuzamurane that operates a business selling a variety of goods in their shop. The business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Donatien and his team, after realizing that their capital is still too low to earn more profits, need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, they will expand their business through purchasing a large quantity of goods. In addition to that, they will purchase foodstuffs such as rice, Irish potatoes, and other kinds of foodstuffs which are in high demand by a large number of their customers. Once done, they will start saving for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs, for sale

loans.name: C 4346 Urumuli Group

texts.en:
Clementine is 26 years old and she is married with three children.  Clementine is the leader of a group called Urumuli and this group is commonly known for selling timbers.  This is their 8th successful year in this business, which they operate from 8 am until late in the evening hours.

Clementine and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. This loan will allow them to expand their business by purchasing more timber for sale.  With the use of this loan to expand their business, they really hope that their sales as well as profits will increase.  If successful, this group will keep reinvesting in their business until they become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell

loans.name: Kihihi Network Of People Living With Hiv Group

texts.en:
Determined and hardworking K. Eunice, age 45, is a happily married mother of 4 children. Like any other responsible parent, she thinks often of how best she could satisfy her family's requirements, having previously been in the grocery business. Then she went into a poultry farming business, where she now looks after chickens for egg production and broilers for consumption, and this is done alongside her coffee beans sales. 

In her home area of Rwemisisi, Kihihi, she has a variety of chickens, and this makes her business more attractive. With this project, she has been able to capture a good market serving shopkeepers and hotel owners who purchase eggs that they use to prepare for customers. This has helped her earn 200,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.

Her main intention for taking up this loan is to help in the purchase of chicken feed and feeding troughs, and to stock more chicken. This will improve her market supply and also the sales revenue collections as she looks at soon owning a hatchery project.

loans.use: chicken feed and restocking of more chickens

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes K. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, lemons, bananas, simsim (sesame) and green vegetables, and is requesting a loan to stock onions and jerrycans of cooking oil to sell. Agnes is 45 years old and is widowed.  She has 5 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock domestic animals such as ducks, hens, goats, sheep, and cows, to keep at home.

loans.use: Stock onions and jerrycans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 36 years old and married with three children who are 1, 6 and 10 years old.  Beatrice is the leader of a group called Abadahemuka and this group has been in this business of selling charcoals for about two years.  The hours of the business are from 7 am until late in the evening.

Beatrice and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, they will hopefully increase the sales of charcoal as well as profits.  If successful, Beatrice and her team will keep expanding their business by creating various sources of income.  This, in turn, will make their business financially stable and enable them to continue taking care of their families.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 32-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and one child. Hussein works in construction, and he has specialized in cement since 2001. Hussein is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy wood necessary for framing his work. Hussein’s clients are his relatives, neighbors and villagers. His work is fine and affordable to everyone. Hussein aims to expand his work and to increase his clients.

loans.use: To buy wood necessary for framing his cement work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, peppers, fish, meat, onions, tomatoes, etc

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is currently in the business of selling clothes and linens such as dresses, trousers, and bedsheets at the market and is requesting a loan to stock shoes and saddles to sell. Victoria is 22 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar for selling beer, hot wines etc.

loans.use: Stock shoes and saddles to sell

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is an active member and secretary of the Kenyagoro Chepkole Group in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 10 years and sells his milk and tea to the local market. He is a full-time farmer and solely depends on the income from his farming to provide for the basic needs of his family.

Samwel has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will help pay school fees for his children and this will raise their standards of living. His biggest challenges have been difficulty in finding the right type of breed and that the veterinary services available are not reliable. In five years time, he would want to have improved his dairy farming by keeping the right dairy breeds and building them modern dairy units.

Samwel is 43 years old and married with eight children between the ages of 5 and 20. All the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 24- year-old single man. He sells electric supplies and provides electricity to homes, through his electrical motor engine, when there is no governmental electricity, a major problem in Lebanon since 2008. Khodor is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy an extra motor engine to provide more houses with electricity. This would increase his customer base, income and business. His clients are all the people in his village. He hopes to expand his work to other villages in the future and to open a big electrical appliances showroom.

loans.use: To buy an extra motor engine

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: Gevorg A. has been selling women’s clothes since 2009. He rents a stall at one of the city’s markets. With his business income, Gevorg supports his parents, grandparents and sister. Gevorg has applied for this loan to purchase new clothing inventory.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing inventory

loans.name: Abajyamugambi Group

texts.en:
Venuste is 30 years old and the leader of a group called Abajyamugambi.  This group is commonly known for selling a variety of agricultural products and they have been in this business for a long time.  The business hours are from 6 am until late in the evening.

Venuste and his team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  Once given this loan, they will keep expanding their business by purchasing a large quantity of agricultural products.  With these additional agricultural products, Venuste and his team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep expanding their business for a better financial stability and start saving for the future of their families.

loans.use: To purchase more agricultural products

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline has a mixed farm in the town of Litein in the Rift Valley of Kenya. She has been farming for the last 4 years. Her farm produces milk and pineapples which she sells to the local market. She is a full-time farmer and depends on the income from her farming to provide for her family's needs. Evaline recently completed repaying her previous loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 65,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. She says that this loan will improve her family's standard of living since the milk will be used for domestic consumption and the surplus sold. The income will be used to expand the business. Evaline's major challenge has been insufficient dairy feed. She hopes to buy a piece of land in the future so that she can expand her dairy farming.

Evaline is 34 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 2 children, ages 9 and 13. Both children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce D.  is currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.  Joyce is 32 years old and married; her husband is an NGO staff member. She has 4 children, who all attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: to stock more baking flour and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Kipkirui

texts.en:
Kipkirui is a farmer from the town of Litein in the Rift Valley of Kenya. He has been farming for 10 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces milk, tomatoes, cabbages and tea. He also earns income from his poultry farming and computer printing services.

Kipkirui is 38 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 3 children, ages 3, 9 and 14. All the children attend school. Kipkirui has requested this second loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will enable him to pay his children's school fees, feed the family and assist other members of his family. He says that this loan will improve his family's living standards. However, he faces the challenge of lack of funds for expansion.

In the future, Kipkirui would like to build a decent zero grazing unit and increase the number of his dairy cows to three. He would also like to expand his poultry farming. He is grateful for the constant support in terms of loans and other beneficial information that are being extended to Juhudi Kilimo's clients.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sellina

texts.en:
Sellina is a dairy farmer from Konoin division in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for 15 years and employs two people from her community. Her main product is milk which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from her small-scale farming of tea.

Sellina is 53 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 10 children who are now between the ages of 10 and 34. Five of the children attend school. Sellina recently completed repaying her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 40,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help in paying her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to have a pure breed of cows only. Sellina is grateful to Juhudi for the good work they are doing.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren has a mixed farm which produces tea, pineapples and milk, all of which she sells at a local market. She has been practising mixed farming for 4 years in Litein, Rift Valley, Kenya. Carren is 23 years old and the mother of 2 children who are currently attending school.

Carren has requested this loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says that she will not always struggle to provide for her family since the extra income from this loan will enable her to pay school fees and buy food for her family.

Carren's primary challenge is lack of enough animal feed and diseases which reduce her output. She hopes that in five years' time, she will have increased her dairy farming by increasing the number of dairy cows to three. She is grateful to Juhudi for the trainings they occasionally offer to their clients.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia K. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal from her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal and some firewood.  Cicilia is 41 years old and married to a laborer. She has 6 children, who all attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motor bike to transport bags of charcoal from the producers' location to her home for resale.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal and some firewood

loans.name: Mauricio Rosales

texts.es: Mauricio N. es un poblador del municipio de Baranoa, en el departamento del atlántico, dedicado al comercio en una tienda muy reconocida en este lugar, donde vende víveres, ranchos,  licores  y refrescos; el se inició como ayudante de este mismo negocio y como su antiguo dueño necesitó viajar, para atender su finca en el departamento del Magdalena, se quedó con él mediante un contrato de arrendamiento,  y en el año 2005 lo compró, cuando logró posicionarse en el mercado, eso si  con  mucha disciplina, buen servicio y ahorrando, éxito  que  lo ha llenado de mucha satisfacción. Mauricio precisamente por su gran responsabilidad,  logró realizar varios financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que le han ayudado mucho porque antes trabajaba  con muy poco capital para poder surtirlo; últimamente se ha beneficiado con el credikiva, que es su tercer crédito con esta organización,  pues necesita comprar en mayor volumen aceite, arroz, y licores preparándose porque ya vienen las fiestas de  fin de año y con este financiamiento su tienda va a estar bien surtida. Su negocio es la única fuente de ingresos y por eso enfoca sus esfuerzos en el crecimiento de su tienda, pues él sueña con verla con una infraestructura, bien dotada con vitrinas, estantería,  pero eso si siempre bien surtida, para que a sus clientes nada les falte cuando lleguen a su tienda.
texts.en:
Mauricio N. is a resident of the town of Baranoa, in the Atlantic region. He works in business in a store that is very well known in this area, where he sells provisions, meals, liquors, and soft drinks. He began as an assistant in this same business, and since its long-time owner needed to travel to take care of his property in the Magdalena region, Mauricio stayed in the store through a lease contract. In the year 2005 he bought the store and succeeded in positioning himself in the market; this he did through much discipline, good service, and saving, and this success filled him with great satisfaction. Indeed, with his great sense of responsibility, Mauricio succeeded in obtaining several loans through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. They have helped him a lot, since before he worked with very little capital to stock his store. Recently he has benefited from Kiva loans, and this would be his third loan from this organization. He needs the loan to buy larger quantities of oil, rice, and liquors to prepare for the end-of-year fiestas that are coming. With this loan his store is going to be well stocked. His business is his only source of income and for this reason he focuses his efforts on the growth of his store, since he dreams of seeing it fully furnished, well provided with glass cases and shelving, but always well stocked, so that he has everything his customers want when they arrive at his store.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy larger quantities of oil, rice, and liquors

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. lives in the Lugala neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

Aisha has a business selling secondhand clothes at the market. She has been in this business for 3 years and she works 6 days a week. Aisha has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. The main business challenges for Aisha include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a big business and to start importing secondhand clothes rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been practising mixed farming for the last 10 years in Nyamira, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, beans, tea, milk and bananas which she sells to the local market. She depends on the income from her farming activities to provide for her family's basic needs.

Mary is 38 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 6 children who are between the ages of 3½ and 20. All but one of the children attend school. Mary has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will assist her in paying her children's school fees and improving her family's living standards. Mary's biggest challenges have been too much rain which spoils the crops and pesticides which affect the productivity of the crops.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet has a mixed farm that produces maize, beans, sorghum, milk and eggs, all of which she sells at a local market. She has been practising mixed farming  in Nyamira, Western Kenya for the last 18 years. She is a full-time farmer and depends on the income from her farming to provide for her family's basic needs.

Linet has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She plans to use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees and build a house. Her biggest challenges have been diseases which attack her poultry and too much rainfall which destroys her crops. She hopes to open a wholesale store in the future. 

Linet is 38 years old. She is a widowed mother of 4 children who are between the ages of 6 and 20. Two of the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar vive la zona de 8 de Diciembre de la ciudad de La Paz. Es soltero y no tiene hijos.

Omar trabaja en el cine-center y estudia en la universidad,  en la facultad de ciencias económicas y financieras, y el crédito requiere para la compra de una computadora, la cual facilitará en gran medida sus estudios y trabajos en la Universidad y así de esta manera poder continuar con su carrera universitaria.

Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito y la primera que requiere el apoyo de kiva.
texts.en:
Omar lives in the 8th of December neighborhood in La Paz called. He is single and has no children. Omar works in the movie theater and studies at the university in the Department of Economic Sciences and Finance. He needs this loan to buy a computer which would help greatly with his studies and work at the university and enable him to continue with his university course. This is the first time that he has requested a loan and the first time he has asked for support from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer that will aid his studies in the Department of Economic Sciences and Finance

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina G. is currently in the business of selling sugar, tomatoes, onions and cooking oil at the market and is requesting a loan to stock fish, beans, maize flour and rice to sell.  Elina is 20 years old and is married; her husband is a student. She has 1 child who does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house which she would rent out.

loans.use: Stock fish, beans, maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 20 years old. He is married and has a 1 month old baby. He has been farming for 3 years and employs one farmhand. He sells his maize, beans and milk to the local market. He also operates a kiosk in the same area. His biggest challenge has been unpredictable weather patterns that affect his crops.

Denis has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will help improve his family's living standards. He hopes to increase the number of his dairy cows and buy more land in the future. He comments that if he continues with Juhudi, he believes it will improve his life by far as compared to the present.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren is 33 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 4 children who are between the ages of 7 and 14. All the children attend school. Carren has been farming for the last 10 years in Nyamira, western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces tea, trees, maize and beans which she sells to the local market. She also operates a kiosk in the same area.

Carren has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family's living standards and enable her to pay her children's school fees. Carren's  primary challenges are lack of enough rain, pests that affect her crops and lack of available markets for her farm products. However, she hopes to improve and expand her farm in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been farming for the last five years in Nyamira town, western Kenya. Her main products are tea, bananas, vegetables, tomatoes and maize which she sells in the local market. Grace is 23 years-old. She is married and has two children aged one and four. One of the children attends school.

She has requested this loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will assist her in improving the living standards of her family.

Her primary challenges have been unpredictable weather conditions, pests and diseases and the lack of an available market for her farm produce. She hope that, in five years time, she will have acquired five dairy cows and expanded her farm by buying another piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty A. is currently in the business of selling soda, mango juice and ice cream at a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of soda, water and mango juice to sell.  Betty is 22 years-old and married with a husband that is a police officer. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock two fridges for keeping soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase crates of soda, water and mango juice.

loans.name: Sheku  A.

texts.en:
Sheka is married and has nine dependants. Sheka sells clothes and other personal effects in a popular section in Makeni known as the flower corner. His wife is fully engaged in the business. Sheka has eight years experience in this type of business. He needs a loan of 4,000,000SLL to buy clothes from Guinea and Freetown where wholesale prices are lower.

Sheka intends to use the proceeds generated from this loan to educate his dependants and buy a car for transportation. He thanks you for supporting him.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is an active member of the Eronge Youth Group which is being funded by Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo. He is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. He has been farming for five years and employs two people from his community. He sells his milk, maize and tea at a local market.

Joshua is 25 years-old. He is married and has been blessed with two children, ages three and six. One of them attends school.

Joshua has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will help increase his milk productivity which will inturn increase his income.

He faces the challenges of dry weather and hailstorms which destroys his crops. In the future, he plans to acquire more land and cows and to sell his produce wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity S. is currently in the business of selling dresses, women's head coverings and bedsheets at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets and also some pairs of shoes and sandals to sell.  Charity is 22 years-old and is married with a husband that is a government worker. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase bedsheets, shoes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine Y. has been managing a clothing shop since 2009, ordering affordable clothing from the USA and Europe. Armine takes care of her pensioner mother. 

Armine has applied for this loan to purchase autumn clothing stock and pay the customs fees.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing stock

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has been selling mobile-phone accessories for over three years. She is married with two children who attend school. With the 40,000 Kenyan Shillings loan, Asha wants to purchase phone batteries and handset covers, which she will then sell door-to-door to her customers. She also sells khangas and kikois (clothing) to her neighbors. 

She owns her home, which has both electricity and water. She cites school fees as her greatest expense. She hopes to someday open a shop from which to operate.

loans.use: To purchase phone batteries and handsets covers

loans.name: C5603 Wintenguha Group

texts.en:
Grace was born in 1965 and is married with six children. Grace is a businesswoman but her husband is jobless. Grace has to work hard in order to get everything her family needs. Grace owns a business selling animals and her business is well known in the region because most of the people who have a butchery come to her to buy the animals for meat.  Grace is focused on her own business but she is the group leader of seven members who have various businesses.

Grace and her group are requesting a KiV. loan to expand their businesses by purchasing more products or more animals for sale. Once this loan is given, all members of the group will be able to satisfy their customers and attract new ones. With extra money; the members of group expect to save and reinvest in their business.

loans.use: To purchase more animals to sell.

loans.name: C7168 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Odette is 33 years old and the leader of a group called Twisungane.  Odette and her team sell a variety of goods in the shop and they have been in this business for a long time. Their business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Odette and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. This loan will hopefully allow them to expand their business by purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs.  With this additional business, they really hope that their profits will increase, which in turn will allow them to create some other sources of income for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Before opening a clothing stand at a city market, Alina A. had worked as a saleswoman for many years. Alina is trading in clothing for teenagers and young women. Currently, Alina is single and living with her extended family, but dreaming of expanding her business and owning her own living place one day. 

To revamp her clothing stock before the upcoming busy autumn season, Alina has applied for this loan.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing stock

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 26 years old and he is still single.  Vincent is commonly known for selling a variety of goods in his shop and this is his fifth successful year in his business.  The business hours are from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Vincent, after realizing how much foodstuffs are being purchased, he decided he would like to start selling them.  To this end, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will hopefully increase his profits, which in turn will allow him to keep expanding his business for better financial stability.  In addition to that, he will start saving for his future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Masikizano

texts.en:
Masikizano has been selling food for 18 years. She is a married woman with five daughters, all of whom have already finished their education. She normally cooks chapatti (flat bread) and beans and sells it in the open-air market to her customers.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan, Masikizano wants to buy more wheat flour and beans. 

One of her greatest challenges is seasonality as she cannot sell her food at the market when it’s raining. Masikizano also gets financial support from her children. 

She owns her home, which has electricity but no piped water. She cites electricity as her greatest monthly expense. In the coming years, Masikizano hopes to operate her own food kiosk (hotel).

loans.use: To purchase more wheat flour and beans

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 28 years old. She is married with two children and in addition, she takes care of four more children.  Mediatrice is commonly known for selling meat. She has been in this business for about two years. The business hours are from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Mediatrice is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of meat to sell.  With this additional quantity, she will hopefully earn more profit, which will allow her to keep expanding her business for better financial stability.  If successful, she will create some other sources of income, which in turn will allow her to satisfy all the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of meat to sell

loans.name: Athanase

texts.en:
Athanase is 48 years old and married with four children who are 4, 6, 10 and 12 years old.  Athanase is commonly known for selling milk. To this end, he has to purchase additional cows in order to get a large quantity of milk to sell. 

Athanase's target is to become financially stable through the operations of his business. He needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to reach his target.  If his target is reached, he will continue providing all the basic needs to his family and keep expanding his business for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional cows

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 27 years old. He owns land where to grows his crops and he has been in this business for about ten years. His working hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Elisa needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. Once given this loan, he will purchase domestic animals hoping to earn more profits in the long term. Apart from that, he will purchase a variety of goods in order to set up a small business which can bring in some money to be used at home.

loans.use: To buy domestic animals to raise plus some goods to sell in a new business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa K. is married to a field worker at the agricultural unit. She has eight dependents. 

She sells pepper and other farm produce at Main Lorry Park in Makeni. Hawa has 35 years experience in this trade. She was a member of the group lending scheme and graduated to individual lending and has a very good credit history. 

She needs a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leone Leones to buy pepper and other farm produce on a wholesale basis. She hopes to use the proceeds from this loan to educate her children and help her husband build their family house.

loans.use: To buy pepper and other agricultural produce for resale

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 42 years old and is married with two children 11 and 12 years old.

Vincent owns a grocery store where he sells a variety of goods, mainly sugar, rice, etc. He has been in this business for about ten years and the hours of his business are from six until late in the evening.

Vincent needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, he will expand his business through adding the sale of beverages and some other products which seem to be in high demand by a large number of his customers.

If successful, Vincent will hopefully earn a lot of money which, in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy beverages and a variety of goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Andia

texts.es:
La sSeñora Andia B. es soltera, vive con su madre de 90 años, ella es hija unica y le es dificil dejarla sola; por  esa razon trabaja en una actividad que le permita estar cerca de su madre.
Andia se dedica a la Venta de Joyas desde hace mas de 25 años, dicha actividad le permite solventar los  gastos del cuidado de su madre.
  Gracias al apoyo económico que le dio nuestra institución, ella pudó obtener de ésta actividad el maximo provecho sin descuidar a su madre.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra  de  Joyas, (tales como, aros, cadenas, pulceras de oro)  ya que tiene varios pedidos y así  brindar mayor  atencion   a sus clientes.
texts.en:
La Señora Andia B. is single and lives with her ninety-year-old mother. She is an only child, and it's difficult to leave her alone; therefore, she does work that permits her to stay close to her mother. Andia has sold jewelry for more than 25 years. This acitvity permits her to pay the expense of caring for her mother. Thanks to economic help from our institution, she was able to obtain maximum advantage from her work without neglecting her mother. The requested loan is for the purchase of jewelry (items such as hoops, chains, bracelets of gold). She already has various requests from customers and wishes to fulfill them promptly.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy earrings, chains and bracelets

loans.name: Janixia De Los Santos

texts.es: Janixia De Los Santos de 33 años, brinda el servicio de salón de belleza,  ella se ha esforzado considerablemente para mejorar sus ingresos, pues la mayoría de sus clientes son personas que siempre recurren a su lugar, la atención esmerada y el buen servicio que ofrece es lo que más les gusta a sus clientes. Este es el primer financiamiento que realiza, por lo que se siente muy contenta con esta oportunidad para mejorar su negocio.  Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como cepillos nuevos, tratamientos, tijeras, secadoras y planchas. En el futuro quiere tener dinero para un salón más grande y así asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Janixia De Los Santos, 33, provides beauty salon services. She has exerted considerable effort to improve her income. Most of her customers come to her place. The excellent service and personalized attention is what they like best. This is the first loan she has negotiated and is happy to have this opportunity for her business. She is asking for funds to buy raw materials and supplies like: new brushes, hair treatments, scissors, hair dryers and curling irons. In the future she’d like to have money for a larger salon thereby assuring her family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty salon tools and supplies.

loans.name: Eliezel

texts.en:
Eliezel was born in 1982 and he is married with one child who is 3 years old. He is a self-employed businessman and and his wife is a businesswoman; they both work hard for the purpose of providing all that’s necessary for their family.

Eliezel makes metal doors and windows and he said that this business is profitable once one has enough capital. He employs two people from his community as helpers so that his business runs well; his business is open from six in the morning to eight in the evening, every day except Saturday.

Eliezel is now requesting Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing enough metal to use in the fabrication of more windows and doors. With the extra profits which are expected he will be able to save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase metals for making more doors and windows

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 31 years old and is married with two children who are 3 and 5 years old. She has owned a restaurant for a long time and her restaurant is open from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Solange, after realizing that she has a lack of equipment, would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she will purchase equipment and, in addition to that, she will repaint the walls of her restaurant so that it will look smart.

If successful, Solange really hopes that her customers as well as her sales will increase. With these profits, she will keep improving her business as well as the living style of her family and she will start saving for the future.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her restaurant

loans.name: Mirian Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Mirian, es una Ama de Casa que con la ayuda de su marido viene desarrollando la actividad de Venta de Carbón desde hace 2 años, los motivos que la llevaron a invertir en este negocio fueron debido a que en el lugar no existen distribuidores de este producto y hay una gran demanda de los restaurantes, churrasquerias, pensiones, etc. de la zona. Su esposo el Sr. Miguel, Contratista de ocupación, la ha venido apoyando de forma continua en esta actividad a tal punto que en las epocas de escacez de este producto el mismo opta por ir a buscar el carbón al Torno, Abapo u otros pueblos aledaños y cercanos a nuestra ciudad. Doña Mirian acudio a nuestro establecimiento debido a la inminente necesidad de ampliar su negocio necesita comprar carbon por cantidad para  proveer a sus clientes, esto por la gran demanda existente en la zona, y una vez realizada la investigación correspondiente se la acepto como cliente de nuestra institución. la Sra. Mirian cuenta con domicilio conocido en Zona Sureste de nuestra ciudad y ademas de aquello cuenta con un excelente Historial Crediticio a nivel general,esta muy agradecida con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brindo.
texts.en:
Mirian is a housewife who, with her husband’s help, has been selling charcoal for two years. She invested in this business because there are no distributors of this product in her area and there is much demand for it from restaurants, churrasquerías (grilled meat restaurants), diners, etc. Her husband, Miguel, is a contractor by profession. He has been supporting her efforts continuously to such an extent that in times of scarcity of the product he himself goes to Torno, Abapo or other nearby towns to get it. Mirian came by our establishment due to the imminent need to enlarge her business. She needs to buy charcoal in quantity to supply her customers due to the large demand in the area. The customary investigation led to her being accepted as a client of our institution. Mirian lives at a well known address in the southeast part of our city. She also has an excellent general credit history. She is very grateful with the institution for the opportunity it granted her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal in quantity.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 33 years old and is married with two children who are 2 and 10 years old.

Patrick owns a video shop where he deals in the business of renting movies and some other services related to this business. He has been in this business for about ten years and his hours are from the morning until late in the evening.

Patrick needs to request a Kiva Loan via Vision Finance Company to increase his business through purchasing additional video studio items. With this additional business, he will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will help him to keep expanding his business for better financial stability. In addition to that, he will be able to keep improving the living style of his family.

loans.use: To buy additional video studio items

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
La Sra Fermina S. de 45 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr Luis Espinola, con quien tiene 6 hijos, cuatro mujeres y dos varones, es comerciante, tiene una pequeña despensa en su domicilio hace mas de 20  años, gracias a este negocio ella pudo ayudar a su marido en los gastos de la casa, como estudio, alimentacion y vestimenta de los hijos.
La Sra es muy trabajadora, llego a la fundacion Paraguaya a traves de una vecina, solicito apoyo crediticio para la compra de mercaderias para su despensa como fideos, panificados, lacteos, harina, huevos, gaseosas, cervezas, etc. la Sra tambien vende empanadas y sandwiches, que ella misma elabora.
Ella agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo recibido porque gracias a eso va a poder seguir creciendo en su actividad.
texts.en:
45-year old Sra. Fermina S. is married to Sr. Luis Espinola with whom she has six children, four daughters and two sons. She is a businesswoman and has run a small store out of her house for more than twenty years. Because of this store, she has been able to help her husband with household expenses such as school fees, food, and clothing for the children. Fermina is a very hardworking woman. She approached Fundación Paraguaya on the advice of a neighbour and is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her store such as pasta, baked goods, milk products, flour, eggs, soft drinks, beer etc. Fermina also sells empanadas and sandwiches which she makes herself. Fermina is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support she has received. Thanks to this support she will be able to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pasta, bread, dairy products, soft drinks & beer

loans.name: Felipe Alfaro

texts.es:
Felipe de 47 años, , vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), el tiene un taller de costura en la sala de su casa.  

Desde pequeño el veía a su papa coser ropa pero nunca pensó que el seguiría los mismos caminos del papa, cuando creció y por la falta de oportunidades comenzó con el negocio para solventar económicamente los gastos de su familia. Ahora el tiene su taller de confección en su casa trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm. 

Para poder incrementar su producción el quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y hilos, en el futuro quiere dar empleo y enseñar lo que sabe y con los ingresos construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
47-year old Felipe lives in the Perimetral de Guayaquil, a suburban area bordered by a salt water stream, where he runs a sewing business out of his home. As a young boy he used to watch his father making clothes but he never thought he would follow in his father’s footsteps. However, when he grew up, because there were few other opportunities, he started the business so he could support his family. Now he has his own sewing workshop in his home and works there from 8am to 9pm. In order to increase production, Felipe wishes to use the loan to buy fabric and thread. In the future he would like to employ other people and teach them what he knows. With the income he earns, he wants to renovate his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing traditional fabrics to make women's clothing

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El señor Victor Hugo vive en la zona del Barrio Braniff, él junto a su esposa viven en la casa de sus familiares, él hace 3 años que se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano que realiza en su vagonta mientras que su esposa la Sra. Yaquelin se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y con esos ingresos ayuda a la economia de su hogar, ellos tiene dos hijos que asisten al colegio. Son personas trabajadoras y responsables, ellos necesitan el crédito para comenzar a construir su casa en un terreno que ellos tienen y necesitan para la compra de cemento, loza, techo, pintura, para estar ya independendientes y poder brindarles mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Hugo lives in the Braniff neighborhood with his wife in a relative’s house. For the last three years he has provided urban transportation services in his car while his wife Jaquelin sells cosmetics. Both their incomes help support the family. They have two children going to school. They are hard working, responsible people and need financing to start building their house on a lot they own. They need to buy cement, tile, roofing materials and paint so that they can live independently and provide better conditions for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es: Carlos Miguel es mecanico y trabaja en su propio taller desde hace 1 año 2 meses. Tiene bastante experiencia aunque es joven. El empezo a trabajar desde los 12 años en un taller llamado San Cristobal hasta los 15 y luego trabajo en otro llamado Taller Mecanico Francis hasta los 18 años. Con los conocimientos que adquirio de la mecanica decidio empezar su propio taller en la casa de sus padres. El es soltero y vive con sus padres, tiene una hermana. Su anelo es especializarse en varios ramos de la mecanica y agrandar su local para tener un taller bien formado.
texts.en:
Carlos Miguel is a mechanic; he’s worked in his own shop for a year and two months. Although young, he has a lot of experience because he started working in a shop called “San Cristóbal” from the age of twelve to the age of 15. He then worked in a shop called “Taller Mecánico Francis” until he was 18. He decided to use the skills and knowledge he had acquired to open his own shop in his parents’ house. He is single and lives with his parents; he has a sister. His dream is to specialize in various branches of mechanics and to enlarge his locale so that he can have a well set up shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is 42 years old and is married with five children who are 3, 6, 9, 12 and 16 years old.

Frida is well-known in the business of selling a variety of paints and this is her 5th successful year in this business. Her business hours are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.
