Frida needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more paints for sale which in turn will allow her to increase her sales as well as her profits. With these profits, she will keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability.

Frida really hopes that the living style of her family will improve.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of paints to sell

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El Señor Alejandro  y su esposa viven en la casa de su hijo tienen dos hijos mayores que ya no dependen de el son independientes el se dedica  a la actividad de la construcción desde muy joven , es su  principal fuente de ingreso es contratista y maestro trabaja con uno de sus hijos y dos ayudantes , el señor solicito el crédito  para la compra de una mescladora mas grande le dimos lo que necesitaba es nuevo con la institución y con el crédito kiva, es muy trabajador siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, su esposa se dedica  a labores del hogar, y estan muy agradecidos con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Alejandro and his wife live in their son’s house. They have two adult children that no longer depend on them, they are independent. He has worked in construction from a very young age. His main source of income is work as a contractor and master builder. He works with his son and two assistants. He asked for funding to buy a larger cement mixer and we gave him what he needed. He’s a new client of the institution and with Kiva loans. He is very hard working and is always thinking about his family’s welfare. His wife is a housewife and they are very grateful to the institution for the support it has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger cement mixer.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 26 years old and has five children. She is married to a driver. Francine sells green bananas at the local market. She also gets much of her income from her motorcycle, which she uses to transport both people and goods.

She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business in the market by buying a variety of food items, such as fish and cooking oil. She says that one of her dreams is to see her business expand each day.

loans.use: Buying a variety of food items to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace was born in 1970 and is a widow with five children. She is a businesswoman and the only one in her family who works. She therefore has to work hard to provide all that’s necessary for her family.

Grace owns a small business which sells various products such as cooking oil, rice, cosmetics products and so on. She employs one person from her community as a helper so that her business runs well. Her business is very small but she is well-known in her community. She operates her business from six in the morning to six in the evening every day. This is her 10th year of successful operation in business.

Grace is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more products to sell. These additional products will help her to attract more customers and satisfy them which is the way to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her store

loans.name: Carlos Daniel

texts.es: El señor Carlos Daniel  está muy contento con su trabajo él tiene 36 años, pues él se dedica a un taller de soldadura, además de esto también se dedica a la venta de repuestos y mecánica automotriz pues siempre con mucho esfuerzo y empeño por salir adelante es que estos negocios han sido fundamentales para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para comprar gafas protectoras, tenazas, alicates y comprar ciertas cosas necesarias para los otros negocios. Pues tiene ciertos encargos pendientes que no ha podido realizar porque no tiene toda estas herramientas. El sueño de Carlos es ampliar su negocio y ofrecer los mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Carlos Daniel, 36, is very happy with his work because he is a welder. He also sells vehicle replacement parts and is an auto mechanic because he’s always working hard to get ahead with these various businesses that have been fundamental in providing for his family’s basic daily needs. He is once again asking for funds to buy protective goggles, pliers, pincers and certain other needed items for the other businesses because he has a few pending jobs that he hasn’t been able to perform due to lack of tools. Carlos’ dream is to expand his business and offer better services.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Rwenyangi Bakyara Tweyambe, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
As they say, hard work pays. A very determined Beatrice N. has gained the fruits of hard work, having started up her hotel (a small or primitive restaurant) enterprise and produce store over 20 years ago to offer catering services in the Omukiragiro Trading Center in Rukungiri. She has no regrets.

Due to good management and esteemed customer care, the business has maintained customers for a long time by creating a good market and maintaining high levels of hygiene. Most of her customers are town dwellers. 

With this loan, Beatrice wants to put in place good furniture and also obtain hotel equipment like foodstuffs and drinks as she looks at improving the quality of services offered. This will enable her to get more customers, earn more profit and be able to cater to her family and children’s requirements, like their education. She is very optimistic to achieve a self-sustaining life with more income coming her way. She is happy that some of the foodstuffs she sells are from her farm and store.

loans.use: Pay for furnishing and stocking of foodstuffs for the hotel (a small or primitive restaurant)

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es: La Señora Laureana vive en casa propia quien tiene su hornito, ella se dedica a la elaboración D. pan,  produce  ricos pancitos desD. hace diez años quien ya tiene bastantes proveedores venD. por mayor y también venD. en su casa ya que tiene su pequeña tienda D. barrio en su domicilio la señora Laureana saco el crédito para comprar harina, levadura y otros para la elaboración D. sus productos,  la señora se fue feliz con el crédito ya que le dimos lo que necesitaba con rapidez y eficacia.
texts.en:
Laureana lives in her own house where her little oven is installed. She is a baker. She has maD. delicious little rolls for the last ten years. She sells wholesale to several distributors and also sells retail from home since she has a small neighborhood grocery store in her home. Laureana is asking for funding to buy flour, yeast and other supplies needed for bread baking. She left happy with her loan because we gave her what she required quickly and efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Narciza De Jesus

texts.es:
María de 52 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  vive en una zona periurbana rodeada de un estero salado. 

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a vender productos de uso personal y cosméticos, aunque no tenia experiencia decidió comenzar por el bienestar de su familia, vendiendo por catalogo. Desde que comenzó a incrementado su clientela y trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener mas variedad en sus productos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cosméticos y perfumes para tener mas ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener una papelería.
texts.en:
María, 52, sells Yambal brand products (a company that offers enterprising women the opportunity to be independent salespersons). She lives in a periurban area surrounded by a salty estuary. To help meet household expenses she started selling personal use items and cosmetics. Despite having no experience she decided to go ahead with catalogue sales for her family’s wellbeing. Since she started she has increased her customer base and works from 7am until 8pm every day. In order to stock a wider variety of products to increase her income she wants to use the loan to buy cosmetics and perfumes. In the future, she’d like to have a stationery shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge Gómez es herrero y gomero desde hace mas de 10 años, tiene su taller y su domicilio en el Barrio las Mercedes en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo. Esta casado desde hace 32 años con su esposa Benita y tienen 6 hijos: Elga Fabiola 30 , Maria Elisa 28, Arturo David 26, Jorge Luís 23, Marco Rodrigo 19 y Matias Ivan de 13 años. A parte de su herrería y gomeria también tiene un lavadero y venta de combustible, es un ejemplo de persona luchadora quien a atravesado varias experiencias de vida, le ayudan sus hijos Arturo, Jorge y  Marco. Tienen buena clientela formada por el trato cordial que les brindan todos los miembros de la familia. El Sr. Jorge manifiesta que comenzó con un pequeño taller y gracias a la confianza que la Institución ha puesto en su persona hoy en día tiene varios tipos de servicios.
texts.en:
Jorge Gómez has had a blacksmith and tire repair shop in his home in the Las Mercedes neighborhood in the city of Coronel Oviedo for over ten years. He’s married for 32 years with his wife, Benita, and they have six children: Elga Fabiola, 30, María Elisa, 28, Arturo David, 26, Jorge Luis, 23, Marco Rodrigo, 19, and Matías Iván, 13. Besides the shop he also has a car wash and sells fuel. He is an example of a tenacious person who has gone through several life experiences. His sons Arturo, Jorge and Marco help him. They have a good customer base established thanks to the cordial treatment all the family members provide. Jorge states that he started with a small shop and thanks to the faith the Institution has placed in him he now provides several kinds of services.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a pump for tire repair shop

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Felix nacido el 14 de Enero, tiene 2 hijos y vive con La Sra. Seberina de 50 años, ellos son de Cochabamba. Hace 7 años que se compraron una parcela de 3 hectareas para trabajar en la agricultura en Quebrada de Horno que se encuentra a 8 km de la localidad de Limoncito y también se dedican a la fabricación de escobas.

Hace 4 años que viene trabajando con Emprender, es muy trabajador y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, estas escobas que realiza son artesanales hechas de paja  y muchas personas las utilizan principalmente en los mercados campesinos, pero su actividad principal es la siembra de maiz y el dinero solicitado es para contratacion d emano de obra para la preparacion de la tierra y compra de semillas, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brindaron.
texts.en:
Felix was born on the 14th of January, has 2 children, and lives with Seberina who is 50 years old. They are from Cochabamba. Some 7 years ago, they bought a 3 hectare parcel of agricultural land to work in Quebrada de Horno, about 8 kilometers from Limoncito. They also make brooms. They have been working with Emprender for the last 4 years. Felix is very hard working and responsible in making his loan payments. The brooms they make are artisan, made of straw, and many people use them, principally in country markets. But Felix's main activity is growing corn, so he is requesting this loan to hire workers to sow his land and to buy seeds. Felix is very grateful to this institution for the opportunity it offers him.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Broom-making and sowing corn

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlene Del Socorro tiene 45 años, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 25 años que tiene este negocio, pues siempre está pensando en la forma de mantener a su hijo de 17 años, y que tiene que pagarle los gastos universitarios, siempre ha sido una mujer responsable que a pesar de las dificultades que ha enfrentado ha sabido sobrellevarlos. Ella se levanta temprano, a pesar de que no tiene todos servicios básicos siempre piensa en mejorar cada día la calidad de vida de su familia. Este financiamiento es con el fin de comprar maíz, por quintal, leña, cal y comal. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Marlene Del Socorro, age 45, makes and sells tortillas. She has had this business for over 25 years. She is always thinking of the way to support her 17 year old son. She has to pay for his university expenses. She has always been a responsible woman. In spite of the difficulties she has confronted, she has known how to pull through them. She gets up early. Even though she does not have all of the basic services, each day she always thinks of improving her family’s quality of life. This loan is to buy corn by the “quintal” (one quintal is 46kg), firewood, lime powder, and a griddle. She dreams of expanding her business and keeping her customers satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Karim

texts.es: Karim tiene 24 años, es una futura madre de familia, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de su madre y hermanas. Desde que tenía 22 años empezó con la venta de cosméticos, y lo realiza durante algunas horas del día. La modalidad  de sus ventas, es por medio de catálogos de diferentas líneas de belleza, y que son mostradas a sus amigas y vecinos, de esa manera escogen el producto que desean comprar. Sus clientes le pagan semanalmente, eso le motiva continuar con este negocio, por lo que trabaja tranquilamente. Se siente muy satisfecha por la labor que desempeña; ya que las ofertas y las campañas que ofrecen de estas líneas, le es  beneficioso; por las ganancias que obtienes y las utilidades que recibe. En adelante planea ampliar su negocio y luego comprarse una vitrina para que pueda exhibir sus productos y sus clientes tenga opción de escoger el producto. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas, como hasta ahora, porque sabe que le es de mucha utilidad para aumentar el capital de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de belleza, para ofrecer la mejor variedad de mercaderías a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Karim is a 24 year old future mother who lives with her parents and sisters. She began selling cosmetics when she was 22 and spends a few hours a day doing this. She sells her products through various beauty supply catalogs and works with different lines of products that she demonstrates to her friends and neighbors, who can make their selections. Her customers pay her weekly and she works at her leisure, so she is motivated to continue with this business. She is very satisfied with her work and benefits from the offers and campaigns that she gets from the different lines, as well as from the income and help that she receives. In the future she plans to expand her business and eventually buy a display case so that she can show her products, allowing her customers to choose the ones they want. This will be her tenth loan through MFP and she is committed to making all of her payments, as she has always done, because she knows that it is helpful to increase her business working capital. She will use the money from this loan to buy more products so that she can offer a greater variety of choices to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Juana De Jesus

texts.es: Juana De Jesús de 52 años, vende cosméticos, Realiza su trabajo sola desde muy temprano, vende pinturas de uñas, desodorantes, perfumes, cremas, jabón, pintura de labios y tratamientos. Lleva17 años en este negocio, su negocio está ubicado en las afueras del mercado, en donde transitan muchos clientes a diario, por lo que ella siempre se esmera en atender muy bien a sus clientes. Esta oportunidad de financiamiento la solicita para la compra de materia prima para comprar nuevos productos y así ofrecer una  gran variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana De Jesús, 52, sells cosmetics. She works alone from very early in the day. She sells nail polish, deodorants, perfumes, creams, soap, lipstick and beauty treatments. She has been in this business for 17 years. Her business is located outside the market were many people pass by daily. She always takes great pains to tend to her customers very well. This loan will be used to buy raw materials, new products, in order to offer a wider variety of goods to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Laura Gladys

texts.es:
Laura de 42 años, vende almuerzos todos los días, vive en una zona urbana tiene con su esposo 4 hijos de 23, 18, 16, 6 años. 

Hace tres años ella comenzó con la venta de almuerzos, como ya tenia experiencia haciendo comidas, comenzó con platos típicos, por la falta de ingresos cocina en su casa y hay sale a repartir los almuerzos, trabaja con dos ayudantes para repartir los almuerzos. Hace caldo de bola, caldo de verde, guatita “arroz con cuerito de vaca”. 

Ella quiere un local para iniciar con su pequeño restaurante por eso quiere el préstamo para readecuar la parte delantera de su casa con cemento, bloques y pintura. En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante conocido.
texts.en:
Laura, 42, sells prepared lunches daily. She lives in an urban zone with her husband and four children who are 23, 18, 16 and 6 years of age. She started selling lunches three years ago because she already had some experience preparing meals. She started making typical regional dishes. Because of lack of resources, she cooks at home and then goes out to sell the meals. She has two assistants that help distribute the meals. She prepares ‘caldo de bola,’ ‘caldo de verde,’ (consists of dumplings or balls made from green plantains and stuffed with meat and vegetables served in a beef broth with corn and yuca. The meat for the dumpling filling is boiled with some beef bones, the green plantains and other vegetables in the broth that will be used for the soup), ‘guatita’ (rice with beef tripe stew). She’d like to have a small locale to open a small eatery and the loan will be used to refurbish the front part of her house with cement, cinder blocks and paint. In the future she’d like to have a well-known restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement, cinder blocks, paint.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La Señora Maria Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad de 4 y 2 años. Ella sale a vender todos los días pues no tiene un lugar estable, solo algunos vecinos que llegan a buscarla a su vivienda cuenta con más de 11 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, Maria lo administra personalmente y durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien pues. El crédito lo utilizara para surtir mejor su negocio y que sus ventas sean mejores para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Ella sueña con establecer su negocio pues así tendrá más afluencia de clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe sells general merchandise. She has two minor children, ages four and two. She leaves to sell everyday, but she does not have a fixed location. Some of her neighbors come to look for her in her house. She has over 11 years of experience managing this business. Maria personally runs the business, and during all of this time it has gone very well for her. She will use the loan to better stock her business so that her sales will improve. She will do that so that she will be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family. She dreams of setting up her business in order to have a greater influx of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty K. is a businesswoman who trades in cosmetics at Gbongo Market in Bo. Betty is married and has three children. All the children are in primary school. She assists her husband greatly in taking care of the home, especially with the schooling of the children.

Betty has a very good credit history in one of the solidarity groups. She needs a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leone Leones to help her stock her shop as she has more customers this season. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 47 años, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Por muchos años atrás se dedicaba en la venta de comida, actualmente vende pescados, en el acopio principal  pesquero del cono Sur, es así que desde las 4:00 de la mañana recibe la cantidad de pescados y mariscos que previamente fue solicitado y a las 5 de la mañana los distribuye a todos los pequeños comerciantes de diversos mercados. Los pescados que más demanda tiene son: corvina, bonito y conchitas; dejándoles muy buenas rentas por lo que siente muy satisfecha por desarrollar esta actividad. Lleva 5 años trabajando en esta actividad y desea ampliar su negocio, distribuyendo toda la zona del cono sur de Lima, de ese modo podrá captar mayores ganancias. Es su séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y sabe que este dinero le será de mucha utilidad para el crecimiento de su capital, por lo que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente. Con el crédito que solicita, se abastecerá de más pescados y mariscos, para cumplir con la mator demanda que le hacen sus clientes minoristas.
texts.en:
Maritza is 47 years old and lives in her own home, along with her husband and two children. She’d been selling prepared food for many years, but now she sells fish in the main fish market in the Cono Sur area. She waits here from 4:00 AM to receive the fish and seafood that she has previously ordered and by 5:00 AM she distributes her wares to all of the small businesses and different markets. The fish in greatest demand are corvina, bonito, and conchita; which provide very good profits and leave her satisfied for developing this activity. She’s been doing this for five years and distributes throughout the Cono Sur zone of Lima. In this way she can have better earnings. This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she knows that this money will be very useful for the growth of her working capital. She is committed to making her payments on time and will use the money from this loan to buy more fish and seafood in order to meet her increased customer demands.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish and seafood

loans.name: Yungueñitas Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Panamericana  es un centro que se encuentra camino a la ciudad de Copacabana. En el mismo ha renovado crédito la asociación comunal de “Yungueñitas”, este grupo consta de ocho socias, está iniciando su décimo séptimo ciclo,  es decir que las socias más antiguas están alrededor de 8 años en nuestra institución;  a la cabeza se encuentre la señora Verónica como presidenta.

La  señora Verónica comenta que es una fundadora, por que se encuentra desde el primer ciclo de funcionamiento de la Asociación. Su negocio está diversificado, pues tiene un negocio de venta de chicharrón y otro de venta de ropa, su hermanita le ayuda con la atención de los clientes. Las ventas son realizadas en las diferentes ferias de El Alto, en las zonas de 16 de Julio  (jueves y domingo), Rio Seco y la Ceja los otros días. Su primer crédito fue de $us100.- y le sirvió para comprar material de trabajo, para este nuevo ciclo está solicitando Bs.3000.- para la compra de mercadería. Este esfuerzo es el que le permite, junto a su esposo, criar a sus cinco hijos.

En relación al resto de los integrantes la A.C. “Yungueñitas” también tienen sus propios negocios en servicio, producción y comercio
texts.en:
The Panamerican Focal Center is a center that has found it way to the city of Copacabana. At this very center the “Yungueñitas” communal association has renewed its credit. This group has eight members, it is beginning its seventeenth cycle. Its most long-standing members have been in our institution for around 8 years; at its head is the president Verónica. Verónica mentions that she is a founding member, because she is from the first cycle of the Association's operation. Her business is diverse, as she has a business selling pork crackling and another selling clothes, her younger sister helps her look after her customers. The sales are made at the different markets of El Alto, in the areas: "16 de Julio" (Thursday and Sunday), "Rio Seco" and "la Ceja" the other days. Her first loan was for $us100.- and she used it to buy material for work, for this new cycle she is asking for Bs.3000.- for the purchase of merchandise. This effort allows her, together with her husband, to raise their five children. Regarding the other members of the “Yungueñitas” association they also have their own businesses in service, production and business.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana Rosa  se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general tiene 2 años de haber iniciado su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, ya que aquí pasan muchos clientes que realizan sus respectivas compras del mercado. El crecimiento en su negocio es notable, pues siempre está brindando lo mejor de ella, Doña Ana tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen en su totalidad de ella, cubriendo los gastos de alimentación, vivienda, salud, vestuario y educación.el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de toallas, sabanas, cosméticos, calzado y tratamientos. Esta joven sueña con establecer otro negocio y agrandar más el de mercadería en general.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa has worked in retail for two years. Her store is located in her house since many customers who shop pass by here. Her business’s growth is impressive as she is always doing her best. Ana has two children who are completely depend on her; she covers the cost of food, housing, health, clothing and education. Ana will use the loan to buy towels, linens, footwear, cosmetics and treatments. This young woman dreams of establishing another store and expanding her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, D. 59 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora, vive en casa D. su hija, junto a sus 2 nietos. En vista que su hija venD. cosméticos decidió ayudarla, al cabo D. un año, realiza por cuenta propia pedidos D. estos productos D. belleza.  DesD. entonces y luego D. atender a sus nietos, se dispone a vender su mercadería a su familia y amistades que tiene, D. esa forma realiza su trabajo. Le gusta mucho el negocio que tiene, ya que le hace ser independiente y generarse sus propios ingresos, además que disfruta mucho D. la compañía D. sus amistades y D. la gente con quien conversa para ofrecer el producto que venD.. En adelante anhela  ampliar su negocio, y retomar sus cultivos D. papa en su pueblo, donD. dice, la vida que llevaba era muy bonita. Este es su décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y sabe que le es D. mucha utilidad, por lo que se  compromete en pagar  sus cuotas oportunamente.Con el crédito que solicita, va comprar diversos productos D. belleza, D. esta manera piensa abastecer los pedidos pendiente que tiene.
texts.en:
Victoria, age 59, is a very hard-working mother. She lives at home with her daughter and her two grandchildren. In light of the fact that her daughter sells cosmetics, she decided to help her. At the end of a year she had her own orders for these beauty products. From then on, after taking care of her grandchildren, she sells her merchandise to her family and friends. That is how she works. She likes the business that she has a lot. It makes her independent, and she generates her own income. Also, she really likes the company of her friends and the people she talks with in order to offer the product that she sells. In the future she would like to expand her business. She would also like to grow potato crops in her village again. That way of life was very nice. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she knows that it is very useful to her. She promises to make her payments on time. She will use the requested loan to buy diverse beauty products. That way she plans to fill the pending orders that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock more cosmetics

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Huaquillay Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Ofelia, tiene 63 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos ya adultos. hace cinco años  forma parte del grupo "Santa Rosa de Huaquillay" integrado por siete personas residentes del distrito de Comas.
Hace ocho años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, inició vendiendo los cosméticos por catálogo, ofreciendo a sus familiares y amigos. Asi también encargaba sus productos con una amiga que tenía su puesto en el mercado para que pudiera venderselo; hasta que esta amiga le recomendó alquilarse un puesto y ella no lo pensó dos veces. Desde ese día empezó a trabjar en el mercado, puso un puestito de bazar.
Con su trabajo diario ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio, ha surtido variedad de productos de belleza y marcas, y éste negocio le permite solventar sus gastos personales y de salud.
con el préstamo solicitado invertirá en la compra de vinchas, ganchos, accesorios de cabello para damas.
texts.en:
Rosa Ofelia is 63 years old, married, and has four grown children. For five years, she has been a member of the “Santa Rosa de Huaquillay” group, which is comprised of seven people that reside in the Comas district. She has dedicated herself to selling beauty products for eight years, having started by selling items to relatives and friends from catalogs. She also sold through a friend who had a stall at the local market and could sell products for her. Her friend recommended she lease her own place in the market, which Rosa didn’t have to think twice about. Since then, she has been working at the market in a small bazaar she opened. Her daily efforts have allowed her to grow her business, supplying it with a variety of beauty products and brands. This business allows her to cover her personal and health expenses. She will use the loan she requests to buy barrettes, pins, and other women’s hair accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hair pins, barrettes and accessories.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu C. is married to a businessman with five dependents, two of whom are her sons. She is assisted greatly by one of her brothers when she is in school. Kadiatu is a trained and qualified teacher and also a trader who is highly involved in business. She sells tailoring materials in the Kissy town section of Bo.

Kadiatu has a good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leone Leones to buy more tailoring materials as they are in high demand toward the reopening of schools. She intends to use the proceeds from this loan to help her husband support the home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe L. G. de 54 años de edad, reside en Colonia Los naranjos, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, los cuales son dos estudiantes muy responsables. Guadalupe se dedica a la elaboración de tamales de elote, los cuales realiza cada tarde y así posteriormente salir a comercializar de forma ambulante por su colonia y otras aledañas. Los tamales de elote son un platillo muy típico de este país y cuentan con muy buena demanda por parte de las personas. Guadalupe solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima necesaria para elaborar mayor cantidad de tamales, ingredientes como: maíz, manteca, leña para cocinarlos y otros más. Gracias a este negocio ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, brindándoles todo lo necesario para que ellos puedan estudiar y que siempre cuenten con su ropa y alimentos, por lo que el mayor deseo de Guadalupe es el de poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 54, lives in Colonia Los Navajos, located in the region of Usulután. She lives together with her husband and two children, who are both very responsible students. Guadalupe works preparing corn tamales, which she makes every afternoon and later sells throughout her neighborhood and surrounding communities. Corn tamales are a very typical dish in this country and they are in high demand. Guadalupe requests a loan with which she can buy all the items necessary to make more tamales, ingredients like corn, butter, firewood for cooking and other items. Thanks to this business, Guadalupe has been able to take care of her children, providing them with all that is necessary so they can study and always have food and clothing. Guadalupe’s greatest desire is to improve sales.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Ingredients to Prepare Tamales

loans.name: Betty Edilma

texts.es:
Betty de 28 años, vende ropa y sandalias desde hace año para poder mantener a sus hijas ya que su esposo vende frutas. Ellos viven en una casa de caña y solo cuentan con agua como servicio básico. 

Inicio vendiendo sandalias poco a poco como le fue bien, con los ahorros que tenia comenzó a vender ropa. Ahora ella trabaja dese las 08h00am recorriendo las calles de tierra de su sector. Aunque ya le han robado la mercadería ella sigue trabajando para darle una mejor vida a sus hijas. 

Para poder incrementar sus ingresos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa, en el futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y tener un local de ropa.
texts.en:
Betty, 28, has been selling clothes and sandals for a year in order to take care of her daughters because her husband sells fruit. They live in a house made of reeds and their only basic service is water. Betty started selling sandals. Gradually, this went well for her. With the savings she had, she started to sell clothes. Now she works from 8:00 AM travelling the dirt roads in her area. Although some of her merchandise has been stolen, Betty continues working to give her daughters a better life. In order to increase their income Betty would like to buy clothing with the loan. In the future she wants to built a cement house and have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Clothing

loans.name: Mamgella

texts.en: Mamgella is single and has four dependents, one of whom is her mother. She is a trained and qualified ophthalmic nurse and also a trader of cosmetics in Bo. Mamgella has a younger brother who assists her in the cosmetics shop when she is at work. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to increase her stock in the shop as she has attracted more of her nursing colleagues to her business. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Emma P. D. A. D. 41 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como agricultor y quien aporta a su hogar D. la cosecha y así mismo D. sus ganancias, así mismo vive junto a su pequeño hijo D. 5 años D. edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. Ella vive junto a su familia en Guatagiagua, ubicado en el departamento D. Morazán. Emma es una madre D. familia muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, ya que su hijo cuenta con todo lo necesario y así mismo se dedica a estudiar gracias a los enormes esfuerzos D. Loida y su esposa. Ella posee una tienda D. productos comestibles como pan y golosinas, y también   D. primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo, así mismo elabora tortillas cada mediodía y también comercializa verduras, cuajada el cual es el nombre que se le da a un tipo D. queso típico D. este país y así mismo otros productos lácteos a las afueras D. su casa. Emma solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda, así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad D. productos lácteos y verduras, D. manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y D. esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Emma P. D. A. is 41 years old and lives with her husband, who works as a farmer and who supports the household with his harvest and his earnings. She also lives with her young five year old son who attends school. She and her family live in Guatagiagua, located in the Morazán department. Emma is a very responsible and hard working mother who strives to get her family ahead. Her son has everything he needs and is able to attend school, thanks to [their] enormous efforts. [Emma] has a food store and sells things like bread and snacks, and also primary need products, such as soap and shampoo. She also makes tortillas in the afternoon and sells vegetables, cuajada (a typical cheese in the country), and other milk products outsiD. her home. She is asking for this loan so that she can better stock her store by buying larger quantities of milk products and vegetables, so that she can better serve her customers and be able to increase her sales. This is a priority for her to be able to move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves, D. 51 años, es una madre D. familia muy amable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su nieto. Hace más D. 10 años, se dedica a los zurcidos D. pantalones, camisas y demás prendas D. vestir, en un taller que tiene dentro D. su domicilio. DesD. entonces sus clientes va a su pequeño taller para que le enmiendan alguna prenda ya sea D. adultos o para niños, D. esta manera logró ganarse la confianza D. sus clientes. Al iniciarse en esta labor, no lograba tener mucho pedidos así que opto por realizar tejidos y trabajos en bisutería, hoy en día le va muy bien en la costura y en las manualidades, como tejer chalinas, gorras, ponchos y demás accesorios para bebes. En adelante sueña con tener un taller D. costura, y sabe que debe bregar arduamente para alcanzar este fin. Es su octavo crédito con MFP y sabe que este préstamo le será muy beneficioso para mejorar su capital D. trabajo, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el crédito que recibirá, podrá invertirlo en la compra D. hilos, telas, cremalleras, madejas D. lana D. diversos colores, para que continúe tejiendo y zurciendo prendas.
texts.en:
Nieves, 51 years of age, is a mother and lives in her own house along with her husband and grandchild. For more than 10 years, she has dedicated herself to doing alterations on pants, shirts, and other clothing in a workshop she has in her home. Her customers visit her in her small shop so she can fix an item of clothing for them, whether it’s for adults or children, and this is how she won their confidence. When she first started out, she didn’t have many orders, so she opted to make knitwear and costume jewelry. Today, the sewing and handicrafts aspects of her business are going very well, and she knits items such as scarves, hats, ponchos and baby accessories. In the future, she dreams of having a sewing workshop and she knows she must work hard to meet this goal. This is her eighth loan with MFP and she knows that it will benefit her a great deal as working capital, and she commits to making her installment payments on time. By receiving credit, she can invest in the purchase of thread, fabric, zippers, skeins of various color yarn, so she can continue knitting and altering garments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, threads, zippers and skeins of yarn.

loans.name: Cecilia Danelia

texts.es: Cecilia Danelia de 51 años, ella se dedica a vender mercadería en general, anteriormente ella solo vendía ropa y perfumes, Comenzó hace 4 años con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia y decidió comenzar a vender otras cosas, ella siempre ha sido una persona muy triunfadora y que no  se deja  abatir por las malas situaciones. Trabaja desde las 7de la mañana hasta las 6 de tarde, por lo que siempre tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos. Con este financiamiento comprara más mercadería como sabanas, perfumes, pinturas de labios, tratamientos para la piel y el cabello.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 51, works in retail. Prior she sold only clothing and perfume. She began four years ago and as time passed, she gained experience and started to sell other things. Cecilia has always been a very tenacious person and doesn’t let bad circumstances get in her way. She works from 7 in the morning until 6 at night which is why she has a wide variety of customer who request different products. With this loan, she will buy merchandise such as linens, perfumes, lipstick, and hair and skin treatments.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: John M.

texts.en: John is married to a trader and has four dependents. He sells used bags in Makeni. John has over 15 years of experience in this type of business and has a reputation for being both honest and reliable. John initially got his start-up capital from the sale of his livestock in the city. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy used bags at wholesale prices. John plans to use the proceeds to educate his children and to build a house in the future. He thanks you for supporting him.

loans.use: To buy used bags for resale

loans.name: Santos Gilberto

texts.es: Santos Gilberto S. C. de 22 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador y responsable, el cual se dedica de lleno al bienestar de su familia, el reside en San Francisco Gotera, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa una joven de 20 años la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a su pequeña bebé de 3 años de edad. Santos se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, el cual cría en su casa de habitación la cual esta ubicada en la zona rural de San Francisco Gotera, este oficio él lo aprendió de su familia, por lo que ya cuenta con 7 años de experiencia, razón por la cual es muy conocido en la zona y cuenta con la confianza de muchas personas quienes le comprar su ganado. Santos es un joven que se esfuerza en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes y nuevas ventas, por lo que cada fin de semana él llega a las plazas de su lugar de habitación, para comercializar al ganado, esto le permite obtener ganancias extras. Santos solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más ganado, así mismo para comprar todo el alimento y vitaminas necesarias para la crianza optima de este y de esta mismo forma ofrecer un mejor producto.
texts.en:
Santos, 22, is a very hard-working and responsible young man who devotes himself entirely to his family’s well-being. He lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán, together with his wife, 20, who does household chores, and their three year-old daughter. Santos works buying and selling livestock, which he breeds in his home, located in the rural part of San Francisco Gotera. He learned this trade from his family, which is why he already has 7 years of experience. He is well-known in the area and trusted by many people who buy his livestock. Santos is a young man who strives to find new customers and make new sales. Every weekend he comes to people’s homes to market his livestock, thus earning extra income. Santos requests a loan as a means to buy more livestock and all of the feed and vitamins necessary for optimal breeding, allowing him to offer a better product.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Livestock and Feed

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Foday Y.

texts.en: Foday is married and has 12 dependents. He trades in cosmetics and hair products in Makeni. Foday has 8 years of experience in the trading business and needs a loan of 4,500,000 SLL to buy additional cosmetics and hair products. He hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to educate his children and to buy a car for transportation. He thanks you for supporting him.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and hair products for resale

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de San José, una zona que tiene como principal actividad económica la pesca artesanal, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la venta de pescado seco – salado, ella adquiere pescado fresco en el terminal pesquero de la región, ubicado a 45 minutos de camino desde donde vive, y ocasionalmente a los pescadores que desembarcan en el distrito donde vive. Luego procesa el pescado y lo ofrece en venta en los diversos mercados de la región. Esta actividad le permite sentirse activa y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos económicos de su familia.

María desea adquirir mas pescado fresco para poder ampliar su negocio y poder aumentar sus ganancias, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales espera darle a su negocio el impulso neceseario para aumentar su nivel de ventas.

María Magdalena es una mujer tranquila y responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
53-year old María Magdelena lives with her husband and three children in the district of San José, an area where the principal economic activity is fishing. The district is part of Lambeyeque province and is located about twenty minutes from the town of Chiclayo. For the past ten years María has earned her living by selling salted dried fish. She gets the fresh fish from the local dock, about a 45-minute walk from where she lives, or occasionally from the fishermen who live in her area. María then processes the fish and sells it in various markets in the region. The work makes her feel useful and she is able to help her husband with household expenses. María wants to buy more fresh fish so she can expand her business and increase earnings. In order to achieve this goal she approached Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to ask for a loan of 1,500 soles which she will use to give her business the boost necessary to increase sales. María Magdelena is a responsible and calm person. Her greatest wish is to carry on working so she can provide her children with a better quality of life. She has worked in the past with our institution and has shown punctuality and responsibility with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: Concepción Del Carmen

texts.es: Concepción del Carmen R. D. G. D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Delgado, el cual se encuentra en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante. Concepción es una persona muy conocida y quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos no solo por ser una persona responsable, sino también por ser alguien muy amable y que atienD. D. la mejor forma a sus clientes. Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, así mismo trabaja elaborando y vendiendo pupusas, las cuales comercializa con sus amigos y vecinos y personas D. los alrededores. Concepción solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir su tienda y D. esta forma ofrecer todos los productos que son necesario en el hogar, así mismo desea poder comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz, queso, frijoles y chicharrón, con el fin D. elaborar más pupusas y D. esta forma atender a más personas. Lo que más desea Concepción, es el poder mejorar su estabilidad económica y aprovechar la oportunidad que la vida le ha brindando D. poder ganarse la vida D. una forma segura.
texts.en:
Concepción del Carmen R. D. G. is 55 years old. She lives in Ciudad Delgado which is in the San Salvador department. She lives there with her husband who is a merchant. Concepción is a very well known person who has good references from her neighbors not only because she is a responsible person, but because she is also a kind person who serves her clients in the best way. She has a perishable goods store located at her house. She also makes and sells pupusas to her friends, neighbors and people from nearby. Concepción is asking for a loan with which she will have enough money to diversify her store and in this way offer all products needed for the home. She also wants to be able to buy greater quantities of corn, cheese, beans and pork rinds in able to make more pupusas and serve more people. What Concepción wants the most is to be able to improve her financial stability and take advantage of the opportunity that life has giver her to be able to earn her living in a stable way.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable products to diversify her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foodstuff for resale

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe G. G. de 65 años de edad, vive junto a una sobrina de 25 años de edad, la cual trabaja como comerciante de productos varios, Guadalupe vive en Usulután, lugar en el cual ha habitado toda su vida. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa, un lugar muy concurrido ya que esta ubicada en calle principal. En dicho negocia ella comercializa leche, pan, golosinas, huevos, jabón y otros productos más. Guadalupe solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio, sobre todo con productos los cuales son muy básicos en el hogar. Ella desea mucho poder mejorar las ventas, ya que es ella junto a su sobrina, son las cuales se encargan de solventar todos los gastos del hogar, ya que Guadalupe es soltera y no tienen hijos, los cuales le ayuden económicamente es por esto que junto a su sobrina ella vela por el bienestar de su hogar.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 65 years old. She lives with her 25 year-old niece, who works selling various products. Guadalupe lives in Usulután, where she has lived her whole life. She has a small store in her house where she sells perishable items. Her store is in a busy area, as it is located on a main street. She sells milk, bread, candy, eggs, ham and other products. Guadalupe is asking for a loan so that she can buy a larger variety of items for her business. She would like to buy products that are used everyday in the home. She would like to buy a lot in order to improve her sales. Guadalupe, along with her niece, are responsible for all the household expenses. Guadalupe is single and she doesn’t have any children that can help her economically. It is for this reason that she lives with her niece. She is looking out for the well being of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products needed for the home.

loans.name: Melba Begonia

texts.es:
Melba Begonia G. C., tiene  21 años.  Es soltera y vive con los padres y un hijo,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.
 
Melba es una socia de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Melba se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y arroz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en Ventanas en el recinto.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y arroz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es mejorar el estado económico de la familia y salir adelante. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos.

Le gusta pasear y estar en la casa.
texts.en:
Melba Begonia G. C. is 21 years old. She is single, and lives with her parents and 1 son in the Ventanas province of Los Ríos. She has 1 son. Melba is a member of the rural cooperative group “San José de los Amarillos”, located in the Los Amarillos region about one hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, the majority of whom are dedicated to agriculture. This is their second loan through the San José Cooperative. Melba dedicates herself to agriculture, planting corn and rice. She buys products every month in the city of Ventanas, and sells them in the surrounding areas. She requests this loan to invest in buying corn and rice. She believes this access to credit is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to improve her family’s financial standing and to get ahead. She meets challenges, such as insect plagues and disease in her crops. She likes to travel and also to be in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in purchasing corn and rice.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo, de 60 años, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su madre. La actividad a la que se dedica, es el tejido y la aplicación de bordados en chompas para niños y niñas. Su estilo de trabajo consiste, en recibir las chompas sin detalles, por lo que luego empieza a colocar los bordados diseñados con  figuras de flores y paisajes. Este trabajo lo realiza cómodamente en su casa, después de hacer las labores domesticas y en temporada de invierno  confecciona muñecos de peluche, de ese modo diversifica sus labores; que tanto le gusta.  Los 2 años que lleva aplicando bordados, sus manos se han vuelto mucho más ágiles, y así alcanza de bordar hasta 20 chompas al día, por tal motivo se siente muy contenta por el trabajo que realiza, puesto que no descuida a su madre y a su hogar. Su mayor anhelo en adelante, es poner un bazar en el mercado y vender las cosas que ella produce. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, como lo viene haciendo. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar lanas de diversos colores y marcas, cuanto más variado sean sus lanas, sus aplicados serán mucho mas reales.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 60 years old and she lives in her own home together with her husband and her mother. She knits for a living, adding crocheted borders to sweaters for boys and girls. Her work begins with plain sweaters and she inserts designs of flowers and landscapes. She works comfortably in her home after she finishes with the house work. In the winter time she makes stuffed toys to vary her work, and she very much enjoys it. She has been knitting for the past 2 years and her hands have become more agile in the work. She can now finish 20 sweaters a day and she feels very satisfied with her work. She can keep up her house work and care for her mother. Her greatest goal is to find success and to set up a stand in the market from where to sell her products. This is her eighth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making her payments, as she has done in the past. With the loan she requests she will purchase yarn of various colors and brand names. The more variety she has in her stock of yarn the more realistic her designs will be.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yarn in various colors.

loans.name: Clemencia Victoria

texts.es:
Clemencia Victoria R. M., tiene  43 años.  Es viuda y vive con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Maribel y Dostin. 

Clemencia es una socia de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Clemencia se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda que vende productos de primera necesidad. Realiza sus compras cada semana en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en Ventanas en el recinto

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra productos comestibles para ampliar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es mejorar el estado económico de la familia y expandir en negocio para servir a las personas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos

Le gusta pasear con su familia.
texts.en:
Clemencia Victoria R. Mora is 43 years old. She is a widow and she lives with her children in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. She has 2 children, Maribel and Dostin. Clemencia is a member of the rural community of San Jose de los Amarillos, located in the region of Recinto de los Amarillos, 90 minutes from the city of Ventanas. The group is made up of 23 members and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they seek from the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Clemencia's occupation is commerce. She has a store that sells items of every day use. She makes her purchases every week in the city of Ventanas and she resells them in Ventanas en el Recinto. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of grocery store items to restock her business. She sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to improve the family's finances and to expand her business to better serve her clients. She faces challenges such as pests and blights in the plantations. She enjoys spending time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of grocery store items for her business.

loans.name: Odalia Alexandra

texts.es:
Odalia Alexandra, tiene 22 años.  Es soltera y vive con los padres. No tiene  hijos. 

Odalia es una socia de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.
Odalia se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener cinco cuadras de cacao. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en le cogollo.

Le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Odalia Alexandra is 22 years old. She is single and she lives with her parents. She has no children. Odalia is a member of the rural community of San Jose de los Amarillos. The group is made up of 23 members and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they seek from the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Odalia is an agriculturist and she has corn plantations. She carries out her purchases every month in the city of Ventanas and she sells her product in the same city. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of corn seeds. She sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to have five blocks of cocoa fields. The challenges she faces are pests and blights, especially langosta moths. She enjoys resting.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Madame yacine F. est une jeune coiffeuse âgée de 29 ans et propriétaire de son salon de coiffure dans un quartier périphérique de Mbour du nom de BAYE DEUK. Pour accroitre sa clientèle Yacine sollicite ce prêt dans le but de s'ouvrir au commerce de produits cosmétiques espérant que cette vente va lui procurer plus de fonds et des revenus qui lui permettront d'agrandir son commerce et de générer des bénéfices et aider son mari à la construction de leur maison qui est son objectif principal
texts.en:
Mrs. Yacine F. is a young, 29 year-old hairdresser and owner of a hair salon in BAYE DEUK, an outlying district of Mbour. In order to increase her customer base, Yacine is asking for this loan so that she can begin to sell cosmetic products. She hopes that these sales will bring in more income, enabling her to expand her business and generate a profit. Her main goal is to help her husband with the construction of their house.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMMERCE

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 29 años, es una joven profesional muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres. Trabaja como profesora en una escuela de primaria, de lunes a viernes hasta 2:00 de la tarde, asimismo alquila disfraces infantiles a sus alumnos para los diversos eventos que tienen en la escuela. Este último negocio decidió emprenderlo, al ver que sus alumnos alquilaba estas vestimentas a precios muy elevados, así que adquirió estas prendas para rentarlos ella misma pero a un precio más cómodo, por lo que le resulta rentable, y más en fechas festivas como la semana del niño, día de la madre, del padre y los desfiles de fiestas patrias. Los  8 años que trabaja como profesora y ahora como negociante le han ido muy bien, por lo que se siente muy feliz, y en adelante piensa tener su propio taller de costura, para que diseñe sus propios disfraces, y así aumentar sus ganancias. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, y en su anterior crédito ha sido ha sido muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su grupo se ha ganado el respeto de sus compañeras. Con el crédito que solicita comprará telas, para mandar a coser más disfraces, y de ese modo seguir alquilando.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 years old. She is a hard working and young career woman. She lives with her parents. She is a primary school teacher from Monday to Friday until 2pm. But she also rents out children's costumes that the school children use for various events. She decided to start up this business because she saw that the school kids were renting these costumes at very high prices. she acquired some costumes and started renting them at better prices, a venture that has been very successful, especially during the holiday seasons such as the Week of the child, Mother's Day, Father's day, and for national holiday parades. For the past 8 years she has worked as both a teacher and a business owner and she has seen great success, giving her a great deal of personal pleasure. In the future she hopes to have her own sewing shop to design her own children's costumes and increase her earnings. This is her second loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). In her previous loan she has been on time and she plans on keep that up. She has earned the respect of her community group. This loan will be destined to purchase various fabrics to have costumes made so that she may continue to rent them out.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to create children's costumes.

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 5 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Fuerza Divina 5 (Divine Force). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children as the head of the family. She says that her most difficult challenge is to give what her family needs in every sense of the word. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying being at home, cleaning and cooking.

Maria is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for more than five years, starting with the first loan Esperanza gave her. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying cosmetics and beauty products and also, bags of used bed linens. She will use the profits to provide what her family needs and she will be saving because she wants to finish building her house and implement another business to rent clothes for ceremonial occasions like quinceañeras and first communion. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because "this was the opportunity to start my business, and I have seen the results" and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products and also, bags of used bed linen

loans.name: Dámaso Nelvin

texts.es:
El señor Dámaso Nelvin, tiene la edad de 41 años vive con su familia en lo Laureles Sur un barrio de la Capital, muy conocido por la inseguridad social que sus habitantes conviven día a día, ellos tienen 3 hijos pequeños que estudian la escuela primaria, el señor labora como albañil y su esposa se dedica a la venta de carnes, apoyando con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar.

Ellos son de Nueva Guinea un pueblo en el interior del país pero se vinieron a la capital en busca de mejores condiciones y oportunidades de trabajo, ellos habitan en una humilde casa que no canta con las comodidades dignas de habitad y es la razón por la cual solicita una préstamo para la división de los cuartos de los niños y la pareja, esto les brindara una mayor privacidad, mejores condiciones, y comodidades para todos, con el crédito se comprara los materiales de construcción como primera etapa de las remodelaciones de su hogar.
texts.en:
Damaso Nelvin is 41 years old and he lives with his family in the district of Laureles Sur in the capital city. The region is well known for its social instability. They have 3 children and they are all attending primary school. He is a construction worker and his wife sells meats. The both contribute to the family's finances. They are originally from Nueva Guinea, a village located in the interior of the country but they moved to the capital city in search for better living conditions and for work opportunities. They live in a humble house that does not provide the common dignities of life and for this reason he is requesting a loan, to install a wall separating the children's room from the parents' room. This separation will provide them with greater privacy, better living conditions, and a greater comfort for all. This loan will allow them to purchase all the materials needed to complete the renovations to their home.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate their home.

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: Madame Fatim F. est une femme commerçante âgée de 36 ans résidente dans le quartier de Liberté 1 d'où elle exerce un commerce de détail avec la vente de produits céréaliers et alimentaires . Ainsi,elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et accroitre son activité génératrice de revenu . Néant pas une situation familiale ce commerce est pour elle un moyen de subsistance qui va lui permettre de faire face à ses besoins personnels et à ses enfants
texts.en:
Ms. Fatim F. is a 36-year-old merchant living in the Liberté 1 district, where she runs a retail business selling cereals and food products. She is seeking a loan to strengthen her capital and increase her income-generating activity. Not having family to support her, she relies on this business as a means to provide for herself and her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her business

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: Gisela tiene 45 años de edad, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y comunicativa, vive en su casa heredada por sus padres, en compañía de sus 2 hijos y su nieto  Piero de 6 años. Por muchos años vendía ropa por medio de pedidos de sus clientes, pero hace 10 meses logró tener su puesto de ropa, en el interior del mercado más grande y concurrido de su distrito. Desde entonces, todas las mañanas se levanta para preparar los alimentos de sus hijos, para luego desplazarse a su puesto de venta. El negocio que realiza le fascina, donde generalmente trabaja sola, pero cuando se va de compras solicita el apoyo de su nuera mientras regresa, de ese modo no pierde clientela. En adelante piensa incrementar su negocio, con la venta de lencerías nacionales e importadas, para atender la exigencia de sus clientes. Es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, de ese modo ganarse la confianza a posteriores ayudas, para el crecimiento de su capital. Con el crédito que solicita, comprara más ropas casuales, para cubrir la demanda de sus asiduos compradores.
texts.en:
Gisela is 45 years old and she is a mother and a hardworking and talkative person. She lives in the house she inherited from her parents. She lives with her 2 children and her grandson Piero who is 6 years old. For many years she took orders for items of clothing for her clients. Ten months ago she managed to set up a stand in the interior of the most visited market in the region. Since them she gets up early in the morning to prepare the day's food for the kids and then she makes her way to her stand. She is fascinated by her business. She generally works alone but when she goes out to make her purchases she requests assistance from her sister-in-law, so that she does not miss out on any sales. In the future she hopes to make her business grow by selling locally made items of clothing as well as imported goods, to have the clients' interest. This is the first loan she requests from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to the obligations of the loan. She hopes to earn the right to have future loans, to supplement her working capital. With the loan she requests she will purchase more casual style clothing, to meet the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase casual style clothing to meet client demand.

loans.name: Qochasaywas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Qochasaywas” actualmente se encuentra en el ciclo III y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Institución de Micro finanzas Arariwa que está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq provincia del Cusco. Algunos de los socios se dedican al comercio como por ejemplo a la venta de chicha de jora, venta de comida y otros brindan servicios como por ejemplo operador de transportes y cuidado de niños. Dentro del grupo hay socios que son profesionales como enfermeras, docentes y guías de turismo.    

Sr. Luis es uno de los socios del banco comunal a quien hemos entrevistando y va representar a sus compañeros, él socio nació en el distrito de Ccaparmarca  de la provincia de Chumbivilcas del departamento del Cusco.  Actualmente, Luis vive en el distrito de San Sebastián de la ciudad de Cusco donde vive junto con su esposa y su hijo.   

Luis tiene estudios superiores y estudió la carrera profesional de educación. Actualmente, Luis ejerce su profesión y trabaja en el colegio COBED como profesor del curso de Religión. Le pueden encontrar de lunes a miércoles en el colegio COBED, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 1 de la tarde. Luis también trabaja en otro colegio llamado Koricancha los días jueves y viernes.  
  
Con su próximo préstamo Luis que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para gasto personal, el desea pagar la luz, agua y para la mantención de su hijo. Luis es una de los socios fundadores del banco comunal y es una persona puntual y responsable con el pago de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Qochasaywas" is on their third loan cycle and the group is made up of hard working and entrepreneurial individuals that at every moment look for opportunities to get ahead and with daily work they hope to provide a better future for their children. The community bank meetings are held ever thirty days in the central office of the Aririwa Microfinance Institution. It is located in the district of Wanchaq, in the province of Cusco. Some of the members sell chicha de jora, a fermented maize drink, and prepared foods, while others provide services such as public transport drivers and day care workers. Some members of the group are professionals, including nurses, teachers, and tourist guides. Luis is one of the members of this community bank, the one member that we have interviewed to represent his colleagues. He was born in the district of Ccaparmarca, in the province of Chumbivilcas in Cusco. Currently Luis lives in the district of San Sebastian in the city of Cusco, where he lives together with his wife and their son. Luis has a superior level of education having studied a professional career to be a teacher. Luis is a teacher and he works in the COBED school as a Religion teacher. He works from Mondays to Wednesdays in the COBED school, from 8 in the morning to 1pm. Luis also works in another school named Koricancha on Thursdays and Fridays. He requests a loan in the amount of S/. 1000 neuvos soles. He would like to use these funds to pay his hydro and water bills and to necessities to support his son. Luis is one of the founding members of the community bank and he is a very punctual and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover hydro and water bills and to support his son.

loans.name: Martha Marlene

texts.es:
Martha de 47 años, tiene un taller de sastrería en la parte delantera de su casa, con su esposo tienen 6 hijos y viven en el suburbio de Guayaquil. 

Cuando ella y su familia vinieron a vivir a Guayaquil para encontrar mas oportunidades, comenzaron a vender cangil (pop corn) porque no tenia suficientes ingresos para su familia. Ella inicio el taller de confección en la parte delantera de su casa. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Para seguir con su taller de confección quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y hilos, en el futuro quiere comprar maquinas para que la producción de ropa aumente.
texts.en:
Martha is 47 years and lives in the Guayaquil suburbs. She has a tailor shop in the front part of her house. She and her husband have six children. When she and her family came to Guayaquil, to find more opportunities, they began selling popcorn because they didn't have enough income for the family. She started her shop in the front part of her home. Now she works from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM every day. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy fabric and thread. In the future she wants to buy some sewing machines so that her clothing production can increase.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric and thread

loans.name: La Bendición De Dios Group

texts.es: Doña Graciela es casada tiene tres hijos pequeños y dos de ellos están estudiando, ella y su esposo se dedican a la venta de pieles, que se utilizan para la elaboración de calzado, su negocio cuenta con quince años de experiencia, vende en San Marcos y San Francisco el Alto. Viendo la necesidad de un capital y no teniendo las garantías necesarias se unen con otras vecinas que tienen la misma necesidad para forman el Banco Comunal llamado La Bendición de Dios, esto es para poder solicitar financiamiento e incrementar sus capitales y volumen de ventas. Ella sueña con que su negocio sea más grande y algún día poder exportar pieles. El Banco Comunal es integrado por diez señoras entusiastas.
texts.en:
Doña Graciela is married and has three young children, two of whom are in school. She and her husband earn their living selling animal hides used in making shoes. Graciela has 15 years of experience in this business and sells in San Marcos and San Francisco El Alto. She is in need of capital and since she does not have the necessary guarantees, she joined with other neighbors in the same situation to form a Communal Bank called “La Benedición de Dios” (The Blessing of God). Now that they are able to request a loan, the members will be able to increase their capital and generate more sales.

Graciela dreams of expanding her business and hopes to export animal hides one day. The Communal Bank consists of ten enthusiastic women.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire animal hides to sell

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Gregorio Alberto, tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos niñas, como él mismo las llama de 24 y 19 años de edad. hace cinco meses forma parte del grupo "La Unión" formado por 7 integrantes residentes del distrito de Comas. Sus compañeras lo eligieron Fiscal del Grupo.
Hace quince años, el Sr. Gregorio Alberto se dedica a prestar servicio de taxi, para lo cual utiliza un auto de su propiedad. Inició éste trabajo para compensar el bajo sueldo que recibía al trabajar parta una entidad estatal.
Gracias a éste trabajo que hacía en sus tiempos libres, puso adquirir su casa propia, brindar estudios a sus hijas y mantener una estabilidad económica sin problemas para él y su familia.
Una de sus metas es poder renovar su carro, cambiarlo por uno menos antiguo que le pueda rendir mejor para el servicio de taxi.
El préstamo recibido lo utilizará para pagar una deuda adquirida para la reparación y mantenimiento de su auto.
texts.en:
Gregorio Alberto is 50 years old and he is married and has two daughters, aged 24 and 19 years. Five years ago he joined the group named "The Union" and it is made up of 7 members, all residents of the Comas district. His colleagues elected him to be the treasurer of the group. For the past 15 years Gregorio Alberto has been a taxi driver, driving his own car. He started this job to supplement his other paid job. He works for the city and the pay is very low. Thanks to this business that he carried out in his spare time he was able to buy his own home, he was able to put his daughters through school and he managed to maintain stable finances for the family. One of this goals is to replace his car with one that is not as old, so that it will be in condition to serve as a taxi service. This loan will be used to pay for the repairs of his car.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for repairs done to his car, used as a taxi

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, de 62 años, es un hombre muy noble, vive en el comedor popular del estado, ya que se encarga del cuidado de inmueble, en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Hace más de 10 años, se dedica en la venta de quesos y manjares que son provenientes de la sierra peruana, en donde sus familiares le proveen de estos productos lácteos para luego venderlos a vecinas y comerciantes minoristas del mercado de su distrito. La modalidad de sus ventas es a crédito; y cada semana renueva sus pedidos, de ese modo no pierde contacto con sus clientes.
