El resto de los días trabaja en múltiples labores de acuerdo a lo que se presente, mientras que termina de estudiar  su hija, ya que después piensa retornar a su pueblo donde tiene su propia casa. Es su veinteavo crédito con MFP y se compromete en continuar pagando puntualmente como hasta ahora, asimismo acudir a las reuniones que organiza el grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el incremento de quesos, manjares para abastecerse bien y cumplir con los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 62 years old, he is a noble man. He is the caretaker of the State's buildings, and he lives there together with is wife and their two children. For more than 10 years he has sold cheeses and snacks that are popular in the Peruvian mountains. His family members provide him with the products for him to sell to the neighbors and the grocery stores in the market. He carries out his sales on credit and every week he receives orders for his products. This way he doesn't ever lose contact with his clients. The other days he works in various other jobs depending on whatever is required. Once her daughter is finished school he hopes to go back to the village where he has his own home. This is his twentieth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to the obligations of the loan and he will continue to attend the group meetings. The loan he requests will be invested in the purchase of more cheeses and snacks to be able to supply the outstanding orders he currently has.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheeses and snacks for resale.

loans.name: El Milagro 6 Group

texts.en:
Valentinia is the coordinator of her group El Milagro 6 ("The Miracle"). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a successful business. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to serve others.

Valentinia is excited to be taking her 12th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for six years, starting when she received her first loan in Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, where she has a little grocery stand and takes it to the local public school to sell snacks, candies and other groceries. She also sell shoes and clothing. She will use the profits to invest and save. She wants to run her business from home or her own location, because she doesn't want in the future to be moving.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she was needing motivation to start a business, which she received in her group and with Esperanza. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy candies, snacks, fruits, soda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Mh 6 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group MH 6. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her mother. She says that her most difficult challenge is to keep working because her family still needs her.  In her free time, she enjoys attending church.  Juana is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and growing her business. She started her business three years ago.  She will use this loan to grow her business and stock more cosmetics, beauty products, and underwear. She will use the profits to help her mother and to improve their home.
 
Juana chose to work with Esperanza due to good loan terms offered.  Her story is representative of others in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general.  Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, beauty products, and underwear for selling.

loans.name: La Piramide De San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis Felipe, tiene 43 años, es casado y tiene un hijo. El forma parte del grupo "L. PirámiD. D. San Judas Tadeo", formado por 8 integrantes, ellos residen en L. zona D. Collique en el distrito D. Comas.
El Sr. Luis Felipe se dedica hace 8 años al servicio D. taxi, debido al poco ingreso económico con el que contaba, decidió comprarse un carro y salir a taxear, y tener un trabajo independiente.
Con su trabajo a logrado construir su casa, educar a su hijo.
Uno D. sus proximos proyectos es terminar D. estudiar L. carrera D. abogado que dejo pendiente.
Con el préstamo recibido apoyará a su esposa en L. implementación D. sus salón D. belleza.
texts.en:
Luis Felipe is 43 years old, he is married and he has a son. He is a member of the group named "The Pyramid of San Judas Tadeo". The group is maD. up of 8 members, all residents of the Collique region of the Comas district. Luis Felipe has been a taxi driver for the past 8 years. Given the low income that he once earned he decided to purchase a car and offer public transportation, and to be independent. With his business he has managed to build his own house and to send his son to school. His next project will be to complete his studies in law, studies that he once had abandoned. With this loan he will support his wife by helping her set up a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help set up a beauty salon.

loans.name: Fe Y Alegria De Huancalle Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Fe y Alegría D. Huancalle” se encuentra funcionando 4 años y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la casa D. la señora Mari Luz en al comunidad D. Huancalle distrito D. Taray provincia D. Calca del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad D. Huancalle se encuentra ubicado a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco por la pista asfáltica. La mayoría D. los socios se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. 
 
Al visitar el banco comunal hemos entrevistado a la Sr. Maria Luz y tiene 33 años, ella nació en la comunidad D. Corao distrito D. San Sebastián. Actualmente, Maria Luz vive en la comunidad D. Huancalle junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Hace 7 años que vive en la comunidad donD. se dedica a la agricultura, ella venD. verduras en el mercado D. Huancaro D. la ciudad del Cusco. La pueden encontrar los días sábados en su puesto D. venta, desD. las 8 D. la mañana hasta las 2 D. la tarD.. Maria luz también venD. en el mercado D. Rosaspata, Wanchaq y Cascaparo D. lunes a viernes. Maria luz estudio enfermería y en asamblea los dirigentes D. la comunidad a Maria Luz la designaron como promotora D. salud D. la comunidad para que pueD. dar charlas D. nutrición, higiene y muchos temas más.

Con su próximo préstamo Maria Luz Luis que espera recibir S/. 800 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para refaccionar su casa desea comprar puertas y ventanas. Maria Luz es una D. los socios fundadores del banco comunal y fue elegida como secretaria del banco comunal porque es una persona puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Faith and Happiness of Huancalle" has been running for four years and it is maD. up of hard working and entrepreneurial members, looking for opportunities to get ahead and to proviD. a better future for their children. The community bank meetings are held every thirty days in Mari Luz's house, located in the community of Huancalle in the district and province of Taray and Calca, in Cusco. The majority of the members are agriculturists and farmers. When we visited the community bank we interviewed Maria Luz. She is 33 years old and she was born in the community of Cora, in the district of San Sebastian. Maria Luz currently lives in the community of Huancalle together with her husband and their two children. She has been living in that community for the past 7 years and she is an agriculturist. She sells vegetables in the markets of Huancaro in the city of Cusco. She can be found on Saturdays at her stand from 8 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon. Maria Luz also makes her sales in the markets of Rosaspata, Wanchaq and Cacaparo on Mondays and Fridays. Maria Luz studied to be a nurse and she was elected to be the health promoter in the community, giving talks on nutrition, hygiene, and may other topics. Maria Luz requests a loan in the amount of S/.800 nuevos soles. She would like to use the loan to renovate her home and purchase new doors and new windows. Maria Luz is one of the founding members of the community bank and she was elected as the secretary of the bank because she is a very punctual and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new doors and windows.

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en: Guloglan H.  is a hardworking man who works in the cattle raising business. He has six children. He works hard to provide everything his family needs. Presently, Guloglan is sacrificing and working hard to grow his business.  He is a widower and runs his business alone. His monthly income is about 250-300 AZN from selling cattle and dairy products to local farmers.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more cattle. He plans to feed and raise the cows and maximize his investment by selling milk products and meat. This will be his first loan with AqroInvest and Kiva. His 20 years of experience and deep knowledge in this field makes him qualified to receive the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: La Señora Georgina trabaja como docente en una escuela para adultos, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, la señora Georgina perdió su casa en un sector donde se inundo hace tiempo y a ella la reubicaron en el sector donde vive actualmente, ella requiere de este préstamo para construir una barda en la parte de un lado de la vivienda, ya que ella teme por su seguridad, por que la señora Georgina trabaja todo el día y su casa se queda sola.
texts.en:
Sra. Georgina works as a teacher at a school for adults and is an extremely hardworking woman. She lost her house since it was located in a flooded area, but has since relocated to another area where she currently lives.

Georgina needs a loan to build a wall to the side of her house because she concerned about her safety. Since she spends all day at work, her house is unoccupied most of the time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en: Rafael K., age 38, is dedicated to raising animals in order to generate revenue from the products they provide. Rafael has earned a living from breeding sheep since he was young. His monthly income is about 150-230 AZN.  He is married with one child.  His low income isn’t enough to provide for his family and, for this reason, Rafael works enormously hard to improve their standard of living. Rafael needs to buy more sheep.  He also wants one milking cow for the milk and milk products which it can provide Rafael and his family, ensuring they will never go hungry and will always have at least cheese and yogurt. He has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: To buy one milking cow and six sheep.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Kahovka. Ludmila sells women’s clothing in one of the local markets. Her business is the only source of income for her family. Ludmila has been in this trade for 18 years. Currently, she has 30,000 grivnyas (UAH) in working capital and her net profit amounts to 8,000 UAH.

Ludmila is very focused and balanced. Her hard work in combination with financial support has promoted the stable growth of her trade. Ludmila is seeking a loan of 15,000 UAH to diversify her merchandise. A wide assortment of inventory and reasonable prices will attract many potential customers to her kiosk which will help her business to grow and expand in the future.

loans.use: To diversify assorted merchandise for resale

loans.name: Alishakh

texts.en: Alishakh S. is married and has 2 children. He runs a small grocery business in Agsu city. His shop is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day.  Alishakh has been in this business for over 10 years. Alishakh  started his business with his first loan from AqroInvest, which he successfully repaid. He is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business.  Now his monthly income is about 300-450 AZN. Alishakh is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to increase the assortment of his selling inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Alishakh 's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for his grocery.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a 12-year-old son Yegor. She is a used clothing vendor in her home town of Berdyansk. She has two vending locations: an outlet in the local mall called ‘Yuzhnyi’ and a little store in another part of town. Irina started this venture nine years ago. Presently, she is making about 10,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Irina is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to reconstruct her vending facility and stock it with merchandise. She is planning to purchase women’s used clothing at wholesale prices and then resell it as retail items. Irina is known as an entrepreneur of integrity and determination. Her commitment to her venture and her personal characteristics will help her repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: To reconstruct her vending kiosk and stock it with merchandise

loans.name: Mirzakhasan

texts.en: Mirzakhasan S. is a married father of two adorable daughters. Mirzakhasan is 49 and living in Agsu city. A farmer from junior ages, he has mastered farming techniques and always achieves good agricultural harvests, especially when the climatic conditions are favorable. The good yield, Mirzakhasan realizes, is in general due to the seeds he uses. He raises up wheat and has a big field. Current seeds have already been used for three years and are beginning to lose their productivity, and need to be replaced by new ones. However, the lack of investment capital is his current problem. For this, Mirzakhasan is asking for a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy selected seeds and fertilizers to revitalize his business. The improvement of his yield will give him the financial means to meet the needs of his family. It is second loan of Mirzakhasan from AqroInvest and he promises to pay it as accurately as he did for the first one, which was completed very successful.

loans.use: To buy selected seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with grown children. He is a small market vendor from Kahovka. Alexander earns his living selling women’s footwear in one of the local marketplaces in his home town. He started this business 13 years ago when he was forced to find ways to provide for his family. Alexander took a risk and launched his own enterprise. Currently, he has 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His turnover capital amounts to 16,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is about 9,000 Grivnyas.  

Alexander is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and increase his sale rate. He is cheerful and energetic. His customers love buying things from him as they always leave encouraged and inspired. Alexander loves communicating with people and believes his job gives him many wonderful opportunities to do so.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise and increase his sale rate

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana Carolina J. R., tiene 22 años.  Estado civil unión libre y vive con la compañera y los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 2 hijos, Miguel (2) Y Anahi (4). 

Diana es un socia de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Diana se dedica al negocio, tiene un restaurante en la ciudad. Realiza sus compras cada semana en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en restaurante en la ciudad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra en el negocio de comida. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener casa propia y ponerse un negocio más grande que el actual. Enfrenta desafíos como los precios de los productos comestibles.

Le gusta jugar fútbol y pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Diana Carolina Jimenez R. is 22 years old. She is single and she lives children and a friend. She lives in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. She has 2 children, Miguel (2 years old) and Anahi (four years old). Diana is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. It is located in the Recinto de los Amarillos region, 90 minutes from the city of Ventanas. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Diana has a restaurant in the city. She makes her purchases every week in the city of Ventanas and she sells her products in her restaurant in the city. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of food and ingredients for her business. She sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to have a house of her own and to have a larger business. The challenges she faces are the high prices of ingredients. She enjoys playing soccer and she likes taking trips with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer H. is the married father of three children. A tractor operator, Azer combines his profession with his major occupation - farming. It is a very profitable business, which requires significant financial means and physical effort.  He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them to the local bazaar traders and sometimes sells to his neighbors. 

Azer's monthly income is about 250-300 AZN and he is on the way to increase it to 500 AZN. Now he needs to expand his cultivatable land and increase his revenue. Azer is seeking a loan of 600 AZN to buy seeds and fertilizer. This will allow him to increase his production and better satisfy his clientele.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Vilayet

texts.en: Vilayet N. is 50 years old and is the father of three children. Vilayet lives in Imishly city. He and his wife are farmers who own farming land to cultivate fruits and vegetables, in particular grapes and pomegranates. At the same time, Vilayet raises cattle at his house. On their plantation, they now face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. So, Vilayet decided to ask for a loan of 900 AZN. His monthly income is about 250-300 AZN. With this loan he believes he can increase it to 500 AZN and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Martha Gricely

texts.es:
Martha Gricely, tiene 53 años.  Es soltera y vive con  los hijos.  Tiene 2 hijos, Jacinto y Duval.
 
Martha es un socia de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”.  Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Martha se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un terreno propio para construir una casa. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Martha Gricely is 46 years old. She is single and she lives with her children. She has 2 children, Jacinto and Duval. Martha is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Martha is an agriculturist and she has corn plantations. She makes her purchases every month in the city of Ventanas, location where she sells her products as well. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of corn seeds. She seeds this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to have a plot of land where to build a house. The challenges she faces are langosta infestations in her fields. She enjoys working in the fields.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase brushes, combs, dryers, tweezers, and other equipment

loans.name: Vilma Sobeida

texts.es:
Vilma Sobeida, tiene 56 años.  Es casada y vive con  la esposa y el hijo.  Tiene 1 hijo, Danilo.

Vilma es un socia de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Vilma se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un terreno propio para construir una casa. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta dedicar tiempo a Dios.
texts.en:
Vilma Sobeida is 56 years old. She is married and she lives with her husband and their son named Danilo. Vilma is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Vilma is an agriculturist, having corn plantations. She carries out her purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of corn seeds. She sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to have a plot of land where to build her own home. The challenges she faces are langosta infestations and blights in her fields. She enjoys dedicating her time to God.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn seed.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto, de 25 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de su esposa Haydee de 28 años y de sus 2 pequeños hijos, juntos habitan un tranquilo paraje de la fría sierra central peruana. Cada día es diferente para este trabajador de campo, pues se despierta con los primeros rayos de sol y se dirige a vigilar sus chacras. Luego de pasar toda la mañana vigilando con dedicación sus plantas de papa y olluco, se alista para regresar a su casa y en su establo le esperan sus carneros que los saca a pastar, en compañía y apoyo de su esposa. Manifiesta que le gusta mucho el trabajo agrícola porque es bastante apacible y rentable, logra vender la papa y el olluco que produce a regulares precios, en cuanto le toca momentos de escasez o alguna deuda pendiente, vende algunos de sus animales en la feria de su ciudad. En adelante tiene muchos planes entre ellos comprar un terreno para sembrar en cantidad pues quiere mejorar sus ganancias. Es el décimo crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas pues quiere continuar trabajando para salir adelante, además esta muy satisfecho con el trabajo de su grupo ya que esta integrado por personas bastante responsables. Alberto tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes, pues desea que la producción de la próxima campaña sea mas fructífera.
texts.en:
Alberto is 25 years old and lives in his parent’s house. He lives there with them, his wife Haydee, who is 28 years old, and their 2 small children. They live together in a quiet spot in the cold mountainous region in central Peru. Every day is different for this agricultural worker. He gets up when the sun rises and sets out to take care of his fields. After spending the morning carefully tending his potato and olluco (root crop) plants, he is ready to head back to his rams waiting in the stable. He takes them out to graze, accompanied and supported by his wife. He says he likes agricultural work a lot because it is quite gentle and profitable. He manages to sell the potatoes and olluco he grows at reasonable prices. Whenever he goes through a period of crop shortage or has any debt outstanding, he sells some of his animals at the market in the city. He has many plans for the future, among them to purchase a plot of land on which to sow in large quantities, as he wants to increase his profits. This is his tenth loan with MFP, and he promises to make all his repayments on time because he wishes to continue working to move forward. He is also very satisfied with the work of his group because it is made up of quite responsible people. Alberto plans to invest the loan requested in the purchase of manure and fertilisers, as he wants to make his next growing season more fruitful.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertiliser.

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: Dora Maria tiene 30 años, su actividad es la venta de refrescos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, pues con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ha logrado mantenerlo activo. Esta actividad inicio con la idea de sufragar los gastos del hogar, para ella esto es muy importante Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad comprar frutas, hielo, bolsas, pajillas y azúcar esto debido a que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar todos sus gastos familiares. Ella desea tener un negocio muchos más grandes.
texts.en:
Dora Maria is 30 years old and sells soft drinks for a living. She has had this business for more than 3 years and has worked very hard and carefully to to keep it running. Her business activity started with the idea of wanting to meet household costs, as this is very important for her. She is requesting a loan which will enable her to buy fruit, ice, bags, drinking straws and sugar, since she doesn't have enough money to buy these things herself. It is very important to make these purchases because this business allows her to cover all her living costs. She wants to have a much bigger business in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with a son. He is a businessman from Novomoskovsk, where he runs a small trade selling office supplies. Sergei owns a kiosk in the central city market. He launched his trade 10 years ago. Currently, he has about 35,000 Grivnyas invested in his business. 

Sergei has used Kiva loans before and was able to extend his business to three locations providing workplaces for his wife and sister. He is known as a consistent and honest entrepreneur who tries to have a proactive attitude in life. 

This time Sergei is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase more inventory. He hopes to increase the sales and make more income to take better care of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Artemia

texts.es: Artemia, D. 58 años, vive en su casa propia  a lado D. su esposo Lucio D. 62 años y sus 2 hijos que son jóvenes, juntos habitan un tranquilo paraje D. la sierra central peruana. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a las labores agrícolas desD. muy joven, y en la actualidad siembra papa, olluco y oca en sus chacras que son propias. Realiza su labor en compañía D. su familia, y dice que le gusta mucho cuidar los campos con esmero, porque luego D. un tiempo recoge su producción, y la comercializa a los mayoristas D. la ciudad que le ofrecen buenos precios y le compran todos sus productos porque son D. calidad. Considera que su actividad es muy rentable porque le permite vivir cómodamente, paralelamente a esta actividad, se dedica a la comercialización D. carne D. res y cordero, que compra al por mayor y venD. al por menor, D. esta manera se genera algunas ganancias extras. Como es una mujer que a pesar D. su avanzada edad, lucha cada día por salir adelante, en adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además D. comprar algunas cabezas D. reses, para criarlas y comercializarlas ante cualquier emergencia. Es el onceavo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, para continuar progresando, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar progresando. Tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. carne al por mayor para agilizar su negocio, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir, y espera obtener regulares ganancias con su inversión.
texts.en:
Artemia is 58 years old and lives in her own house with her husband Lucio, who is 62 years old, and their 2 young children. They live together in a quiet spot in the central mountains of Peru. This hard working woman has worked in agriculture since she was young, and currently grows potato, olluco and oca in her own fields. She works with her family and says that she very much likes taking care of the fields. She does so very thoroughly because after a time she collects the produce and sells it to wholesalers in the city. They offer her good prices and buy all her products because they are good quality. She considers her activity to be profitable because it allows her to live comfortably. AlongsiD. this work, she also sells beef and lamb, which she buys wholesale and retails in order to generate a little extra income. She is a woman who, despite her advanced years, struggles each day to move forward. In the future she plans to sow greater quantities and to buy some cattle to breed and sell in case of emergency. This is Artemia's eleventh loan with MFP, and she promises to make her repayments on time to continue progressing. She is also very grateful to all the people who provided the money that will allow her to continue making progress. She plans to invest the loan requested in the purchase of wholesale meat to improve her business, as she has several orders to meet and hopes to make a regular income from her investment.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef to increase her income.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: La señora Ana Sánchez es Originaria de la Ciudad de León y se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente para llevar el sustento a su mesa y así suplir todas y cada una de las necesidades de su hogar. Es importante destacar que ella es muy trabajadora y la razón por la que hoy en día está solicitando el crédito es para ser invertido directame en el pago de los estudios de su hijo porque así lo necesita y es de importancia destacar que su sueño es llegar a ver a su hijo convertido en un gran profesional para bendición de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. is originally from the city of Leon and she is a cook. Her family is made up of two minors. She has a small house that she has been improving with her own funds. This is her eighth loan provided through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and it will be used to cover personal medical expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover the university tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Juan Víctor

texts.es:
Juan C. es  de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 25 años y  está cursando el 5° año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad de Villarrica (UNVES).

Su madre es ama de casa y su padre es empleado de la fabrica AFSA (Azucarera Friedman S.A), vive con ellos, es soltero.

Juan  actualmente trabaja con la empresa Profarco desempeñándose como preventista hace más de 3  años percibiendo un salario mensual de Gs 2.000.000 gracias a su esfuerzo ayuda a sus padres y hermanitos y esta pudiendo cubrir sus gastos de estudio.

Juan  tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y ser un buen profesional para así poder algún día montar su propia empresa y ser exitoso en la vida.
 
El solicita para la compra de algunos libros contables que necesita para estudiar y para el pago de su mensualidad y otros gastos de su facultad.
texts.en:
Juan C. is 25 years old and lives in the city of Villarrica. He is in his 5th year at the University of Villarrica (UNVES) studying business administration. He is single and lives with his parents. His mother is a housekeeper and his father is employed by the AFSA (Azucarera Friedman S.A.) factory. Juan has been working for a company called Profarco as a sales coordinator (presales) for more than 3 years. He receives a monthly salary of Gs 2,000,000. With effort and the help of his parents and siblings, he is able to cover his school expenses. Juan wants very much to finish school and to be a good professional so that some day he can start his own business and be successful in life. He is requesting a loan to buy accounting books that he needs to study, to make his monthly payments and to cover other school expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make his monthly payments and to buy school supplies such as books

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria Eugenia tiene 24 años. Esta no es la primera experiencia que obtiene en financiamientos pues siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Hasta los momentos ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable  con sus cuotas, Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Tiene más de 6 años con este negocio pues con el paso del tiempo ha logrado obtener experiencia y también aprender a relacionarse con sus clientes y satisfacer la demanda. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes. Pues su juventud le da cierta ventaja ya que tiene muchos clientes que son jóvenes y sabe bien el tipo de ropa que les gusta.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia is 24 years old. This is not her first experience obtaining loans; she always looks for ways to improve her income. So far she has shown herself to be very responsible with her payments. Her economic activity is selling clothes. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. As time has passed, she has gained experience and has also learned to relate to her customers and meet the demand. This loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and suits. Her youth gives her a certain advantage because many of her customers are young and she knows what type of clothes they like.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Livinston Jahir

texts.es:
Livinston Jahir M. J., tiene 22 años.  Es soltero vive con los padres,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Livinston es un socio de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Livinston  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, cacao y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz, cacao y fréjol Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un terreno propio para construir una casa. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Livinston Jahir M. Jimenez is 22 years old. He is single and he lives with his parents. They live in the city of Ventanas, of the province of Los Rios. He has no children. Livinston is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. It is located in the Recinto de los Amarillos region, 90 minutes from the city of Ventanas. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Livinston is an agriculturist, sowing corn, cocoa and beans. He makes his purchases and sales every month in the city of Ventanas. He request a loan to invest in the purchase of corn, cocoa, and bean seeds. He sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to have a plot of land where to build his own home. The challenges he faces are blights and langosta infestations in his fields. He enjoys playing sports.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, cocoa and bean seeds.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es: Damiana, de 39 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 jóvenes hijos, que le ayudan en las labores agrícolas. Desde que se quedo sola a cargo de sus 3 hijos, se propuso trabajar con más dedicación, y así siguió con la siembra de papa y olluco en sus chacras que son propias, y cuando sus hijos estuvieron jóvenes empezaron a ayudarle en tan sacrificada labor. Desde entonces los 4 trabajan cada día para salir adelante, vigilan con mucho cuidado sus cultivos, sobretodo de las plagas de insectos que muchas veces malogran producciones enteras. Durante la época de cosecha recoge toda la producción y la traslada hasta donde están los mayoristas de la ciudad, que le ofrecen regulares precios por la calidad de sus productos naturales. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado comprar algunas cabezas de vacas para criarlos y poder comercializar su leche, además quiere terminar de construir su casa. Es el onceavo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de todas sus cuotas pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso, también  esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo comunal pues esta integrado por personas muy solidarias y responsables. Tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes y abono, además destinará una parte del préstamo en la paga del jornal de los operarios que ha contratado para que la ayuden en la siembra.
texts.en:
Damiana is 39 years old. She lives in her own house with her 3 young children who help her in her agricultural work. Ever since she found herself raising 3 children alone, she decided to dedicate herself to her work even more. She continued planting potatoes and olluco in her own fields. When her children were young, they began to help her in this very laborious work. Since then, the four of them work every day to get ahead. They watch over their crops very carefully, especially guarding against the insect pests that often ruin entire crops. During harvest, she takes all of the prudiction and transports it to the wholesalers in town, who offer regular prices for the quality of her natural products. Since she is a very enterprising woman, in the future she plans to buy some heads of cattle in order to raise them and sell their milk. She also wants to finish building her house. This is the eleventh loan that she has with MFP and she promises to make all the payments on time because she is very grateful to the people who made this loan possible which will allow her to continue working and looking to progress. She is also very satisfied with the work in her community group because it is made up of people who are very supportive and responsible. She plans on investing the loan she has asked for in buying organic and chemical fertilizers. A portion of it will also be used to pay for the work of the laborers whom she has hired to help in the planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for the laborers who help in the planting.

loans.name: Segundo Jasmany

texts.es:
Segundo Jasmany H. C., tiene 27 años.  Es soltero vive con los padres,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Segundo es un socio de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Segundo  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y cacao Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un terreno propio para construir una casa. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Segundo Jasmany H. C. is 27 years old. He is single and he lives with is parents. He lives in the city of Ventanas, of the province of Los Rios. He has no children. Segundo is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. It is located in the Recinto de los Amarillos region, 90 minutes from the city of Ventanas. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Segundo is an agriculturist, sowing corn and cocoa. The makes his purchases and sales every month in the city of Ventanas. He requests a loan to invest in the purchase of corn and cocoa seeds. He sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to have a plot of land where to build his own home. The challenges he faces are blights and langosta infestations in his fields. He enjoys playing sports.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of corn and cocoa seeds.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is divorced. She sells men's clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk. Olga has been in this business for three years. Even though she went though some serious hardships - divorce, death of her mother and medical surgery for her son - Olga is working hard to make this business a success. She knows her inventory well and enjoys selling it.

Olga would like to borrow 9,000 Grivnyas to increase her inventory. She hopes to make additional income and help her son's family financially.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Duval Nicolás

texts.es:
Duval Nicolás A. S., tiene 19 años.  Es soltero vive con la hermana,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Duval es un socio de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Duval  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y cacao Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es seguir con el trabajo de producción e incrementar al negocio. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta hacer deporte especialmente el fútbol.
texts.en:
Duval Nicolas A. Suarez is 19 years old. He is single and he lives with his sister in the city of Ventanas, of the Los Rios province. He has no children. Duval is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. It is located in the Recinto de los Amarillos region, 90 minutes from the city of Ventanas. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Duval is an agriculturist and he sows corn and cocoa. He makes his purchases and sales every month in the city of Ventanas. He requests a loan to invest in the purchase of corn and cocoa seeds. He sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to have a plot of land where to build his own home. The challenges he faces are blights and langosta infestations in his fields. He enjoys playing soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of corn and cocoa seeds.

loans.name: Cristián Adolfo

texts.es:
Cristián Adolfo G. L., tiene 24 años.  Es soltero vive con los abuelitos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Cristian es un socio de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Cristian se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y cacao Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es incrementar la producción para obtener mas ganancias y comprar una casa. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Cristian Adolfo Garcia L. is 24 years old. He is single and he lives with his grandparents. They live in the city of Ventanas, of the province of Los Rios. He does not have any children. Cristian is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. It is located in the Recinto de los Amarillos region, 90 minutes from the city of Ventanas. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Cristian is an agriculturist, sowing corn and cocoa. He makes his purchases and sales every month in the city of Ventanas. Cristian requests a loan to purchase corn and cocoa seeds. He sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to increase his production to improve his earnings and purchase a house. The challenges he faces are blights and langosta infestations in his fields. He enjoys participating in sports.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of corn and cocoa seeds.

loans.name: Guido Efrain

texts.es:
Guido de 46 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, el tiene una pequeña papelería y fotocopiadora. 
El tuvo que dejar su trabajo para poder estar mas tiempo con sus hijos, pero como no tenia ingresos suficientes invirtió sus ahorros en papelería para vender a sus vecinos, poco a poco con esfuerzo obtuvo su local, ahora trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.    

Para surtir mas su tienda el quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería y cuadernos. En el futuro quiere aumentar su negocio y tener un almacén.
texts.en:
Guido is 46 years old and lives in an urban zone in a suburb of Guayaquil. He has a small office supply store and photocopier. He had to leave his job to be able to spend more time with his children, but since he did not earn enough money he invested his savings in office supplies to sell them to his neighbors. Bit by bit and with effort he got his own store. Now he works from 7:00 am until 10:00 pm every day. With the loan he wants to buy paper and notebooks to stock his store. In the future he wants to expand his business and have a department store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, paper

loans.name: Guillermo Joel

texts.es:
Guillermo Joel A. S., tiene 23 años.  Es soltero vive con la madre y la hermana,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Guillermo es un socio de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Guillermo se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y cacao Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para comprar terreno para seguir trabajando. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Guillermo Joel A. S., 23, is single and lives with his mother and sister in Ventanas, Los Ríos province. He doesn’t have any children. He is a member of the “San Jose de los Amarillos” communal bank located in Los Amarillos an hour and a half from Ventanas. It has 23 members most of whom are farmers. This is their second loan with Cooperativa San José. Guillermo is a corn and cacao farmer. He makes his purchases monthly in Ventanas and his sales are done there too. He is asking for funds to buy corn and cacao. He feels that the loans are an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have enough money to buy land to continue farming. He faces challenges like pests and plant diseases like locusts in the hearts of the plants. He enjoys sports.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and cacao.

loans.name: Dedicacion

texts.es: Dedicación, de 44 años, viuda, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de sus 3 jóvenes hijos, quienes le ayudan en las labores agrícolas. Se dedica en la siembra y cosecha de productos naturales y en la actualidad sus tierras producen papa, olluco y oca. Confiesa que luego de días de esforzada labor en el campo, pues debe madrugar todos los días a lado de sus hijos para cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas de insectos y de las variaciones climáticas. Se siente recompensada cuando recoge toda su buena producción y carga los pesados sacos de sus productos naturales hasta el mercado mayorista de su ciudad para comercializarlos a sus compradores, y como sus productos son de calidad obtiene regulares ganancias, que le permiten vivir cómodamente. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que lo realiza en compañía de sus hijos, y pasan trabajando gran parte del día. Como es una mujer bastante emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además de comprar un terreno más, pues tiene el anhelo de dejar muy bien a sus hijos cuando ella les falte. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, pues quiere devolver la confianza que depositan en ella, además esta muy agradecida no solo con las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo, si no también con los miembros de su grupo comunal que demostraron ser muy responsables y solidarios cuando trabajan juntos. Tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono para mejorar la productividad de sus campos, de esta manera espera continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Dedicación, 44 years old and a widow, lives in her own house with her three young children who help her with her agricultural work. She plants and sows produce. Her land currently produces potatoes, "olluco" (a starchy tuber similar to potatoes) and "oca" (a small waxy crinkled tuber). She confides that she works hard in the field. She must wake up very early every day and start taking care of her produce remediating blights and weather variations alongside her children. She feels rewarded when she has a good crop and takes the heavy bags of produce to her town's wholesale market to sell it to her buyers. Since she has good quality produce she obtains a regular income which allows her to live comfortably. What she likes the most about her job is the fact that she does it alongside her children and they spend good part of the day working. Being an entrepreneurial woman, she wants to buy another lot of land to leave to her children once she passes away. This is the second credit she has with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time. She wants to reward the trust that has been deposited in her. She is also very thankful not only to the people who made the loan possible but also to the members of her community group who have proven to be responsible and caring when they work together. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizer to increase her fields' productivity. She hopes this will help her continue to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar, de 33 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa Norma de 27 años y sus 2 pequeños hijos, juntos habitan en un apacible paraje de la sierra central peruana. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió observando como sus padres y vecinos comuneros preparaban juntos la tierra para que produzca en grandes cantidades. En la actualidad este trabajador hombre se dedica a la siembra de papa y avena, aunque confiesa que el trabajo es algo tedioso, pues el cuidado de sus cultivos debe ser a diario, y desde muy tempranas horas, asegura que la recompensa a su labor es cuando recoge toda su cosecha, y la traslada al mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Luego de las considerables ventas a sus compradores de siempre, puede invertir las ganancias en los gastos de su  hogar. Edgar dice que gusta mucho de las labores de campo y como si fuera poco también se dedica a la crianza de animales, tiene regular cantidad de ovejas, que comercializa de vez en cuando en las ferias de su ciudad. Como es un hombre emprendedor, para mas adelante tiene planeado comprar mayor cantidad de animales, pues sabe que en este negocio se obtiene buenas rentas. Es el onceavo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues sabe que solo si es responsable logrará cumplir con todas sus metas, además le gusta mucho el trabajo con su grupo comunal, porque esta integrado por personas muy trabajadoras. Con el crédito que solicita, tiene planeado comprar abono que necesita para mejorar la productividad de la próxima campaña de siembra que se encuentra cerca, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Edgar, 33, lives in his own house with his wife, Norma, 27, and their two small children. They live in a pleasant spot in the Peruvian central mountain range. From a very young age he has been a farmer. He learned farming watching how his parents and neighbors prepared the soil together so that it would produce large crops. He currently farms potatoes and oats. Although he confesses that the work is somewhat tedious, for crop care is a daily routine that starts very early in the morning, he assures us that the rewards for his labor arrive at harvest time and when the crops are taken for sale to the city’s wholesale market. Once the considerable sales to his usual buyers are completed he can use the profits to meet household expenses. Edgar says that he enjoys farming very much and, as if this weren’t enough, he also raises animals; he has several sheep that he sells at his city’s livestock fairs. He knows that this business produces good profits. This is his 11th loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion because he realizes that only if he’s responsible will he reach all his goals. Besides, he enjoys working in his communal group because it’s composed of very hard working people. He plans to use the requested funds to buy manure that he needs to improve production in his next planting cycle which will be soon. He hopes thus to continue to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure for the next planting cycle.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 30 años, su actividad es la venta de llantas y servicios de vulcanización, por iniciativa propia empezó desde pequeño como aprendiz cuando creció para poder mantener a su familia y por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que trabajar muy joven, su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda, pues siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materia prima necesaria para su actividad, en el futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda y obtener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Oscar, 30, sells tires and tire repair services. He started out by his own initiative as an apprentice when still very young. As he got older, because of lack of employment opportunities and needing to support his family, he had to go to work while still very young. His shop is located in his home and he’s always aware of what his customers are requesting from him. He will use the loan to buy raw materials for his work. In the future he’d like to make some home improvements and acquire another business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and supplies.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha de 23 años, tiene un pequeño Cyber hace unos años atrás, es madre soltera, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Ella comenzó con el negocio del Cyber trabajando solo con una computadora, como en el sector por donde vive era mucha la demanda, decidió comprar otra computadora, así poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22:00pm. Para tener oto ingreso adicional también vende pescado. 

Para poder incrementar las computadoras quiere comprar con el préstamo computadoras y pescado. En el futuro quiere tener una línea de Cyber.
texts.en:
Martha, 23, has had a small Internet access service for a few years. She’s a single mother and lives along Guayaquil’s Beltway (a periurban zone surrounded by a salty estuary). She began her business with just one computer. Because demand in her area is large she decided to buy another computer and gradually increase her profits. Now, she’s open for business from 8am until 10pm. To earn extra income she also sells fish. She wants to use the loan to buy more computers and also to buy fish. In the future, she’d like to own an Internet line.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computers and fish.

loans.name: Encuentro Con Jesus  4 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group. Encuentro de Jesus 4 (encounter with Jesus). She lives in a simple structure with her husband and two children. She says that her most difficult challenges are spiritual. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying attending church and worshiping the Lord.

Maria is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 5 years. She started with some clothing a friend gave her. She focused and invested all the sales. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, oil, beans and a bag of used cloths. She will use the profits to reinvest and meet any needs at home.

This Esperanza associate began with us because "In Esperanza I found support". Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, beans and a bag of used cloths

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Eduardo es cliente antiguo  lleva trabajando junto a nosotros desde el año 2005 vino a la institución por recomendación de otro cliente, el se encuentra atravesando la decima tercera secuencia.  La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de celulares, repuestos de los mismo, cámaras fotográficas, filmadoras y otros mas, la misma que la desarrolla en  una galería de la zona gran poder, tienda  que es bastante concurrida por la clientela.  La familia del Señor U. esta compuesta por su esposa y sus tres hijos los cuales se encuentran en etapa de estudios es por ellos que desea superarse y darles una mejor vida y estudios.  El destino del crédito será la compra de celulares y flash memory con los cuales surtirá su negocio.
texts.en:
Eduardo has been a client for a long time. He has been working with the institution, which a friend recommended, since 2005. He is in his 13th cycle. He sells cell phones, replacement parts for cell phones, cameras, movie cameras, and other items. He sells from a store, which is much frequented by customers, in the Gran Poder area. Mr. U.’s family is comprised of his wife and their three children. The children attend school. He wishes to do well for his children, and he wants to give them a better life and education. He will use the loan to buy cell phones and flash memories cards to stock his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cell phones to stock his business

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Flor María es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside en el distrito de San José, una zona que tiene a la pesca como principal actividad econímica. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la venta de pescado seco – salado. Ella adquiere con frecuencia pescado fresco en el terminal pesquero de la región (a 45 minutos de la zona en donde vive), eventualmente lo compra también a los pescadores que desembarcan en su distrito. Ella procesa el pescado y lo vende en los diversos mercados de la región. Adicionalmente cuenta con una pequeña bodega que tiene instalada en su domicilio gracias a las ganancias que percibe de su negocio de venta de pescado.

Flor desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pescado, de modo que pueda ampliar su producción y sus ventas. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar su objetivo. Con el dinero de este préstamo ella espera brindarle a su negocio el impulso que necesita para salir adelante.

Flor María es una mujer trabajadora y bastante emprendedora. Las ganancias que percibe de sus actividades las utiliza en colaborar con el sustento de los gastos económicos de su familia. Ella espera seguir creciendo como empresaria para asegurarle a los suyos un futuro establey próspero.
texts.en:
Flor María is a 34 year mother who lives in the San José district. The area’s main economic activity is fishing. It belongs to the Lambayeque province, which is over 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling dried and salted fish for ten years. She gets fresh fish often at the regional fishing terminal (45 minutes from the area where she lives). Sometimes she also buys from the fishermen who disembark in her district. She processes the fish, and she sells it in different regional markets. She also has a small store in her house, thanks to the income she gets from her business of selling fish. She wishes to expand her business by purchasing more fish. That way she will be able to increase her production and her sales. In order to do this she believes it is advisable to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This will allow her to reach her objective. She hopes that the loan will give her business the impulse it needs to get ahead. María is a hard-working and very enterprising woman. She uses the earnings that she gets from her activities to help with her family’s living expenses. She hopes to keep growing as a businesswoman in order to assure her loved ones of a stable and prosperous future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 40 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su madre Lucia de 60 años, juntos habitan en la tranquilidad de un paraje de la sierra central peruana. Aunque todavía no tiene familia este trabajador hombre labora todos los días con mucha dedicación, pues desea brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su madre. 

Es por eso que se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa y oca en los terrenos que posee. Cuando es tiempo de siembra contrata operarios que la ayudan en la labor, y también cuando debe recoger los pesados sacos de sus productos naturales, durante la cosecha. 

Dice que aunque es algo tedioso vigilar sus plantaciones a diario para que no se pierdan por causa de la plaga de insectos. La  recompensa a todo su sacrificio se manifiesta cuando vende su producción a regulares precios a los mayoristas de la ciudad, además se dedica a la crianza de ovejas, que comercializa de vez en cuando en las ferias de su comunidad. 

Como tiene muchos planes a futuro para mas adelante quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad y comprar algunas ovejas para criarlas y comercializarlas después a mayor precio. 

Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente, porque sabe que solo así alcanzara el tan anhelado progreso y podrá brindarle una estabilidad económica a su madre, también dice que esta muy satisfecho con el desempeño de su grupo comunal ya que esta compuesto por personas responsables y solidarias. 

Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono y fertilizantes que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras, pues quiere obtener mayores ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Juan, age 40, lives in his own house with his 60 year old mother, Lucia. They live together peacefully in a parish on the central Peruvian mountain range. Even though he does not yet have a family, this hard-working man labors with great dedication everyday. He wishes to give his mother a good quality of life. That is why he devotes himself to farming. He plants potatoes and “oca” (an edible root) on the land that he has. When it is planting time he hires laborers to help with the work. He also does this when he needs to pick up the heavy sacks of his natural products during the harvest. He says that even though it is somewhat tedious to watch over his crops everyday so that he does not lose them to insect infestations, he is compensated for all of his sacrifice. The compensation occurs when he sells his production at the usual price to the city’s wholesalers. He also raises sheep, and he sells them every now and then at the community fairs. He has many plans for the future in order to get ahead. He wants to plant in greater quantity, and he wants to buy some sheep to raise and later sell for a greater price. This is his fifth loan with MFP. He pledges to make his payments punctually. He knows that it is the only way to make the desired progress and to be able to give her mother financial stability. He also says that he is very happy with his communal bank’s performance. It is comprised of responsible and supportive people. He will use the requested loan to buy the natural and chemical fertilizer that he needs to improve his land’s production. He wants to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve his land's production

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan de 54 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Paraíso” lugar caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Comenzó hace 22 años con la tienda para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo  legumbres y granos completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña tienda en su casa. Ahora el vende todo tipo de víveres. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  

Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar legumbres, granos y una vitrina, en el futuro quiere trasladar su casa y negocio en un lugar mas seguro.
texts.en:
Juan, 54, has a small store in the front of his house. He lives in a neighborhood on the outskirts of Guayaquil called "Paraiso," a place characterized by its dirt roads. He started his store 22 years ago to support his family, selling vegetables and grains. He saved up some money so that he could put a small store in his house. Now he sells all types of food. He works from 6:30am until 8pm every day. In order to continue with his business he wants to buy vegetables, grains and a glass display case. In the future he wants to move his home and his business to a safer place.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables and rice

loans.name: Lizeth Noemi

texts.es: La Señorita Lizeth viene por recomendación de sus padres que también son clientes de la institucion ellos se dedican a la confección de chamarras, la cliente tiene un puesto de venta en la calle Illampu, en la cual vende chamarras importadas Coreanas, la misma que adquiere por cantidad. Ella vive en la casa de sus papas de la zona alto Chijini, además medio tiempo se dedica a estudiar en la Universidad ya que ella tiene ganas de superarse y tener un mejor futuro.  la inversión del préstamo será para la compra de dos cajas de chamarras para surtir el negocio.
texts.en:
Lizeth comes on the recommendation of her parents who are also clients of this institution; they make jackets. Lizeth has a post on the Llampu road where she sells jackets imported from Korea, which she buys in bulk. She lives in her parent's home in the Alto Chijini neighborhood. In addition, half of the time she is studying at the University, since she has a desire to succeed and have a better future. She will invest this loan in the purchase of 2 boxes of jackets to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy 2 boxes of jackets

loans.name: Turi Centro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Turi Centro esta formado por un grupo de 11 mujeres luchadoras que trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante  a sus familias. Viven por diferentes partes de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta es una ciudad hermosa por sus iglesias, su centro histórico, los cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad, su variada gastronomía y especialmente por su gente.

La Señora María Lastenia I. vive en por el sector de Turi, tiene 49 años , es casada, y tiene 6 hijos de 32,30, 28, 25, 22, 19 años de edad, cuatro de sus hijos son casados y viven de manera independiente, su hija de 25 años de edad trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su hijo de 19 años estudia en el colegio, su esposo se dedica a pintar casas, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad, la lograron construir con el sacrificio conyugal.
María se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a la cría de animales domésticos como: pollos y cuyes. Lleva trabajando con los créditos de la banca comunal 3 años, el nuevo crédito que LA FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su  sueño es tener una máquina de coser.

La Señora Blanca Esperanza A. vive en el sector de  Don Bosco, se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, pero le gustaría emprender el negocio de venta de cosméticos YANBAL. Es su primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y fue su hermana la que la incentivó para formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras, el crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de productos  YANBAL,
Doña Blanca tiene 40 años, vive en unión libre y  tiene 2 hijos de 22 y 20 años de edad, sus hijos son económicamente independientes y viven en el extranjero, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que habita no es de su propiedad por lo que vive arrendando. Su sueño es viajar a New York.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Turi Centro" is formed by a group of 11 tenacious women who work very hard to provide for their families. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This is a beautiful city that is known for its churches, its historic center, the four rivers that surround the city, its varied cuisine, and especially for its people. María Lastenia I. lives in the Turi neighborhood. She is 49 years old, married, and has 6 children aged 32, 30, 25, 22 and 19 years of age. Four of her children are married and live independently. Her 25 year-old daughter works and helps her economically and her 19 year-old son studies in school. Her husband paints houses. They live in their own home, which the couple managed to build with a lot of sacrifice. Maria is in charge of the household chores and also raises domestic animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. She has taken loans from the communal bank for 3 years. With the new loan from the FUNDACION ESPOIR, she will invest in the purchase of chickens. Her dream is to have a sewing machine. Blanca Esperanza A. lives in the Don Bosco neighborhood. She carries out the household chores, but also would like to start a business selling Yanbal brand cosmetics. This is the first loan she is taking from the communal bank; it was her sister who motivated her to become part of this group of women who are determined to succeed. She will use the loan from the FUNDACION ESPOIR to buy Yanbal products. Blanca is 40 years old, and lives with a partner. She has 2 children aged 22 and 20 years; her children are economically independent and live outside the country. Her husband is a farmer. The house that they live in is not their property; they are renting. Her dream is to travel to New York.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens and Yanbal brand cosmetics

loans.name: Generación 2006 Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “GENERACION 2006” está iniciando su quinto ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.   Este grupo consta de diez socias,  es decir que las socias más antiguas están alrededor de dos años y medio en nuestra institución;  a la cabeza se encuentra la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas.

La  señora María Eugenia, tesorera de la asociación, comenta que ya está cuatro ciclos en la asociación. Su negocio es ambulante, venta de artículos de necesidad común, como pañales, papel higiénico y otros, cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana, está casada y tiene dos hijos.  Su primer crédito fue de Bs.1200.- y le sirvió para comprar mercadería, ahora está solicitando Bs.2000, el mismo que también le servirá para comprar mercadería.

En relación al resto de los integrantes la A.C. “Generación 2006” también tienen sus propios negocios, como ser venta de productos Yanbal, venta de varios, Venta de pañales y papel higiénico, venta de galletas, dulces y varios, venta de abarrotes ambulante, distribuidor mercantil, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa de bebé, tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The community group "Generacion 2006" is starting its 5th loan cycle with "Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación." This group has 10 members, and the oldest members have been with the institution for 2 1/2 years. At the head of the group is the president, the treasurer, and the recording secretary. María Eugenia, the group treasurer, comments that she has already been through 4 loan cycles with the group. She has a mobile business selling things everyone needs like paper tissues, toilet paper, and others. Her sister helps with the business. She is married and has two children. Her first loan was Bs. 1200 and she used it to buy merchandise. Now she is requesting Bs. 2000 and this will also be used to buy merchandise. With regard to the other members of the "Generacion 2006" group, they also have their own businesses such as selling beauty products from Yanbal; selling various goods; selling paper tissues and toilet paper; selling cookies, candies, etc; a mobile grocery store; a commercial distributor; selling cosmetics; selling baby clothes; and a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paper tissues and toilet paper

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: Doña Silvia tiene 52 años D. edad tiene una hija ya granD. y está estudiando Derecho en la Universidad. Ella tiene su negocio que consiste en una Farmacia donD. da consultas y venD. los medicamentos. Con la farmacia tiene 16 años D. estar funcionando, pero le falta capital para poder surtir y equipar la farmacia, y siendo una gran líder reúne a otras once señoras y forman el Banco Comunal llamado El Carmen el cual es nombrado así por su ubicación. Lo que ella espera y sueña es que su farmacia sea granD. y poder abrir una sucursal contando con la ayuda D. Dios y D. su hija quien le brinda tambien su apoyo.
texts.en:
Silvia is 52 years old and has a grown daughter who is studying law at the university. She has a pharmacy where she gives consultations and sells medicine. Silvia has been in business for 16 years, but she lacks capital to stock and equip the pharmacy. Silvia is a great leader who brought together 11 other ladies to form the communal bank, El Carmen, which is named for its location. With God's help and her daughter's support, Silvia hopes that one day her pharmacy will be large enough to open another branch.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for pharmacy

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery, de 27 años, vive a lado de su madre y de sus 2 pequeños  hijos, pues su esposo trabaja en el extranjero en busca de un futuro mejor. Esta alegre y trabajadora mujer se dedica a las labores agrícolas, y desde muy pequeña observaba como realizaban las labores sus padres, y así aprendió las técnicas necesarias para cultivar con mucho cuidado la tierra. Y en la actualidad siembra papa y olluco, con la ayuda de operarios que contrata, logra obtener una mayor producción. Cuando es tiempo de cosecha recoge todos sus productos y los coloca en pesados sacos, en el que son trasladados en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, donde los vende a regulares precios. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de carne de carnero al por menor, así se genera mejores ganancias. De esta manera ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, es por ello que tiene planeado comprar algunas cabezas de reses para aumentar su producción y ganar más. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el credito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Mery tiene planeado invertir el crédito que solicita en la compra de carne que luego los  comercializará a sus comerciantes minoritarios, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
Mery is 27 years old and lives with her mother and her two young children because her husband works abroad in search of a better future.
