This cheerful and hardworking woman earns her living by farming. As a little girl, Mery watched her parents complete their work. She learned the techniques required to cultivate and care for the land. Mery currently grows potatoes and ulluco with the help of hired laborers in order to obtain the greatest production. During the harvest season, all of her products are gathered and placed in heavy sacks before being transported to the wholesale market in the city where they are sold at regular prices. In addition, Mery sells mutton on a small scale in order to generate additional income so that her children can get ahead. She has plans to buy a few heads of cattle so that she can increase her production and earn more.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. Mery promises to be prompt with her loan payments. She expresses her thanks to everyone who made this loan possible since it will allow her to continue working. Mery plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of meat that she will sell later to the informal merchants who have placed several orders with her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat for distribution to the informal merchants

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es el  Sr. Claudio; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos,  el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de repuestos para autos, el distribuye auto partes;  El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el capital de negocio y comprar repuestos.    

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Claudio is a member of the communal bank "UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO." The bank is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco. Sr. Claudio is 45 years old and is married with 3 children. He buys, sells, and distributes auto parts. Claudio is seeking a loan to invest in business capital and to buy auto parts. He is grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Requesting a loan to invest in business capital and to buy auto parts

loans.name: Luz Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz;  La socia tiene 27 años de edad;  ella es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos y se dedica a la administración de su tienda abarrotes, ella necesita el préstamo para aumentar e implementar su tienda abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.   

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Communal Bank “Unidos Para El Triunfo” (United for Victory), which is located in the district of Huanchac in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Luz is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. She manages a grocery store and needs a loan to increase her inventory and keep her store in operation. Luz is requesting this loan so that she can purchase basic necessities.

She appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities to restock her store

loans.name: Luz Veane

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Veane;  La socia  tiene 39 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, ella  trabaja en su propia imprenta desde hace 12 años y  es madre soltera, la socia sola educa y se hace cargo de todos los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus menores hijos, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el capital de la imprenta y comprar papel y tinta para las maquinas y aceites.   

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz Veane is a member of the Communal Bank “Unidos Para El Triunfo” (United for Victory), which is located in the district of Huanchac in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 39 years old and has four children. Sra. Luz Veane has managed her own printing business for the past twelve years. Being a single mother, she is solely responsible for all of the household expenses and the education of her young children. Luz Veane is requesting this loan to invest as capital in her printing business. She will buy paper and ink for her machines, as well as oils.

Luz Veane appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

El socio necesita este préstamo para ayudar en el negocio de su conyugue, ella es comerciante y trabaja con verduras y frutas al por mayor. She is a merchant who sells vegetables and fruits in bulk. The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital to be invested in his wife’s business.

loans.name: Willis

texts.en:
Willis is a veteran electrician, having worked in this trade for the past forty years. He remembers one of his first projects as an electrician: on stage for jazz pianist Herbie Hancock. "He was using a lot of synthesizers and microphones, so it wasn't an easy job." Willis keeps a photo of Mr. Hancock hanging in his office in Oakland, California.
 
In 2007, after working as a union electrician with large companies for 34 years, Willis decided to open his own business: Special Electric Construction. He wanted the freedom to take on the projects he is most passionate about: industrial and public works, such as bridges, schools and public buildings. He also wanted to have more control over the decisions that are made around purchasing and managing project budgets. "I've seen so much waste in 34 years," he said.
 
As the son of a general contractor, Willis is proud to own a professional electrician business. “There are very few ‘mom-and-pop’ shops left,” he says, “because of the competition from larger players.” As a minority-owned business and a certified Small and Local Business, Willis's shop fulfills an important niche in the Bay Area.
 
Willis’s biggest challenge so far has been finding a line of credit to support the upfront costs of larger projects. He sought a small business loan from his bank but, despite being a home-owner and successful businessman, he couldn’t qualify for a loan because he had never borrowed on credit cards and usually avoids taking on debt. When he saw Opportunity Fund’s small business loan program featured on the local news, he decided to apply.
 
With a $5,000 loan, his first from Opportunity Fund, Willis will purchase and install exhaust fans in a building he is working on in Oakland. The loan will act as the line of credit he needs to purchase these costly items before his clients pay him for the job. In addition, this loan will ensure that he is able to start establishing a credit history for his business.

loans.use: To purchase and install exhaust fans in a building he is working on

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.en:
Ana María is 32 years old, married, and has two children in the 6th grade at school. She lives with her husband in a place know as Cantón Chuixtoca near Chuicanatuj and ChiT., in the municipality and department of Totonicapán. She joined a group with the goal of growing her business. Everyone in the group has a different business activity, and they include: making the typical clothes of the region and offering pharmaceutical services. They approached the "Asociación Asdir" to access a loan that would enable them to grow their business capital since everyone one of them wants to overcome challenges and to be able to continue studying and one of them wants to be able to grow her business and gain a better income so that she can offer a better standard of living to her family.

loans.name: La Esperanza Ii Group

texts.es:
Este comité lleva por nombre La Esperanza debido a que todas las integrantes coinciden de que ésta oportunidad les servirá de esperanza para progresar, actualmente se encuentran en el quinto ciclo, integrada por 21  luchadoras señoras, quienes se esmeran días tras días para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. 
Todas las integrantes son muy trabajadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Así como la señora Gilda quien invirtio el credito en la compra de carne de pollo, cerdo, vacuno y otros.
Ella se dedica a la venta de carne en una carniceria que posee en su casa, en la actividad la ayuda su marido.
Se siente muy satisfecha con su actividad ya que le ayuda a su familia.
Agradece a todas a sus compañeras por el apoyo constante entre ellas y desea seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
This committee has the name "La Esperanza" or "Hope" because all the members agree that this opportunity will give them hope to progress. They are currently in their 5th loan cycle and they consist of 21 determined women who strive day to day to increase their income and so to provide the best for their families. All the group members are very hardworking and have invested their loans in their respective business activities. For instance, Gilda invested the loan in buying chicken meat, pork, beef, and others. She sells meat in a butchers shop located in her home and her husband helps her with this. She feels very satisfied with her business as it helps her family. She is very grateful to all her companions in the group for the constant support there is between them and she wants to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meet like beef, pork, and chicken

loans.name: Iver Jhonny

texts.es: El Sr. Iver vive en la zona del Plan 3000 en el Barrio de los Pocitos, se dedica a la venta de bebidas y atención de rockola, además que durante el día atienden ahí mismo una pensión familiar, hace como un año que comenzaron con esta actividad y vieron la necesidad de atender con una rockola ya que los clientes solicitaron música para ambientar el lugar. El ayuda a su madre que vive con el, con su negocio colabora con las medicinas que necesita su mamá ya que ella se encuentra enferma de reumatismo, él pese a  tener 19 años, es una persona que presenta mucho interes en superarse ya que aparte de atender su negocio piensa comenzar a estudiar para formarse profesionalmente. Él necesita el credito para terminar de pagar la rockola y además comprar más sillas y mesas que le hacen falta para la pensión.
texts.en:
Sr. Iver lives in the Plan 3000 area of the Pocitos neighborhood. He has a business where his customers can both buy drinks and listen to "rockola" (a karaoke-like entertainment). Along with that, he tends his family's "pension" (room-rental) business during the day. He started the beverages business a year ago and soon saw the need to offer rockola because his customers wanted it. Iver helps his mother, who lives with him, with the medicines she needs to battle rheumatism. Though Iver is only 19 years old, he is strongly driven to get ahead in the world. Apart from his business, he is planning to go to school to study for a paid career. He needs a loan to pay for the rockola, along with tables and chairs that he needs for the pension.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for food business.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium and is equally committed to meet the payments of her quotas in the time period established.

loans.name: Luis Ernan

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 22 años de edad que vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Tejedores del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola caracterizada por producir exclusivamente frutas como el mango y el limón. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace algunos dos años aproximadamente a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, el cría ovejas en un ambiente cercano a su vivienda, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que visitan el lugar en donde reside. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades el sostiene sus gastos personales y apoya a sus padres en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Luis desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas animales para criarlos y venderlos, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales espera lograr su objetivo.

Luis es un joven tranquilo, trabajador y bastante independiente. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder brindarle a su familia la posibilidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, 22, lives with his parents, brothers and sisters in the Peruvian district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area largely given over to growing fruits like mangoes and lemons. Tambogrande is in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, and some three hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Luis has operated a business raising and selling sheep for two years. He raises the animals behind his house and, when they are ready for market, sells them to neighbors and the buyers who occasionally travel through the area. With earnings from the business, he supports himself and helps with family expenses. Luis wants to buy more animals to expand his business. He is applying for a 1,500 new-soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can meet his goal. Luis is a reserved, hard-working young man and largely independent. His greatest hope is to grow his business so that he can provide his family with the best possible quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals for livestock business.

loans.name: Mario Anibal

El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es el  Sr. Mario; el tiene 29 años de edad y es soltero y el socio se dedica a prestar servicio de seguridad, el socio también tiene su negocio familiar de fabricación y venta de velas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la fabricación de velas para la venta.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 22 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su madre y 2 hermanos jóvenes, juntos trabajan para salir adelante en busca del progreso. Desde muy joven este laborioso hombre se dedica a las labores agrícolas, pues ayudaba a sus padres para que las tierras produzcan en cantidad. En la actualidad siembra papa, arveja y algunas hortalizas, junto a sus hermanos, aunque sabe que la labor de campo es algo tediosa porque debe vigilar sus cultivos todos los días, con los primeros rayos del sol, para obtener una cosecha productiva. Pero se siente gratificado cuando recoge los pesados sacos repletos de sus productos naturales, y los comercializa a los mayoristas de la ciudad, que le pagan considerables precios porque conocen de la calidad de sus productos. Como es un hombre bastante emprendedor para mas adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad papa, además quiere comprar algunas cabezas de reses, pues empezará con la comercialización de estos animales. Es el onceavo crédito con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea continuar trabajando en busca del progreso, además esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero solicitado que le permitirá continuar adelante. Miguel tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Miguel is 22 years old, he lives in his own home with his mother and 2 younger brothers, they work to get ahead and progress in life. From a very young age, this hardworking man has worked in agriculture to help his parents’ land produce to capacity. At present, he grows potatoes, peas and some vegetables with his brothers. Miguel knows that field work is somewhat tedious since he has to watch over his crops everyday from sunrise in order to have productive crops. Although it’s a tough job, Miguel feels satisfied when he collects the heavy sacks full of his natural products and sells them to the wholesalers in the city that pay him well since they know the quality of his products. Miguel is an enterprising man, and plans to grow more potatoes in the future, and to have some cattle to sell also. This is Miguel’s eleventh loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and he promises to pay his quotas on time and wants to keep working to get ahead. Miguel is very grateful to everyone who lent him money since that will allow him to keep progressing in life; he plans to use the loan to buy manure and fertilizers to improve the productivity of his lands.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Elizabeth
