loans.name: Katty

texts.es: El Sra. Katty y su esposo Edwin viven en la  casa  de su tio,  tienen una hija de seis añitos. Tienen su punto internet que es atendido por su esposo.  Ademas la Sra, por la tardes se ocupa de hacer Empanadas para salir a vender por los diferentes mercados para lo que cuenta con un Ayudante, debido a que se le incremento la demanda de empanadas,  fue que se vio con la necesidad de sacar un Credito para poder comprarse un Horno Insdustrial y para comprar mas computadoras. La Sra. Katty  es una persona trabajadora junto con su esposo se esfuerzan para salir adelante por el bienestar y futuro de su hija.
texts.en:
Katty and her husband Edwin live in their uncle's house with their 6-year-old daughter. They own an internet cafe that is attended by her husband. In addition, in the afternoon Katty bakes meat pies and sells them in various local markets. She has an assistant, because the demand for her meat pies is growing. This is why she saw the need to request a loan for the purchase of an industrial oven, and also to buy more computers. Katty is a very hard-working individual. Together, Katty and her husband are striving to get ahead for their benefit and for their daughter's future.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING AN INDUSTRIAL OVEN AND ADDITIONAL COMPUTERS FOR THEIR INTERNET CAFE

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es el  Sr. Marco; el tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente,   el socio es taxista el presta servicio de taxi y solicita el préstamo para su conyugue, ella es comerciante, tiene una carreta en la cual vende golosinas. El socio ayudara a implementar el pequeño negocio de su pareja.  El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de golosinas de su conyugue.  
       
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “United for Success” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Marco he is 35 years old and lives with his partner. The member is a taxi driver and needs the loan to help his partner; she is a merchant and has a cart where she sells candy. The member will help his partner set up her business. Mr. Marco needs the loan to invest in the candy business of his partner.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payment of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to invest in the candy business of his partner.

loans.name: Nilton

texts.es: Nilton, de 30 años, vive en compañía de su madre en casa de ella, juntos trabajan para conseguir todas sus metas. Cada día es nuevo en la vida de este luchador joven que trabaja con mucho esmero las tierras que son de propiedad de su madre. Cuando era joven le ayudaba, pero desde hace un tiempo él solo las trabaja. Dice que para la labor de campo se requiere mucha dedicación, pues al amanecer debe trabajar, arando y regando la tierra, para que se mantenga en buenas condiciones, además  le gusta mucho su trabajo pues lo desempeña bien. Lo que no le gusta es que durante la época de cosecha debe contratar la ayuda de peones, para cargar los pesados sacos de sus productos naturales, pero dice que la recompensa es buena, ya que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten vivir en comodidad con la compañía de su madre. Como es muy emprendedor para mas adelante tiene planeado comprar algunas cabezas de carnero ya que quiere aumentar la cantidad de animales y empezar con la comercialización y venta de carne de carnero. Es el onceavo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que desea continuar trabajando, además dice que le gusta el trabajo con su grupo comunal pues esta conformado por personas bastante responsables y solidarias. Tiene planeado invertir el crédito dinero solicitado en la compra de guano y abono que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos y así obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nilton, 30, lives with his mother in her home. They work together to meet all of their goals. Every day is new in the life of this tenacious youth, who works his mother's lands with a lot of care. When he was young he helped her, but for some time he has done the work on his own. He says that working in the fields requires a lot of dedication, as each day he must get up very early to plow and irrigate the land to keep it in good condition. He loves his work, and he does it very well. What he doesn't like is having to hire workers during the harvest season to carry the heavy sacks of his produce, but he says that he pays them well, since the earnings that he obtains allow him to live comfortably with his mother. As he is very enterprising, he has plans for the future to buy some sheep, since he wants to increase his quantity of animals and start selling their meat. This is the 11th loan that he has taken with MF, and he pledges to make his payments on time since he wants to continue working with the organization. In addition, he says that he enjoys working with his communal bank, since it is made up of people who are very responsible and cooperative. He plans to use the money requested to invest in the purchase of fertilizers that he needs to improve the productivity of his cultivations; in this way he can obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve the productivity of his lands

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es:
Blanca de 21 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, ella confecciona ropa desde hace años, su esposo es policía retirado ellos tiene tres hijos. 

Comenzando con una maquina de coser vieja pudo tener suficientes clientes para solventar sus gastos. Poco a poco inicio su negocio comenzando a reunir dinero para comprar varias maquinas de coser industriales. Ahora trabaja todos los días en su casa confeccionando pantalones, vestidos, blusas y las vende para una revista colombiana y un periodico llamado "super exito".

Para continuar con su taller de confección de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y hilos, en el futuro quiere trabajar con D-Parti (compañía de ropa del Ecuador).
texts.en:
Blanca, who is 21 years old, lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil. She has made clothing for several years. Her husband is a retired policeman and they have 3 children. Beginning with only an old sewing machine, she was able to retain enough clients to cover her costs. Little by little, she expanded her business, saving money to buy various industrial sewing machines. Now Blanca works every day in her home, making pants, dresses, and blouses. She sells them through a Colombian magazine and a periodical called “Super Exito” (Super Success). To continue with her clothes-making workshop, Blanca needs a loan to buy cloth and thread. In the future, she wants to work with D-Parti (an Ecuadorian clothing company).

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CLOTH, THREAD, AND FASTENERS FOR HER CLOTHING WORKSHOP

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La Señora Elizabeth , es cliente de la institución  que se encuentra en su segunda frecuencia, la cliente se dedica a la  venta de  comida (almuerzo y platos extras) y los sábados y domingos cocina platos especiales como ser chicharon, fricase y chairo especial, el kiosco lo tiene Cubicado en la zona de Cota Cota ,  la Sra. atiende con la ayuda de su esposo Martin ,ellos tienen tres hijos en edad escolar y un pequeño de  tres años, ahora  la cliente solicita el préstamo para el anticrético de otro ambiente para atender en ambos ya que el ambiente esta cerca de su negocio, por lo que se solicita este financiamiento kiva.
texts.en:
This is Elizabeth's second loan with the institution. She sells food (lunch and side dishes), and on Saturdays and Sundays she cooks special plates such as chicharon (fried pork skin), fricase, and chairo (both types of stew). Her kiosk is located in the Cota Cota area. She runs the business with the help of her husband, Martin. They have three children in school and a three-year-old. She's requesting this loan for the "anticrético" (special lease arrangement in Bolivia in which the renter pays a fixed sum up front and is then returned the money when he/she vacates the property) of another location close to her current location so that she can attend to both.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lease of another location

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es el  Sr. Victor; el tiene 40 años de edad  y es soltero,   el socio es odontólogo y también se dedica a restaurar obras, el socio también estudio artes plásticas y es otro de sus pasatiempos favoritos y el cual también le genera ingresos económicos; El socio viene trabajando en la restauración de obras desde hace 12 años y para lo cual ahora requiere un pequeño presupuesto para restaurar 2 cuadros. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la restauración de dos obras.         

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “United for Success” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Victor; he is 40 years old and single. The member is an odontologist and restores artwork as well since he studied visual arts too, this is one of his favorite pastimes and it also gives him another source of income. Mr. Victor has restored works of art for some 12 years and he now needs a small budget to restore 2 paintings. The member needs the loan to restore 2 works of art.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payment of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to restore 2 works of art.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco esta situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria, L a socia tiene 31años de edad, ella es soltera y es contadora de profesión, La socia está a punto de poner un estudio contable y requiere el préstamo para pagar los alquileres.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su estudio contable (alquileres).   
     
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “United for Success” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Maria, she is 31 years old, she is single and an accountant. The member is about to begin studying an accounting course and needs the loan to pay the fees. The member needs the loan to invest in her accounting studies.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of her quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to invest in her accounting studies.

loans.name: Bolivianitas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “BOLIVIANITAS” está iniciando su tercer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.   Este grupo consta de nueve socias,  las socias más antiguas y tienen un año en nuestra institución;  a la cabeza se encuentra la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas.

La  señora Maríanela, presidenta de la asociación, comenta que fue invitada para formar parte de la asociación. Su negocio es ambulante, ella trabaja haciendo jugar “Pasanacu”, recoge todos los días un monto de dinero pequeño de sus clientes y luego cuando se reúne una cantidad considerable al término del tiempo establecido, puede ser por semana o por quincena o por mes, se entrega el dinero o víveres al ganador del sorteo y luego cada cierto tiempo el monto de dinero o víveres van rotando entre todos sus clientes.  Este trabajo le permite cuidar de su hogar y de sus cuatro hijos.

En relación al resto de los integrantes la A.C. “Bolivianitas” también tienen sus propios negocios, como ser: comercio de víveres, Internet, venta de quesos, macramé, venta de cosméticos y artefactos, artesanía, venta de comida, venta de chinelas.
texts.en:
The communal association “BOLIVIANITAS” is initiating its third cycle in the focal point of Villa Exaltación. This group consists of nine partners--the oldest partners--and has been with our institution for a year. Heading up the group are the president, treasurer, and secretary. Maríanela, president, comments that she was invited to form part of the association. Her business is mobile--she works in "Pasanacu" (the Bolivian term for person-to-person lending). Everyday she collects a small sum of money from her customers and then when a certain considerable amount is gathered at the end of a determined time--it could be per week, per two weeks, or per month--the money or provisions are delivered to the winner of the drawing. Eventually the amount of money or provisions rotates around to all her customers. This work permits her to take care of her home and her four children. As for the rest of the members of "Bolivianitas," they also have their own businesses, such as: provisions commerce, Internet, cheese sales, macrame, cosmetics sales, handicrafts, food sales, and flip flop sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel;  La socia tiene 39 años de edad, ella es separada  y tiene 2 hijos, la socia estudio ciencias de la comunicación en la universidad nacional, ella es periodista y trabaja en Tv Sur y en radio la hora; La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y ella es padre y madre para sus hijos, ella necesita ahora el préstamo para abrir una distribuidora de libros, para trabajar por horas, ella ya vio al detalle este proyecto y lo hará realidad en las siguientes semanas  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en una distribuidora de libros.        

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Little Treasure” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Isabel, she is 39 years old, is separated and has 2 children. The member studied communication in the national university; she is a journalist and works in TV Sur and in la Hora radio. Mrs. Isabel is a very hardworking woman and she is a mother and father to her children, she needs the loan to open a book distributor and plans on working per hour. She has worked in every detail of this project and will make it come true in the following weeks. Mrs. Isabel needs the loan invest in the book distributor.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of her quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan invest in the book distributor.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Mario;  El socio tiene39 años de edad, el socio es soltero y es empleado en el diario del Cusco; asi mismo el socio tiene un taller de mecánica, el socio administra su taller y por horas va a la redacción del periódico. El socio necesita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para implementar su taller de mecánica. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en su taller de mecánica. 
      
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Little Treasure” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Mario he is 39 years old, he is single and works for the Cusco newspaper, he also has a mechanics’ shop, he manages his business and for some hours he goes to write for the newspaper. The member needs the loan to buy spare parts to set up his mechanic’s shop.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy spare parts for his mechanic’s shop.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: El Sr. Joaquín, es cliente que trabaja solo con emprender  y se encuentra en su quinta secuencia, ingreso el año 2007, con la actividad que aun continua, de constructor, el realiza contratos para construcción de casa particulares y arreglos, estos trabajos generalmente los acaba en un plazo máximo de seis Semanas en cuanto a la obra bruta y en obra fina actualmente trabaja junto con su esposa y dos ayudantes, el Sr. Joaquín utilizara el dinero del crédito en la compra de andamios y de madera para poder realizar un trabajo mas  seguro en las casas de dos pisos o mas altas, en  el Sr. Joaquín, vive en casa propia por la zona de Cota Cota, tiene dos hijas en edad escolar y un bebe de ocho meses, es una familia joven y trabajadora, por lo que se solicita nuevamente una tasa kiva.
texts.en:
Joaquín works exclusively with Emprender and this is his fifth loan. He began in 2007 with an activity that he continues with to this day: construction. He works on contract building private houses and doing repairs. This work typically takes him no more than six weeks of hard labor, and then for the lighter construction he works with his wife and two assistants. Joaquín will use the loan money to buy wood scaffolding to make the taller, two-story houses more stable. Joaquín lives in his own home in the Cota Cota area. He has two young daughters and an 8-month-old baby. His family is young and hardworking, which is why he's asking for a new Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood and scaffolding

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth;  La socia tiene 2 hijos y es conviviente,  La socia se dedica a la venta de comidas en el mercado central, ella tiene un stand propio y cada día de lunes a sábados, la socia elabora comidas caseras para la venta.   La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio de alimentos (comprar ingredientes.   
     
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Little Treasure” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Elizabeth; she has 2 children and lives with her partner. She sells food in the central market she has her own stand and works everyday from Monday to Saturday. Mrs. Elizabeth makes homemade food to sell and she needs the loan to invest in her food business. The member is grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of her quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in food business.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza es una mujer muy trabajadora  en este momento cuenta con 46 años de edad con 2 hijos el mayor ya es profesional y la menor tiene 16 años la cual  esta estudiando en la universidad estatal. La Sra. Esperanza cuenta con un casa en anticrético y su mayor anhelo es poder tener una vivienda propia para poder pasar su vejes tranquila. Ella en este momento se dedica a la venta ambulante de productos de belleza (Labiales, delineadores, bases de maquillajes, perfumes, y otros) ganado el 50% de cada producto que compra por docena, además la Sra. es muy conocida por su trabajos en costura ( Realiza fundas para living , vestidos y arreglos en costura en general, ella solicita el crédito para comprar muebles para su casa, como roperos, sillas mesa comedor, televisor, etc.  ya que a ella siempre le gusto vivir en un ambiente cómodo y confortante.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a hardworking woman. She is 46 years old and has two children. The oldest already works and the youngest is 16 years old and goes to a State University. She lives in a house with an "anticretico" contract (a common contract in Bolivia in which the owner of a house "rents" it for a determined period of time in exchange for a one time payment that must be given back to the tenant once the contract expires). Her biggest wish is to own her own home so that she can have a comfortable old age. She currently sell cosmetics (lipstick, eyeliners, foundations, perfumes, and others) door to door. She earns 50% profit over the products she buys by the dozen. She is also well known for her sewing jobs (slipcovers for couches, dresses and general repairs). She requests the credit to purchase furniture such as closets, chairs, dining table, TV and others for her home since she has always wanted to live in a warm and comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for her home

loans.name: Jesus De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Jesus es una joven madre de familia de 20 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector Valle de los Incas del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola caracterizada por dedicarse principalmente al cultivo de frutas como el mango y el limón. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra situada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega situada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de consumo diario a los que generalmente no tienen rápido acceso dada su ubicación geográfica, se encuentran a bastantes kilómetros de distancia del pueblo mas cercano. Con el dinero que percibe de esta actividad ella se encarga de apoyar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos de la economía familiar.

Jesus se esfuerza diariamente por sacar adelante a su negocio, por ello siempre trata de brindar a sus clientes productos de calidad y un buen trato. Actualmente ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos, de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y por ende, sus ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.

Jesus es una mujer emprendedora y bastante entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ayudarles a obtener una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Jesus is a 20 year old young mother who lives with her husband and their two children. They live in the Valle de los Incas sector in the Tambogrande district. It is an agricultural area primarily known for growing fruits like mangos and lemons. It belongs to the Piura province, which is in the region of the same name. It is three hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. For over a year she has been selling basic needs products and groceries in a store, which is in her house. She offers her customers all types of daily consumption products. Her customers generally do not have quick access to these products because of their geographic location. They are quite a few kilometers from the nearest town. With the money she gets from this activity she helps her husband, a farmer, with the family expenses. Jesus works hard everyday to get ahead with her business. In order to do that, she always tries to offer her customers quality products and good service. She currently wishes to expand her business by purchasing more products. That way she will be able to increase her sales, and then her earnings will increase. In order to achieve her objective, she believes it is advisable to request, for the first time, a loan for 600 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Jesus is an enterprising woman who is very devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to keep working in order to help her family obtain a better quality of life. In the area where she lives her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high esteem and respect her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela, de 31 años de edad, convive con su pareja tienen seis hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tiene su propio techo a base de madera. A pesar de tener primaria incompleta, Adela no se desanima, más bien sacó a relucir las ganas de seguir trabajando. Hoy posee un negocio de venta de ropa, dejando a la mayoría de sus clientes contentos por la variedad de modelos que ofrece. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y su punto de venta lo realiza en el mercado de su propia localidad. Normalmente trabaja de lunes a domingo, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche. En el futuro, piensa construir su casa a base de material noble, con la finalidad de que pueda darle seguridad y comodidad a su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además está satisfecho con su banco comunal, ya que todos se solidarizan entre sí. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de  mercaderías, para que de esa manera pueda abastecer su tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Adela is 31 years old she lives with her partner and together they have six children. Together they live in the Quimbiri area located in the beautiful Cusco jungle where they have their own roof made of wood. Despite not completing primary school Adela is not discouraged and came out enthusiastically to keep working. Today she has her own business selling clothing leaving the majority of her customers happy with the variety of styles that she has to offer. In general she works by herself but sometimes she gets help from her children and her store is in the market in her area. Usually she works Monday through Sunday from 7:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night. In the future she plans to build her home with quality materials so that she can provide a secure and comfortable home for her family. This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and she is committed to meet all of her payments and she is happy with her communal bank since everyone works together. With the loan she plans to buy more clothing to sell so that she can stock her clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her store.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julio;  El socio tiene25 años de edad, el socio es soltero y es administrador de tortas Tota; el socio trabaja en la calle belén.  El socio también tiene su negocio propio él tiene sus cabinas de internet, el socio administra también su propio negocio y con él tiene trabajando a otra persona. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio de alquiler de internet.       

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Little Treasure” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Julio he is 25 years old, single and manages Tota cakes, he works in Belén street. The member also has his own business, internet booths, the member manages this business as well and another person works with him. The member needs the loan to invest in his internet rental.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to invest in his internet rental.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edgar;  El socio tiene24 años de edad, el socio es soltero y es administrador de tortas Tota; el socio trabaja en las tiendas de el barrio magisterial,  av. La cultura y San Jeronimo.  El socio también tiene su negocio propio él tiene una tienda de distribución de gas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio y adquirir balones de gas para consumo domestico.      

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Little Treasure” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Edgar, he is 24 years old, single and manages Tota cakes in the stores in the Magisterial neighborhood, avenues of La Cultura and San Jeronimo. Edgar also has his own business where he distributes gas. The member needs the loan to invest in his business and to have tanks of gas for domestic consumption.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to invest in his business and to have tanks of gas for domestic consumption.

loans.name: Irma Angelica

texts.es: Irma Angélica A. y su esposo con ahorros han ido construyendo su casa pero en este momento ellos requieren de un préstamo para terminar el baño. Ellos quieren enjarrar por dentro y comprar los accesorios como los son el inodoro, el lavabo y regadera. Este proyecto lo quieren realizar para ofreces a su hijos la mayor comodidad y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe Lagunas bought a lot upon which is a house in ruins. She wants to demolish that house and begin the foundation of a new house. Maria Guadulupe wishes to give her son a higher standard of living and an inheritance when he grows up. Maria is a hard-working woman; she is exposed to the elements as she looks for customers who will become affiliated with a banking institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a bathroom

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
La señora Magdai Sánchez M., tiene cincuenta y cuatro años de edad, vive en Ángel Alvino Corzo Municipio de Copainala,  Estado de Chiapas México. Tuvo cinco hijos los cuales cada uno tiene su respectivo hogar, en su poder tiene dos de sus nietos Roxana Yassiri de ocho años y Axel  T. de seis años.

  Ella se dedica a su hogar y a su tienda de abarrotes (kendra) desde hace tres años el cual comenta que le ha ido bien desde que inicio con esta actividad en donde vende Frijol, azúcar, aceite entre otros productos más. Y es la que la ha ayudado a cubrir sus gastos de su hogar.  

  Lo que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad fueron sus hijos quienes le dieron el dinero para que pusiera este negocio en donde ella se pudiera ayudar y salir adelante ya que no tiene de quien depender y con este trabajo lo está logrando.

  Con las ganancias que obtiene de su tienda de abarrotes compra más mercancía para volver a surtirla  y este siempre en buena presentación  y su clientela se sienta bien atendida por ella ya que su tienda es  muy popular y la prefieren porque está en buen sitio de la comunidad.

    Comenta que su sueño es que su negocio se valla incrementado día con día para poder ahorrar y comenzar a construir un cuarto para su nieta y también como también apoyarlos en su educación y hasta que dios le preste vida seguirá dándoles les todo su apoyo. 

     Magdai formo parte del grupo por una invitación que le hizo su hija la señora rosa lidia,  quien es la  representante  del grupo, el grupo se llama girasol la razón del  nombre es porque en el patio de su casa hay matas de esa flor.

 Las personas que integra el grupo girasol son la siguiente: 
  Magdai Sánchez M.: se dedica a   su negocio de abarrotes y solicito el préstamo para comprar más mercancía.
  Yolanda E. Juárez: se dedica a la venta de tamales y solicito el préstamo para comprar ingredientes como son: la carne, masa, chile, pasas entre otro ingredientes mas.
  Rosa lidia Hernández Sánchez: compra pollos de rancho, para venderlo en la misma región.
 Ilse E. Juárez: se dedica a la venta de tamales y solicito el préstamo para comprar lo ingredientes como son: la hoja de guineo, carne, masa, chile ancho, pasas entre otros.
 Yareny T. S.: utilizara el préstamo para la compra de catálogos de avon y llafra.
texts.en:
Señora Magdai Sánchez M. is fifty-four years old and lives in Ángel Alvino Corzo in the municipality of Copainala, which is in the state of Chiapas, México. She had five children, each of whom now lives in their own home. She has custody of two of her grandchildren, Roxana Yassiri, who is eight years old, and Axel T., who is six years old. She is dedicated to her home and to her grocer's shop (Kendra), which she has had for three years, showing that the business has been successful since it opened. In her small grocery she sells beans, sugar and oil, among other products. Her grocery is what has helped her to cover her household expenses. Since she didn't have anyone else to support her, Magdai's children motivated her to open the business by giving her the start-up money. They wanted her to be able to support herself and to get ahead. With this work, she has been able to do just that. With the profits that she earns from her grocer's shop, she purchases additional merchandise to re-stock the store. Her store always has a professional presentation, and her customers feel well cared for by her. Her store is very popular and preferred because she has a good spot in the community. She says that her dream is for her business to continue to grow day by day so that she can save some money to start construction on a room for her granddaughter. She also wants to support her grandchildren in their education and, for as long as god grants her life, to keep giving them all her support. Magdai became a member of the group through an invitation from her daughter, Señora Rosa Lidia, who is the group representative. The group is named "Girasol" (Sunflower) because on the patio of their house there are lots of sunflower plants. The people who make up the Girsol group are the following: Magdai Sánchez M.: she makes her living with a grocery business and requested the loan to purchase additional merchandise. Yolanda E. Juárez: she makes her living selling tamales (a local dish) and requested the loan to purchase ingredients such as meat, dough, chili peppers and raisins, among other items. Rosa Lidia Hernández Sánchez: she purchases chickens from ranches to re-sell in the same area. Ilse E. Juárez: she makes her living selling tamales (a local dish) and requested the loan to purchase ingredients such as guineo leaves (from a local plant), meat, dough, ancho chilies and raisins, among other items. Yareny T. S.: she will use the loan to purchase Avon and Jafra beauty catalogs.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery, such as sugar, beans, oil, and soap, among other items.

loans.name: Astrith Candela

texts.es: A Astrith mujer muy seria no la para nadie trabajando, ni siquiera un accidente de transito que le causó fracturas y por el,   tuvieron que reconstruirle sus pies. Ella es una mujer emprendedora, madre de tres hijos que ya están en las edades de 18 a  26 años y por los cuales ha venido esforzándose día a día, mediante un trabajo persistente en los diversos negocios que ha tenido a lo largo de su carrera y como mama jefe de hogar. Inició en el año 2004 vendiendo café y bebidas aromáticas puerta a puerta y en los centros comerciales, pero una vez sufrió el accidente mencionado, casi sin recuperarse totalmente  empezó a vender mercancía y en la actualidad tiene un negocio donde comercializa cosméticos por catálogos y que la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha venido apoyando hace 4 años; Hoy amerita su credikiva, con el comprará calzado y productos que están en descuento en su catalogo como perfumes, cremas, pinta uñas, delineadores, pestañina, bases y tratamientos de cabello  para continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, porque sueña con adquirir su viviendo en un buen sitio para allí mismo tener su miscelánea y caminar hacia la prosperidad.
texts.en:
Astrith is very serious about her work. Not even the traffic accident that caused her fractures and required reconstructive surgery on her feet caused her to stop working. She is a very entrepreneurial woman and the mother of three children, between the ages of 18 and 26, for whom she has made a great daily effort. She has earned her position as mother head of the household through the work she has done. She began selling coffee and aromatic drinks door to door and in shopping centers. After she had the accident mentioned earlier, she began selling again before she was completely recovered. Now she has a business where she sells cosmetics through catalogs and has been getting encouragement from “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo” for the past four years. She will use the money from this Kiva loan to buy shoes and other items that are being offered at a discount through her catalog; items such as perfumes, creams, nail polish, eyeliners, mascara, and hair treatments. This will allow her to increase her working capital because she hopes to be able to get a house in a good location so that she can run her store from there and move toward prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Sydney Viviana

texts.es: La Señora Sídney se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pollos a la broaster hace ya dos años,  su local esta ubicado en lugar céntrico de la ciudad  lo que le permite tener buenas ventas, ella esta casada con el señor Herland con quien aun no tienen niños, el destino del crédito es para la compra de un horno para la elaboración de pollos al espiedo, ya que muchos de sus  clientes solicitan la  venta del mismo, la  señora es muy trabajadora ya que trabajan desde las 5 de la mañana y para las siete ya están vendiendo sus pollos a la broster y tienen buena venta, ya que es la única que vende por el lugar y no tiene competencia, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan.
texts.en:
Señora Sídney has been preparing and selling broasted chicken for two years. Her stand is located in a central area in the city where her sales are good. She is married to Señor Herland and they don't have any children yet. She will use the loan to buy an oven in order to make rotisserie chicken since many of her customers request this. Señora Sídney works very hard from 5:00 in the morning until 7:00 selling broasted chicken. Her sales are good since she is the only vendor at this location and she doesn't have any competition. She is very grateful to the institution for the support they give her.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an oven to make rotisserie chicken

loans.name: Willy Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Willy;  El socio tiene 32 años de edad, el socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, es comerciante él se dedica  a la venta de productos naturales, desde hace 1 año; el socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la implementación de su stand.  
    
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Little Treasure” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Willy, he is 32 years old, he lives with his partner and has 2 children. He is a merchant and has sold natural products for a year and Mr. Willy needs the loan to help his business. The member needs the loan to invest in merchandize for his stand.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to invest in merchandize for his stand.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela Carreón es una mujer comerciante que tiene varias actividades como lo son  tienda de Dulces, venta de joyería, venta de ropa usada y hace manualidades; estos trabajos los viene realizando desde hace 3 años. Estas ventas que ella tiene lo hace con gusto pues es de la manera que percibe un ingreso mas, aparte de la pensión de su esposo que es mensual. Blanca desea un crédito para comprar material y mercancía para seguir teniendo más ganancias.
texts.en:
Irma Angelica Armenta and her husband started building their own house with their savings but they currently see a need for a loan to complete the bathroom. They would like add tiling and purchase the toilet, the sink and the shower. They would like to complete this project to provide their children with greater comfort and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: María Rocio

texts.es: María Roció R. E. tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde ofrece refrescos, comida enlatada, botanas, dulces, artículos de limpieza y para tener un ingreso extra vende hamburguesas que ella misma prepara. Este negocio ya tiene 12 años establecido al cual quiere comprar mercancía para tener mas variedad en producto y sí le generen más ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Rocio Rodriguez E. has a grocery store from where she sells soft drinks, canned foods, snacks, candies, and household cleaning supplies, and to have an additional source of income she also sells hamburgers that she makes herself. She has been running this business for the past 12 years and she would like to purchase merchandise to have a greater selection in her inventory, and thus generate greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Bera Cruz

texts.es: Bera Cruz de 63 años, ella es una persona muy conocida y quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos no solo por ser una persona responsable, sino también por ser alguien muy amable y que atiende de la mejor forma a sus clientes. Ella posee una pulpería la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación, Bera solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir su tienda y de esta forma ofrecer todos los productos que son necesario en el hogar, pues siempre está pensando en llevar el pan de cada día de su hogar. Lo que más desea, es el poder mejorar su estabilidad económica y aprovechar la oportunidad que la vida le ha brindando de poder ganarse la vida de una forma segura.
texts.en:
Bera Cruz is 63 years old and she is a very well known person and she benefits from many good references from her neighbors. She is not only a very responsible person but she is also very kind and she excels in customer service. She has a grocery store located in her house. Bera resquests a loan to have funds enough to restock her store and be in the position to offer her clients the products they need for the home. She always has on her mind having to provide for their family on a daily basis. Her greatest wish is to improve her financial situation and to take full advantage of the opportunity that is granted here, to earn herself some security in life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Fanny Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora. Fanny Leonor Ávila es socia del banco comunal Atenas, vive en la comunidad  Reina del Cisne en la Parroquia de Llacao, esta parroquia se caracteriza por que su gente por tradición   realizan los sombreros de paja toquilla, también se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Doña Fanny se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 10 años, está muy contenta con los préstamos porque le han ayudado a mejorar  la economía de su hogar y de su negocio, trabaja como empleada privada hace 6 años, en el cual labora de 8 a.m. hasta las 3 y media p.m., de lunes a viernes, también se dedica a la venta de chuzos (carne en palitos) y tiene una pequeña tienda  donde vende gaseosas, cervezas etc., la cual ya tiene 4 años.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su tienda.

La Señora. Fanny tiene 46 años, está separada de su marido, tiene un hijo  de 15 años que estudia en el colegio, gracias a su trabajo tiene casa propia. Su meta es hacer varios arreglos a su casa ya que aun no está terminada.
texts.en:
Señora. Fanny Leonor Ávila is a member of the Atenas community bank. She lives in the community of Reina del Cisne in Llacao parish. It is well known for its people and their tradition of weaving hats out of toquilla straw. They also raise animals and work in agriculture. Fanny has been a member of her community bank for ten years and is very happy with the loans as they have helped her to improve the financial situation of both her family and her business. She has worked as a private domestic servant for six years and works from 8 am to 3:30 pm, Monday to Friday. She also sells chuzos (strips of meat on a stick) and has had a small business where she sells soft drinks, beer etc. for four years. Fanny will use the loan to buy more products for her store. She is 46 years old and separated from her husband. Her son is 15 years old and is a high school student. Because of her hard work, she has a house of her own. Her goal is complete the renovations to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, eggs etc

loans.name: Brisas De California Group

texts.es: Rocio es la presidenta D. Grupo “Brisas D. California” el cual lleva 1 año trabajando con Edaprospo y es conformado por 7 personas las cuales son amigas. Rocio tiene 39 años y vive en la zona D. AH las Brisas D. california, D. ahí el nombre D. grupo ya que los demás miembros también son vecinos suyos, ella trabajo vendiendo queques al comienzo y ya desD. hace 5 años que venD. sus dulces en su casa, con lo cual junto a su pareja sostienen los estudios y gastos D. hogar, además tiene la meta D. poner un restaurant.
texts.en:
Rocio is the president of the Group, “California Breezes” which has worked with Edaprospo (Kiva’s field partner) for a year and it is comprised of 7 people who are all friends. Rocio is 39 years old and lives in the AH area Brisas D. California which is where they got the name of the group since the other members are also her neighbors. Rocio worked selling cakes and 5 years ago she has sold candy from her home and with her partner they are able to pay for household expenses, her future goal is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prodcuts and merchandize.

loans.name: Digna Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora Digna Margarita es socia del banco comunal Atenas, vive por la parroquia de Sidcay,  la agricultura y ganadería es la ocupación tradicional de sus habitantes la que es solo para autoabastecerse, razón suficiente para que salgan a la ciudad de Cuenca en busca de otras fuentes de trabajo.
 
La Señora. Digna tiene 49 años,  vive en unión libre y tiene  11 hijos, sus primeros 4 hijos son casados y viven  independientemente, sus 7 hijos solteros que tienen  19, 17, 16, 15, 13, 9 y 8 años de edad todos estudian, los 5 primeros en el colegio y sus dos últimos  en la escuela, su esposo trabaja como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven en una casa que les han prestado.

Doña Digna se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y aprovecha  ese tiempo para la realizar  guaipe (tela para limpiar), actividad que la realiza hace un año, también cuenta con un su negocio  de salchipapas las que vende en su parroquia hace 6 años. Nuestra socia se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en la fundación Espoir, los cuales le han beneficiado  en su hogar y negocio. El  dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para las matriculas de sus hijos y también en la compra de tela para realizar guaipe.
 
Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Digna Margarita is a member of the Atenas community bank. She lives in Sidcay parish where the traditional work of the local people is agriculture and raising animals so they can be self-sufficient. They go to the city of Cuenca to find other sources of work. Sra. Digna is 49 years old and lives with her common-law partner. She has eleven children: the four oldest are married and have left home, and her seven remaining children (aged 19, 17, 16, 15, 13, 9, and 8) are all students, five in secondary school and the two youngest in primary school. Digna’s husband works as a private employee. They don’t have a house of their own so they live in a house that someone has lent to them. Digna looks after the household and also uses the time to make dusters (cloths for cleaning). She started doing this a year ago. She’s also had a business selling salchipapas (hot dogs and fried potatoes) in the community for six years. This will be Digna’s fifth loan with Kiva partner Fundación Espoir. The loans have helped both her family and her business. The money from this new loan will be used to pay for her children’s education and also for fabric to make the dusters. Digna’s dream is to have a house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for education and fabric

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
Flavio es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Laynas del distrito de La Matanza, un distrito agrícola situado en la provincia de Morropón, en la región Piura, se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde que era joven. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar algodón y maíz. Como el sustento económico de su familia depende de esta actividad el se esfuerza diariamente para poder cuidar de su cultivo de manera adecuada, de modo que pueda obtener una buena producción que le asegure buenos ingresos.

Flavio desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos, para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Flavio es una persona tranquila y responsable. Su mayor deseo es tener exito en esta campaña agrícola y en las campañas posteriores para poder asegurarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Flavio is a family man, he is 46 years old and he lives together with his wife and their children in the Laynas sector of the La Matanza district. This district is a primarily agricultural district in the province of Morropon of the Piura region. It is located approximately four hours from the city of Chilayo in the Lambayeque region. He has worked as an agriculturist since he was young. He has a plantation field where he cultivates cotton and corn. This is the only source of income and the family depends on this business so he works very hard every day to provide the adequate care to the fields. This way he will ensure he will have a better yield and generate good earnings. Flavio wishes to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to help his plantations. To reach his goal he sees the need to request a first-time loan form Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner), amounting to 500 nuevos soles. Flavios is a very calm and responsible person. His greatest wish is to see a bumper crop this season and in future cultivations, so as to ensure that his family will have an improved way of life. In the region where he lives, his neighbors and his acquaintances consider him to be a very calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides to improve his cotton and corn plantations.

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es:
La Señora Olga María Álvarez es socia del banco comunal Atenas, vive  por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por sus bellos paisajes, su centro histórico que fue nombrado en diciembre de 1999 como patrimonio de la humanidad y  la variada gastronomía hace de Cuenca una ciudad hermosa y calida.

Doña Olga tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 28, 26, 24, 22, 20 y 16 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive de manera independiente, su segundo hijo es soltero y vive de manera independiente, su tercer hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su cuarta hija estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en un taxi, con el sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir una casa pequeña.

Doña Olga es nuestra socia hace 10 años y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, tiene una tienda en su casa hace 20 años, labora de domingo a domingo, vende desde las 6 a.m. hasta  las 9 p.m., en sus tiempos libres se dedica a tejer bufandas y colchas, sus tejidos los vende a sus amistades. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más víveres para ampliar su tienda.
 
Su meta es  realizar algunos arreglos en su casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Olga María Álvarez is a member of the Atenas communal bank. She lives in the Las Orquídeas ("The Orchids") neighborhood in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for it's beautiful scenery and in December 1999, it's historic center was named a World Heritage Site. The varied cuisine of Cuenca makes it a beautiful and warm city. Ms. Olga is 49 years old, married, and has 6 children, who are 28, 26, 24, 22, 20, and 16 years old. Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently. Her second oldest, a son, is single and lives on his own. Her third oldest, a son, works and helps with the household finances. Her fourth oldest, a daughter, is studying at the university, and her two youngest children attend high school. Her husband is a taxi driver. With their joint sacrifice, they have been able to construct a small house. Ms. Olga has been a client of Fundación ESPOIR for 10 years. The loans she has received have been beneficial to her business. She has run a store out of her house for 20 years. She works from Sunday to Sunday, selling from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. In her free time, she knits scarves and quilts, which she sells to her friends. She will use the money from this loan to purchase more food products to stock her store. Her goal is to make certain repairs to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, eggs, rice, and foodstuffs in general

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina S. is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Alicia, Isabela. She is 26 years old,  married and has one infant child. To make a living, Divina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from tending a canteen in the community. Divina has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Divina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan that Divina has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mr. Shorn Bou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of 19 people from Kampong village in Takeo province. They are led by Mr. Shorn B., a village bank president who was born in 1966. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in this current year. 

Mr. Shorn B. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. He is a teacher while his wife, Mrs. Phorlla Tuon, sells dry fish and sour cabbage in the local village to earn some income to support her family. Since his wife’s business is going well, he wants to expand. So, Mr. Shorn B. is applying for a loan to buy more dry fish to resell. 

He is the father of four children who are studying at school and also help in their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy more dry fish for resale

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pao M., aged 33, is the village bank president who has been selected by the six members of this group loan, located in Preaek Traeng village, Kandal province. Each member will use their portion to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes.
 
Mrs. Pao M. is a seamstress in a garment factory while her husband, Mr. Nara S., is a mushroom cultivator at home. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. To support her husband's business, Mrs. Pao M. will use the loan from AMK to buy mushroom cultivation supplies. 

This couple has two children who both attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy mushroom cultivation supplies to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Mrs. Ret Aeth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen people who have selected Mrs. Ret A., a village bank president who was born I. 1969. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to support their businesses located I. Tuol Trea village I. Takeo province.

Mrs. Ret A. is a famer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support herself. She is also a pig breeder. Since her breeding is going well, she wants buy more piglets. So, Mrs. Ret A. is applying for a loan to buy more piglets. With the rest of the loan she will purchase fertilizer and hire farm laborers to grow rice. She is a widow with two children who are both studying at school and also help I. her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn C. is from the village of Bacolod, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ginalyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Ginalyn has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3000 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

In 2010, Ginalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the 1st loan that Ginalyn has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Hermano Miguel (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Hermano Miguel está formado por 8 mujeres que son como una familia  unida que buscan  mejorar su economía y así salir adelante con sus familias. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad mas importante  del país, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía y una belleza natural.

La Señora Norma Beatriz vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9, 5 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en la escuela, su esposo es tapicero y posee su propio taller, la casa en la que habitan no es de su propiedad por lo que viven arrendando.
La Señora. Norma es maestra hace  4 años, pertenece al magisterio y labora medio día en una escuela, también se dedica a la venta de productos naturales  Forever.  Lleva 17 créditos trabajando con la banca comunal y nos comenta que los créditos son muy beneficiosos ya que tiene facilidad de pago, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en  más productos Forever.  Su  sueño es tener su casa propia.

La Señorita Marcia Teresa Carvinagua vive por el sector de la Orquídeas en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, estudia en la universidad  la carrera de Psicología educativa y va en su primer año, también ayuda a su mamá en un bar que poseen, es su primer crédito en la fundación y ha sido incentivada por su mamá a formar parte de este  grupo de mujeres luchadoras.
La Señorita Marcia tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera, vive en la casa de su hermana y depende económicamente de sus papás. El  crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en su matrícula y en la compra de productos para el bar, su  sueño es terminar su carrera.

NOTA FOTO: Las Señora que esta parada en la parte de atraz con un niño en brazos vestido de rojo, no perteneca a la banca, es pariente de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Hermano Miguel is made up of 8 women that are like a close knit family, all looking to improve their financial situations and to provide for their families. They live in the city of Cuenca. This is the third most important city in the country. It has a great variety of gastronomy and a natural beauty. Señora Norma Beatriz lives on the outskirts of Cuenca. She is 29 years old and married. She has 3 children, ages 11, 9 and 5. All of her children attend school. Her husband is an upholsterer and has his own workshop. They don't own their own house but live in a rented house. Señora Norma has been a teacher for 4 years and works half days in a school. She also sells Forever natural products. She has had 17 loans with the communal bank and she tells us that the loans have benefited her greatly since they have easy repayment plans. She will invest this loan in more Forever products. Her dream is to have her own house. Señorita Marcia Teresa Carvinagua lives near the Orquídeas neighborhood on the outskirts of Cuenca. Señorita Marcia is 20 years old and single. She lives in her sister's house and is economically dependent on her parents. She is studying educational psychology at the university. She is starting her first year. She also helps her mother in a bar they own. This is her first loan with the foundation. She was encouraged by her mother to join this group of hard-working women. She will use the loan from Fundación Espoir to pay her enrollment fees and to buy products for the bar. Her dream is to finish school. NOTE: The woman standing with the child in red in the back line of the photo is not a member of the bank. She is a parent of one of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Forever products, to pay school registration fees and buy food items

loans.name: Mrs. Sarath You Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eleven people based in Tonle village in Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. Sarath Y., aged 40, as their village bank president. They will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sarath Y. owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to earn a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bou TU. Kheng, is a soldier. He is also a farmer and owns a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family. Her problem is that her husband's field is infertile but she does not have enough money to address this. So, to improve production, Mrs. Sarath Y. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will hire farm laborers to grow rice. 

She is the mother of four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, two are enrolled in the local school and the youngest is one year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija, juntas residen en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola que posee un movimiento comercial moderado, se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros. Ella adquiere su mercadería en las ciudades de Chiclayo y Trujillo para ofrecerlas en venta a sus vecinos por pedidos. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia, por ello trata de mantenerlo de la mejor manera posible.

Sus esfuerzos diarios por conseguir un mayor número de clientes están teniendo resultados, ella desea adquirir una mayor cantidad de prendas para ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer su creciente demanda, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Esperanza es una mujer luchadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir adelante con su negocio y llegar a tener su propia tienda de ropa. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 46, is a single mother. She has a daughter and they live together in Cayaltí district, an agricultural zone with moderate commercial activity located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She sells women’s and men’s clothing. She gets her merchandise in the cities of Chiclayo and Trujillo to sell to her neighbors filling their previously-placed orders. The business is an important source of income for her family so she endeavors to manage it in the best possible way. Her daily efforts to secure a larger number of customers have been having results. She wants to buy a larger quantity of articles of clothing in order to increase sales and meet growing customer demand. But, she lacks necessary capital to do so. Therefore, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 700 new sol loan. Esperanza is a hard working, responsible woman. Her greatest wish is to continue making progress with her business and to someday have a clothing store. People who know her consider her to be trustworthy and calm.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing.

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consist of twenty-one people who have selected Mrs. Sitha E., aged 49, as their village bank loan president. They are based in Praek Ta Kaev village, Kandal province. The members of this village loan will each use it to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Sitha E. and her husband, Mr. Rorn Buoy, are farmers who own 1.20-hectares that they use to cultivate corn, peanuts and rice for a living. Mrs. Sitha E. will use the loan requested from AMK to buy food to support her family wH. they harvest rice on the farm. This couple works very hard to also support their four children: one is a government worker while the other three are students who also help their parents on the farm.

loans.use: to buy food to support the family when they harvest rice.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea A. is a married woman who lives in Ruiz Street, Brgy. Libacao, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a furniture-making business. Her husband Peter, who is 54 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have nine children who are aged between eight and 30. 

Andrea joined NWTF - Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF - Project Dungganon, Andrea has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use to pay for more stock of raw materials for making furniture so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Andrea is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To increase her stock of raw materials for making furniture

loans.name: Mr. Torn Uy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people from Ponley village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mr. Torn U., aged 60, has been selected by the other group members as the village bank president. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. He and his wife, Mrs. Thon Sao, are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. His problE. is that his rice field is infertile. So, to improve production, Mr. Torn U. is asking for a loan to bU. fertilizer. He is the father of three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the others are studying at school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato S. is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Alicia, Isabela. He is 50 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Renato owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Renato has been engaged in his business for over 18 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP every two months.

In 2010, Renato joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 1st loan that Renato has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rosa Angélica

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Angélica S. vive en el sector del Cebollar en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se levanta sobre la antigua ciudad inca de Tomebamba,  tiene un clima frió,  amenos paisajes del entorno, la abundancia de agua y la fama de sus habitantes por su habilidad de orfebres y ceramistas hacen de esta ciudad una de las más bellas del Ecuador.

Doña Rosa  tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos  todos  mayores de edad y casados que viven independientemente, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora como taxista con su propio vehículo, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad la cual han construido con el trabajo de los dos.

La Señora Rosa tiene una tienda, lleva 15 años con este negocio, su horario de trabajo es de 6 a.m. a 9 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de pollos, lleva 1 año con este negocio, los vende vivos en su tienda. Tiene 3 años trabajando con los créditos de la banca comunal y nos comenta que los créditos le han beneficiado mucho para seguir creciendo en su negocio, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para ampliar  su tienda, Su sueño es tener un mini mercado ya que hace falta en su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Angélica S. lives in the Cebollar sector in Cuenca’s outskirts. This city is built above the ancient Inca city of Tomebamba. Its climate is cold, has pleasant surroundings, an abundance of water and its residents are famous for their ceramic and silver crafts, all of which makes this city one of Ecuador’s most beautiful. Rosa , 55, is married and has 5 adult, married children who live independently. Her husband works as a taxi driver using his own car. The house they live in is their own and they have built it with their own efforts. Rosa has had a grocery store for 15 years. She is open for business from 6am until 9pm. She has also raised chickens for the past year to sell live in her store. She has been collaborating with loans from the communal bank for 3 years and she mentions that the loans have been of great use to her for her business’ growth. The new loan that FUNDACION ESPOIR will deliver will be used to buy stock items for her store. Her dream is to have a mini-mart because there isn’t one in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia R. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 37 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Emilia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Emilia has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP whenever she sells her raised animal.

In 2010, Emilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan that Emilia has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
